properties.description: MCAD’s location is a prime spot to enliven downtown and encourage others to do the same!   What is a key element in an enlivened downtown?  MUSIC!  ENTERTAINMENT!   We believe that street (or in our case sidewalk) music/entertainment is a key element missing in downtown Miami!  We plan to create regular music, spoken word, and poetry readings on the steps in front of our building—every Friday afternoon!  Built in 1912, the Old Post Office Building’s east façade is a perfect setting for outreach into the neighborhood.   New York, New Orleans, Seattle to name of few have wonderful live performers throughout their cities—it makes the experience of traveling through a city on foot special.  And we have a plethora of talented folks in Miami!
properties.title: LIVELY STEPS!
properties.details: Enjoy their walks.  Have a place to stop, sit and relax.  We envision regular programming on a weekly basis for the entertainment of downtowners—residents, commuters and tourists alike— to sit and listen.  We plan to partner with New World School of the Arts, Miami Dade College, BuskerFest, and the Arts & Business Council to give our fantastic local musicians and entertainers their best an opportunity to share their gifts with downtown.   We hope this will inspire other businesses to do the same and maybe even the City of Miami to create a program for buskers, such as the one in New Orleans or Seattle.  This grant would allow us to pay our entertainers!

properties.description: The innovative Miami Youth Garden, Inc. (MyG) is a nonprofit organization featuring a live, community garden classroom and a proven youth leadership development program called Seed to Harvest.  Church of the Open Door’s Youth Ministry created the garden, including an action plan and budget.  MyG is now a collaborative effort including The Collective Empowerment Group of South Florida (funded the garden through Wells Fargo and CitiBank community beautification grants), neighborhood volunteers and a grant from Joel Osteen Ministries.  We currently need funding for an irrigation system, wrought-iron fence, additional tools and equipment to expand the program and support teachers to impart the Seed to Harvest curriculum.
properties.title: Joel Osteen-supported Community Teaching Garden for Liberty City's Future Leaders
properties.details: Miami’s youth are the flowers of tomorrow – healthy plants we really need to grow.  MyG targets the underserved, sub-population within an at-risk community of Liberty City.  A Public Space Challenge grant will allow us to expand the promising program. Our goals include teaching age-appropriate leadership skills, deferred gratification and entrepreneurship; establishing a farmers’ market with healthy food choices for Liberty City residents and a built-in revenue stream to sustain programming; create employment and job training opportunities; and then replicate the program throughout Miami-Dade County.

properties.description: The M-Path along US1, between Vizcaya and Dadeland South stations is poorly lit and unsafe. GREENLIGHTS will illuminate that land with a civic art installation that lights up the columns of MetroRail. The installation will literally spotlight public transit, reminding the 100,000 drivers on US1 every day that MetroRail provides an alternative to driving.  It will also promote the future vision of the GreenLink, the grassroots initiative to transform the M-Path into a world-class mobility corridor (walking/biking/exercise path) and linear park (www.thegreenlink.org).   Our rendering is from UM Arch. School's vision plan of the GreenLink proposing new standards for the path: to light, widen, straighten, and add much-needed amenities.
properties.title: GREENLIGHTS a 1-month rotating civic art lighting installation underneath MetroRail
properties.details: Here’s how GREENLIGHTS works:  Each month, a spotlight installation designed by a local artist will uplight a series of 3 sets of MetroRail columns, spanning 300 feet.  Then, each month, the installation moves to a different section of the 8-mile stretch, strategically positioned for the most community impact.  Over a 12-month period, the low cost, high impact, installation will connect to millions of drivers and residents. This year-long installation will open our eyes to “what could be” — reclaiming the underutilized land under MetroRail and turning it into a bright community asset.

properties.description: Downtown is an exciting place – but sometimes you just need a break from the grind.  What if you could go to a place, leave the stress of work, take a break from the noise and escape to a park like no other? Introducing Sound Garden. From sunrise to sunset, CBD professionals, residents and tourists can come together and enjoy this outdoor music lounge. Surrounded by tall tropical foliage, Sound Garden endeavors to transform a portion of Bayfront Park into an audio oasis that will invigorate cultural engagement and civic life. Through a hidden solar audio system, a weekly variety of instrumental music will seamlessly fill the listening area. For now it only exists in our mind…but wouldn't it be cool to bring it to life? With your vote it can
properties.title: Sound Garden @ Bayfront: A Refreshing Audio Experience
properties.details: Visitors can comfortably lounge, take a break from the office, get inspired to work, meet friends, learn about new music, read, connect with the outdoors and plug in to the community. The musical program will highlight our cultural diversity and feature instrumental: Ambient, Bossa Nova, Classical, Flamenco, Jazz, Lounge and World music. Sound Garden will have a space for special acoustic performances, and will also house a small lending library where book swapping can take place. This audio oasis can serve as a sightseeing attraction or a hidden gem for locals. We would like to partner with Urban Impact Lab to provide shade with its colorful umbrella installation and the DDA, City of Miami and Bayfront Park, to implement the project.

properties.description: Create mini “play kits” for a community with limited access to parks and recreational areas.  Kits would include inexpensive equipment for group activities (such as badminton, jump rope, football, and chalk for hopscotch); arts and crafts materials, and detailed steps to deal with permitting, street closures, agreements for using parking lots and other underutilized spaces as play areas.
properties.title: Play Kits or Park in a Box
properties.details: This project would increase recreational opportunities and promote physical activity.  I would also assist residents in navigating city processes and provide a springboard for seeking permanent play spaces. The kits would be piloted in the West Perinne community but can be easily replicated in other communities.

properties.description: Skate Free would like to develop the defunct and under used spaced under the I-95 free way at the MPA Lot 11. We would like to create a 40,000 sq. ft mix use skate plaza and green space that offers a useful urban environment promoting physical activity, gathering of families/friends, and community connectivity. Skateboarders and families in Downtown Miami are underserved with public space to play and enjoy. Skate free would like to transform an otherwise neglected piece of land that serves only parking and transform this space into a 50/50 green space and concrete skate plaza that includes a 200 sq. ft sculpture garden, 1000 sq. ft dog park,  2000 sq. ft play ground,  16,800 sq. ft of green space, and a 20,000 sq. ft skatepark.
properties.title: Lot 11 Green Space Skate Plaza
properties.details: This space sits at the convergence of three Miami neighborhoods including Park West, Overtown and Miami River. This Project will allow kids and their parents to have a safe and shaded place to skateboard, play, have picnics or outings, walk their dogs and enjoy the sculpture of local miami artists. The plaza serves the community directly by being locate within a quarter mile of the Government Center Metro Rail, Mover and Bus station and it is accessible from the I-95 North 2nd AVE Exit and the I-95 South NW 8th ST Exit with available parking at MPA lot 12 and 13. People will be able to safely monitor their kids while they are playing out doors and exercising while being under the shade of the I-95 Overpass. This park will be free and public

properties.description: is to create the first truly handicapped accessible beach.  Miami-Dade County touts its beaches, saying that people with disabilities are welcome. In truth, some beaches have wheelchair mats, but they end far short of the main beach area.  We are proposing to create the first fully accessible beach to be located on 76th Street in Miami Beach. A wheelchair mat would extend further into the sand, configured to create a patio landing.  We would purchase special assistive beach chairs and aquatic equipment including adaptive kayaks, wave skis, and flotation devices. The project organizer is the Sabrina Cohen Foundation, a non-profit dedicated to providing a better quality of life for people living with paralysis.
properties.title: Beach for ALL
properties.details: fully enjoy the physical, recreational and spiritual benefits of the beach, including the disabled. This fully accessible beach area would enable disabled people to get onto the sand. People in wheelchairs could hang out in the patio area with their friends, bask under umbrella-topped assistive device beach chairs, roll along the shoreline, and enjoy the spray of the waves. Those with assistance could use the specialized aquatic equipment. Such a beach would foster friendships between able-bodied and disabled people, promote tourism, and serve as a model for other county beaches. This accessible beach could be a stand-alone project or could be part of an adaptive gym project that SCF is discussing with the City of Miami Beach.

properties.details: This neighborhood has a highly utilized public library that attracts customers of all age levels and interests. With the Wi-Fi, users can sit in the "park" and still have access to online resources while the facility is closed. Programmatically, outdoor theater, yoga and tai-chi can become  regularly scheduled events.

properties.submitter_name: Macias Advertising / Walk Landscape and Urban Design
properties.description: Bringing back the old school Hot Wheels Monday night roller skate funk and taking it to downtown’s Pepper Fountain at Bayfront Park!  Every second Monday night of the month, Bay Skate Mondays will transform downtown’s CBD into a community gathering space that celebrates a Miami pastime which brings together different cultures, ages and favorite freestyle moves.  With the abundant seating, smooth surface and bay views, Pepper Fountain is the perfect venue for a unique social experiment. We will introduce Bay Skate Mondays by inviting the original Hot Wheels DJ Irie, and complete the experience with everything from skate rentals and shoe valet to food trucks and first aid stations.
properties.title: Bay Skate Mondays
properties.details: Bay Skate Mondays is a great excuse for the community to come together and have fun! By activating this underutilized portion of Bayfront Park, we’ll emphasize the city’s iconic water feature and bay front views. We will bring people to the park at night and to the downtown area to patronize local businesses and restaurants.  By giving residents access to a roller rink, we’ll encourage them to become active and live more healthy social lifestyles.

properties.description: Plant and maintain 10 gardens on swales at strategic corners throughout La Paloma, a culturally-mixed neighborhood in northern, unincorporated Miami-Dade. Each garden will cultivate flowers, fruits, and vegetables, and will surround a trash can, a recyling bin, and a compost bin. Soaring over the garden, in lieu of a scarecrow, will be a sculpture of a dove created by neighborhood youth in collaboration with local artists.
properties.title: La Paloma Garden Walk
properties.details: The La Paloma Garden Walk would promote health and community in the La Paloma neighborhood. In a neighborhood without a public park, the garden walk will inspire residents to get out of the house and explore, activating the sidewalks as public and recreational space. Designated families on each block would maintain the gardens, in collaboration with their neighbors. The caretakers would also manage the trash, recycling, and compost bins, keeping trash off the streets and enriching the soil. The vegetable and fruits would be shared by all, whether casually picked by passersby or harvested by the community. The doves would stand as a symbol of neighborhood pride.

comments.comment: Quite a vision -- of healthy living, environmental preservation, and aesthetic delight!

properties.description: West Kendall Baptist Hospital (WKBH) wants to foster a sense of place and create a gathering spot for residents to enjoy cultural and recreational activities.  The hospital's park-like grounds currently contain a walking trail and several small lakes. With additional funding, the hospital plans to develop a “Fitness Zone,” install lighting to improve safety and encourage use of the site,  construct a permanent stage for community events including live entertainment, and seek a park designation. Public Space Challenge funds would support the fitness trail, which will be designed to appeal to the elderly, accommodate cyclists and runners, and promote a more comprehensive fitness experience for walkers.
properties.title: Living Healthy in West Kendall: Connecting, Inspiring, Changing Lives
properties.details:
As a community hub, the hospital's planned park would inspire people to incorporate exercise into their daily routine; help connect them to their neighbors and to resources that can prevent heart disease, obesity and other ailments; and change lives to be healthier, happier and longer.

Since the hospital's opening, West Kendall residents have used the grounds and beautiful paths around the lakes for their daily exercise, to bring their elderly family members outdoors for fresh air or to take their babies for a stroll around the gardens. The proximity of schools and residences makes WKBH an ideal location to gather and connect with neighbors, a critical element in creating a sense of community.

WKBH loves this community, and yes we care for you when your sick, but we would much rather help you and keep you healthy.  Living healthy in West Kendall is what we want to help everyone become.
God Bless!
West Kendall  residents really need a place where they can exercise outside and enjoy the outdoor spaces. What a wonderful idea!
This is a perfect way to get people a little more connected with nature with the added benefit of fitness! Free gym with great scenery. Awesome idea!
Thank you West Kendall Baptist Hospital for keeping your community healthy and safe.
As a resident behind the hospital I can't wait for the fitness course to come as well as the lighting. Thank you West Kendall Baptist for helping to better our community.

This would be a great added benefit to the residents of West Kendall. Not only is the hospital there for their time of need due to illness they are there proactively to encourage health and well-being. I can't wait for my parents to take full advantage of the fitness course. Great job West Kendall Baptist!
This is a wonderful idea for the West Kendall community to have a place to exercise and get outdoors and enjoy the fresh air!!
A gazebo for yoga. A loop that is exactly one mile for running and walking.
This growing community deserves many easy-to-access areas to play and exercise. This is a beautiful, pleasant area to do so.
This is an excellent idea for families living in the community of West Kendall!
It's a fantastic idea, the grounds are ideal, not only for a fitness course and community gathering spot, but to become art filled and park like. Go West Kendall Baptist Hospital.
A wonderful proposal to inspire and promote a healthier lifestyle for our West Kendall residents.
The only thing that would make this better is a few racquet ball courts!

The West Kendall community is ready and asking for a healthy community.  Having an outdoor fitness zone anchored in a beautiful setting would certainly draw community residents and inspire them towards a healthier lifestyle.

This would help establish a vibrant community space that is desperately needed in West Kendall.  Due to congestion and sprawl, West Kendall residents often feel isolated and lack options for leisure and recreation activities.  This proposal would  do a great service to the community!
Beautiful! West Kendall is growing rapidly and our community needs public spaces like the one proposed. This is a great idea  for a private-public partnership!
Finally a reason to drive West for a sense of community and cultural enrichment. Hope you will have outdoor music concerts and activities for kids! Gracias!
More than a hospital, a community destination! Thank you for offering to continue to improve the health and well being of West Kendall residents!
Wonderful, fresh and welcomed idea for the West Kendall Community!

properties.description: Add low-cost low tech signs along the trail that will let people know how long and how far a location destination is (ie. AD Barnes Park, 5 mi, 1200 ft).
properties.title: Ludlam Trail walking signs
properties.details: The Ludlam Trail is a 6.2 mile corridor runs through the heart of Miami-Dade County, and together with the M-Path and South Dade Trail, would form an uninterrupted regional trail network from Homestead to Downtown Miami to Flagami. It directly connects to 4 schools, 3 major regional parks, and dozens of neighborhoods, and will reach over 34,000 residents who live within ½ mile.  Making sure people know how to get there, and how far/ long it will take to get to key destinations is a great way to make the trail an amenity, while long term planning for the corridor continues.

comments.comment: You can event host local charity 5k runs, marathons, walks, in this area. The only issue would be the need for parking. Unless they can connect it to Dadeland North.

properties.description: When I visit our parks, I see a mess of bottles, cans, plastic bags—remnants of people enjoying parks just left there. But people aren’t all to blame. We haven’t made it easy.  There are NO recycling bins in our parks—the very places where people gather to have BBQs, where they bring bottles and cans by the car load  have no alternative but to throw them away in overfilled trash cans which easily blow over and into our waterways.  Additionally, for those conscientious enough to bring their own bottles, there are no purposefully designed refill stations as I have seen in airports and parks at major cities all over the world.   Let’s add recycle bins and water bottle refill stations to popular parks where people gather and exercise.
properties.title: Water Bottle Refill Stations and Recycling Bins in Parks
properties.details: Recycle their waste responsibly and cut down on single use plastics (especially plastic water bottles) by giving them an alternative to trash cans and an option to refill their drinking bottles from stations designed for that purpose. There are a variety of ways to design these so that they are fun (some recycle bins make music when you recycle) or have messages conveying the importance of recycling and reducing waste.  Stations can be designed as a water bottle refill and drinking fountain hybrid with counters that track impact by # plastic bottles saved. Both can be branded ( like the coca cola recycling bins on Lincoln road) or have space for advertising to help defray the costs and scale the project to cover more parks in the future.

comments.comment: 1 in every 4 plastic bottles is recycled, so this is a must to have to put an end to all those plastic bottles and caps that end floating on the shore...Good Luck Dara!
Should be a matching project with the Parks Department

This is a MUST! 
No more single-use bottles! 
Get rid of single-use trash!
Such a great idea!
Great idea. Keep people hydrated and less plastic. Hope we see it come to pass.
Fabulous Dara! You are great!
This would be awesome, I tried to always have my water bottle with me and ask people to fill it up so having stations around the city would be fabulous!
Great suggestion! I would also love to see this in Sound Garden @ Bayfront Park found on this map.

Such a great idea. There are no recycling bins where people are grilling and hanging out for the day. And why is there no public water source for bottles when it gets 95 degrees in the summer. This would make a significant difference that wouldn't be too difficult to achieve.
agree. this is desperately needed! Will help our community and environment tremendously
Yes Please!
This would be great - I would rather have more refills than have more bottles in landfills. Great thinking!

We really need to support public water and reduce bottle water which is an environmental menace. Consider only 1 in every 4 plastic bottles is recycled and all if the carbon dioxide to import it. Why do that when we have awesome Miami water?
Love Dara's commitment to the community! We need this. Other states have it and there's no reason why we shouldn't. :)

properties.description: is to set up a free library  on the metro rail platforms to promote literacy. The library would also provide more attractive seating and serve to improve the quality of public transit.
properties.title: Metro-Rail Transit Library
properties.details: have a more positive experience riding the metro rail.

properties.description: Create the Wynwood Community Market at the Bakehouse Art Complex, a 28 year old artist colony housing 60 artists’ studios on a 2.3 acre(100,188 sq.ft.) parcel located at NW 32nd Street & NW 6th Ave. The market will prominently feature South Florida farm-to-table produce; Wynwood- and Miami-produced craft foods and products; herbs, flowers and other plants; and products by local producers (such as Wynwood Brewing, Sprout Floral, Bunnie Cakes). Other activities of interest to the community will include free yoga, artist booths, crafts, performances, and activities and hands-on crafts for kids. The market will be held monthly on Second Saturday from noon-6pm for the first six months; moving to twice monthly on the second and fourth Saturdays.
properties.title: Wynwood Community Market at Bakehouse Art Complex
properties.details: The Wynwood Community Market will be conceived by and for the residents and businesses of Wynwood. If market visitors want cooking demonstrations, then we will work to find partner organizations that can provide this service. The market will celebrate and attract the diversity of Wynwood (different generations, cultures, socio/economic backgrounds). It will have a block-party feel, offering market goers a multitude of experiences both inside and around the grounds and surrounding areas of the BAC. The atmosphere will be both communities enriching and enriched (home-grown). The BAC wishes to create a place where neighbors can gather together and as an arts center we are already well-positioned to serve Wynwood in this capacity.

comments.comment: If this happens, I'll be there!

This would make an enormous contribution to life in our city while yielding wide-spread public benefits.  On top of it all, the Bakehouse Art Complex is a perfect space from which to host an extensive community market!  This would build both a physical and virtual forum for exchange while serving to strengthen a more cohesive spirit of community in Miami.  Brilliant.  Love it:)
The Bakehouse is ideally located to serve the community as a gathering place over all things made by hand - art, food, beverages, music, dance. It is just what we need!
This would be the perfect community gathering for Wynwood!

Excellent idea.  Not only will it support "Locally Produced" which was the cornerstone economic structure every city and town was based on... but it will help create a sense of community togetherness and pride to an area that could really use it.
perfect!
Excellent Idea!
Great concept for the space!
Sounds great. Hope it happens
This is a great place for the community and the Bakehouse Art Complex to come together. Looking forward to it!
Great idea! What a perfect location for the community and Wynwood area.
I think is a great idea. Finally we will have a a fresh market near by plus art

I love that this idea provides a much-needed platform and gathering place to bring together the disparate forces in the neighborhood of Wynwood - its artists, businesses, and residents - along with local artisans and farmers, to participate, share, create, and collaborate in a space already devoted to creativity.

I love this idea! How is it possible that a neighborhood as arts-focused as Wynwood does not already have a community market where people can go to find produce, new and used things, and just find out what the neighborhood is all about. I have visited the Bakehouse and I think their place is a perfect location for such a market.

properties.description:
The stair installation is proposed with the premise of promoting the use of the stair vs the escalator in our public transportation stations, such as the metro mover and metro rail.  This idea not only improves the design quality by using art, but also expresses an educational message to create awareness among our pedestrians of the health benefits of physical activity, even when just going up a few stairs.
This project will be organized by A.L.T. (Active Living Team) Non-profit organization with the support of local artists, architects and community organizers.
properties.title: The Public Stair Activation
properties.details: The project will help people become aware of the advantages of modifications in their physical activity patterns, and how utilizing the stair in their daily commute will help create large scale well being benefits throughout their life.  The project can be temporary, permanent or constantly interchanging installations to maintain the commuter engaged and excited about making the stairs a permanent part of their routine and life style.

properties.description: The Miami Short Film Festival (MsFF), South Florida’s only short film festival, will stage Guerilla Shorts, surprise public screenings of innovative short films in unexpected locations across Miami Dade. Imagine encountering a short film projected in a train station during rush hour, at a food truck roundup, or next to a busy basketball court in a public park at dusk. The selected films’ content will correspond with each particular location, bringing meaningful short form cinema to South Florida residents where they live, work and play. Guerilla Shorts events will be a free and completely unexpected way for MsFF to bring new cinema to the masses.
properties.title: GUERILLA SHORTS
properties.details: Films can help people share with each other and understand  the similarities that they have. Cinema can be the "glue" that keeps society together by showing people that the citizens of the world have similar morals, values and beliefs.

comments.comment: I like this

properties.description: The Vizcaya Village, an important part of Vizcaya’s and Miami’s history, has been inaccessible to the public for nearly 100 years.  Vizcaya Museum and Gardens is finalizing plans to restore and revitalize this space as an educational and recreational resource for enjoyment by the local community.  Situated between South Miami Avenue and US-1, the Village was where James Deering cultivated and sold crops, raised livestock, and housed staff. The project aims to re-establish a greenscape in the Village as a new public space with recreational and urban agricultural initiatives, linking to bicycle and pedestrian programs, following the departure of the science museum.
properties.title: Repositioning Vizcaya through New Public Space, Recreational and Urban Agriculture Initiatives
properties.details: Vizcaya seeks to convert a substantial portion of the massive parking lot on the Vizcaya Village property into a beautiful, historically evocative and publicly accessible green space that will re-establish its vibrant horticultural and agricultural past. New programs will transform perception and experience of Vizcaya, including hands-on community gardening, cultivation and use of flowers and food crops, and educational workshops on agriculture and the environment. The community, including walkers and bicyclists, will be invited to enjoy this green space to relax and experience nature. Visitors will also gain insight into the social history of Vizcaya—its people, technologies, and labor—currently unavailable in the main house and gardens.

comments.comment: This is a wonderful idea, the location is ideal and so many people in our community would benefit!

properties.description: There are approximately 5 miles between Southwest 8th Street and Dadeland Mall between 69th and 71st Avenue that was a former railroad line that has long been derelict. Instead of this neglected space continuing to gather weeds and debris why not convert this space into a landscaped linear park with a bicycle/pedestrian path with native plantings along the trail, benches, lighting and possible water features. As time progresses and more funding becomes available different programmable aspects can be incorporated such as work out machines, basketball court, bocce court, etc.
properties.title: West Miami Greenway
properties.details: The linear park will help improve the urban core by creating connectivity between neighborhoods as well as increase the amount of open green spaces and a wildlife corridor. Creating this space will become a catalyst for health improvement and recreation for local citizens.

comments.comment: Victor, are you aware of Friends of the Ludlam Trail? Check out the following site when you have a chance... http://ludlamtrail.org

properties.description: is to adopt the practice of “cyclovia,” a Spanish term for "cycleway," through the closing of certain streets to automobiles for cyclists and pedestrians, modeled after Bogotá, Colombia’s weekly closures of main streets to cars as a response to congestion and pollution. Runners, skaters, and bicyclists took back the streets, with stages set up in city parks, fitness instructors, yoga teachers and musicians leading people through various performances, all free to the public. The Town of Miami Lakes is an ideal location, with opportunities to tour its 101 parks under the protection of a lush, shady tree canopy.
properties.title: CycloMiamiLakes
properties.details: enjoy livable streets and community as well as cycling and walking. CycloMiamiLakes will make the streets safe for people to walk, skate, play and ride a bike. There are activities along the route. Shop owners and restaurants are encouraged to open their doors to people along the route. In northwest Miami-Dade County, streets are congested with traffic, children suffer from obesity and we lack safe, healthy transportation options.

comments.comment: More information is necessary. How often would these closures occur? Which streets would be shut down? What are the costs of an event like this? This sounds like a fun annual or semi-annual event, but I see it getting old fast, especially if it occurs during peak traffic hours or on main streets.

This is a great idea to incentive healthy habits in a city that depends heavily on cars. Also, it is good opportunity for local businesses to provide sponsorship or sell their products on the route such as snacks, fruits or even bike repairs.

This is what sustainable communities are all about!!! 
I have great memories of participating at the Ciclovia in Medellin, Colombia as a kid. Me and my family used to attend every Sunday, it was the perfect event to socialize, advertise, spend time with your family and exercise, all at the same time!
I remember this as being my favorite activity as a little kid. I really hope this can be implemented in our community.

Definitely a superb opportunity! Miami Lakes is a great town with lots of under-appreciated hidden green areas that can only be discovered on bike. Plus, the beautiful tree canopy covering the majority of the town provides refreshing shade for bikers! I can't think of a better way to bring the community together while also promoting healthier living.

This is a great idea! Offering the community a space where they can interact with each other while improving their health is something innovative. Not only the general public will benefit from it but small businesses can take advantage as well by increasing their exposure.

properties.description: I would love to see a mini-splash park in Liberty City. This land is currently empty and unused, and it would be great to bring a couple of elements of a water park to this neighborhood.  There is no local pool nearby, and the beach is hard to get to. It doesn’t need to be anything fancy – just some features that allow kids to play with water. I would be working with the Liberty City Collaborative and Miami Children’s Initiative to find additional grants for this project.
properties.title: Liberty City Mini-Splash Park
properties.details: The kids in my neighborhood have been dreaming of a place to cool off and play when it gets hot outside. Having a splash park in this neighborhood would get kids outside when it gets hot, stay active and let them play with each other in a positive way. Water is such a simple and natural way for kids to be kids, and I would love for the kids of Liberty City to benefit from such an experience.

comments.comment: Fun in the sun with physical exercise. What could be better for children and families.

Of course Emerging Parents will support this project and priority use if public properties. Children in Liberty city have more blighted spaces traded back and forth . A few years ago a park was promised and a new development came about. Soon the cries of the children were forgotten and their dry hot days are thirsty for a refresher of hope. As I walk though I talk to them about the park they can play in and the waterfront park behind the airport that was built instead. I wholehearted believe the unity will prevail with local parents leaders and youth if they knew we are helping them lead this project. I support it whole hearted lay as a organizer resident and AUNTY . Feeling kind of flushed lol and ready slide weeeee!!!!
Like this idea.  Cooling off in a playful and social way is good for the body and spirit. Supervised by parents of course.

A wonderful idea that can bring together community members, promotes outside activity in a really fun manner, has specifically been requested by Liberty City children and families, and can be used year-round - perfect!
I love, love, love this idea!  The children in Liberty City would love it and they keep asking for it.  Please vote for something this important and meaningful in Liberty City!
It will give kids who might not have the opportunity to go to these parks to experience a fun thing to do.
I think the children would love this. Some zoos offer splash fountains. The only problem is the liability in case of falls, and the cost of the water

properties.description:
This spot has been a park on planning maps for a very long time.  It was nothing but an empty field that attracted illegal dumping and other un-neighborly behavior.

Two years ago, Channel 10 adopted this little park and has been working with the County and the neighborhood to find people and companies willing to donate time and material to make it a real park.  This will be a great little recreational space the neighbors will be proud of - but it has been slow going.  The Public Space Challenge would help build the playground and benches for parents to sit and make it a truly wonderful amenity for the neighborhood.
properties.title: Gratigny Plateau Park - help complete the park with playground and benches
properties.details: Turn an abandoned lot into a passive park with a walking path, exercise equipment, a playground, a butterfly garden, and shady trees.  A little urban oasis in a working-class neighborhood that has no easy access to parks.

properties.description:
Downtown Homestead is a quintessential Florida main street with an underused center space.  To preserve its charm, but move the space forward, this idea is to share the existing  outdoor Miami Beach simulcast of the New World Symphony  with the residents of Homestead, Florida City and the Florida Keys. 
The projections could easily be on the exterior wall of the old Seminole theater. A free Symphony concert with images of both Miami Beach and Homestead exchanged with each other creates a technological synergy of community. The events would energize both places at the same time while creating the first countywide Symphony concert.
properties.title: Community Connect Concert Series:  Link Symphony Outdoor Miami Beach WallCast to Homestead
properties.details: Technology is amazing in its ability bring the arts into communities. The idea is to fuse two unique places in Miami together for a celebration of artistry and community through the use of simulcast. The transformation of outdoor spaces by public utilization is the best  way to enliven an area.  The mixing of the film media with the concert and public event also creates multiple motivations for residents to attend and enjoy.

comments.comment: Very cool idea!  Great point about preserving it charm while moving it forward.

properties.submitter_name: Studio Roberto Rovira / FIU Landscape Architecture
properties.description: Unfriendly, inhospitable and unsafe, could easily describe the NW 12th Ave. stretch of Liberty City where an infamous segregation wall once separated blacks from whites. This broad corridor that runs for nearly 10 blocks is remarkable for its lack of public amenities, despite its proximity to Liberty Square and to Holmes Elementary & Miami Northwestern H. S. Despite great strides that have recently propelled MNWHS from an “F” to an “A” school, the quality of public spaces surrounding it have remained woefully inadequate. This project builds on the efforts to transform 12th Ave. into a Historic Linear Park by adding a series of colorful & iconic shade structures & crosswalks to change the perception of a place to avoid into a place to be.
properties.title: Liberty Shade Stops
properties.details: Have a shaded, colorful, and welcoming, pedestrian-friendly place to proudly call their own and reverse the long history of neglect that has resulted in a landscape to be avoided at all costs.

comments.comment: This is a beautiful idea..these would be great around Miami. Fun in the sun! Go check out my project submission. http://ideas.ourmiami.org/place/169952
Fantastic idea!

properties.description: is to implement a demonstration project that allows residents to engage and reimagine an urban public space by combining recreational amenities, art, technology and sustainability into a vibrant transit-oriented green space. The Brickell Station Promenade Demonstration Project would be the catalyst for a larger vision to enhance the M-Path, a 10-mile paved multi-use trail beneath the Metrorail guideway.  Funding at the $25K level would be used to solicit input and build consensus amongst prospective stakeholders and facilitate partnerships to create a uniquely-Miami public space that promotes health and wellbeing, social interaction, transportation efficiencies and increased economic benefits for residents and businesses.
properties.title: Brickell Station Promenade Demonstration Project
properties.details: be engaged in the transformation of the Brickell area and understand how parks can be catalysts for greener, healthier, more economically vibrant communities;  enjoy amenities that densely-populated areas currently lack; cherish a sense of place providing opportunities for renewed civic engagement; and realize economic development opportunities through the prism of parks.

comments.comment: Why not just take the $25K and put out tables and chairs in the existing plaza and green space?  Just do something simple and make adjustments as needed.  Don't talk, do.

properties.description:
There is a great and highly used bicycle path which runs around the Miccosukee golf course in Kendale Lakes. Directly on the path is underused West Kendale Lakes Park. I thought this would be a great place to create a biking hub of sorts for the many riders who already use the path; as well as a fantastic way to get new people in the neighborhood active and using both the park and the path. 

The park has a small bike rack, but would greatly benefit from more bike racks, as well as a water bottle refill fountain, bike air pump, bike repair stand, and a bike share system.
properties.title: Kendale Lakes Bicycle Hub
properties.details:
The creation of this biking hub would promote a healthier and more active lifestyle among residents in the area, as well as provide a safe space for families to spend time together and get active. It would also provide a place for the many residents who are already using the bike path to make small repairs and upkeep on their bicycles, as well as making it easier for them and their families to enjoy the park before and after their rides. 

West Kendale Lakes Park is in an underserved area of Unincorporated Miami-Dade and this project would take advantage of an already existing park and bike lane, and turn it into something special and truly beneficial for the neighborhood.

properties.description: is to retrofit a pontoon boat as a floating mini park at the mouth of the Miami River with a hyper realistic, tropical design by Miami artist Cristina Lei Rodriguez. Our goal is to improve urban mobility options in Downtown Miami by shuttling both commuters and tourists across the mouth of the Miami River.
properties.title: Ferry Garden
properties.details: take full advantage of Downtown Miami’s waterfront by providing them with both a car-free and immediate crossing between Downtown and Brickell. The floating park will ferry passengers back and forth from a berth on the Miami Riverwalk behind One Miami, to a berth at Brickell Point Park by the Miami Circle.

comments.comment: I love this idea. The waterfront along the river needs to be beautified and used as has been done in Chicago. I live in Brickell and would prefer to walk to downtown if it could be done safely and in nature enhanced surroundings. Cheers!

http://cristinaleirodriguez.com/Sculpture-Outdoors
Check out what our "Ferry Garden" would look like :)

properties.description: SFSN would like to convert an open space into a tented hub with wireless access to the future entrepreneurs of the Little Havana community. The Tent will be equipped with foldable tables and chairs, and provide free wireless, along with a "weekly event black board." There will also be secure internet connection, and a storage box. The purpose of the project is to promote entrepreneurship among young professionals in the community. The tented startup will be a educational, networking and brainstorming hub, and will provide space for presentations to get the technology startups off the ground.
properties.title: Outdoor Startup Hub
properties.details: Miami is becoming an open door to technology startups with the influence of the Latin American community. With the open space hub, we plan to provide a free gathering space for like minded young professionals to get bring their startup dreams into reality. Startup hub will provide the community with a free wifi place to gather, grow their ideas, and meet like-minded individuals. The hub will also set up presentations for startups to pitch their ideas, showcase their work, market their business and apply for funding.

comments.comment: Hey baby!, as I said it's a great idea, better if provided free daycare!! Jeje. But a playground, this way Sandor let me socialize!!!  Seriously, Nay, add the playground , I'm making my own contribution.
Oh yes, I love it! Make it happen
For sure that is a great opportunity that should not be missed in order to feed the important tech developments that will take place in Miami!
I'm a startup that would be interested in joining a program like this, it would be a great opportunity!!!!
Love the idea!!!
Excellent contribution!
Yeah! I hope to see this happen. What a great idea.
Great Idea, would be a fun concept for little Havana
This idea is great news for the startup community in south florida.  I am involved with a few tech companies that would eat this up.

properties.description: Landscape and plant palms and shade trees at the green space surrounding the Toussaint L'Ouverture statue, which sits at the entrance of Little Haiti at 62nd Street. The project would bring together children from the nearby Toussaint L'Ouverture Elementary School to help beautiful the green space, while learning about its significance in Haitian History and the neighborhood.
properties.title: Renewing Little Haiti's "Pride" Park
properties.details: The beautification at the Toussaint L'Ouverture statue site would upgrade the small park and a main entrance to the community, while giving residents in this predominantly Haitian neighborhood a renewed sense of pride. The project would provide a unique learning experience for children of all backgrounds, who after taking part in the project will have a sense of community ownership and involvement. The experience will benefit them for years to come. Providing shade trees near existing benches and tables at the park will allow local residents to enjoy the area and cultivate a communal atmosphere, which is part of the community's tradition.

properties.description: is to make a bicycle- and pedestrian- friendly path across the Julia Tuttle Causeway (just like on the  Rickenbacker Causeway).  There is currently an existing paved path along the south shore of the causeway on the Miami Beach side.  Continue the path near the shore heading west on the other islands of the causeway  (to keep away from traffic), and go over the bridges on a shoulder path separated from traffic by a concrete barrier.
properties.title: Julia Tuttle bikeway and connector
properties.details: have a safe and beautiful place to ride, increase use of our public green space, and advance the bike master plan by connecting different parts of the community.

comments.comment: Yeah!
This is direly needed.

properties.description: In this location, a parcel of land was created through the closure of SW 50th Street in South Miami.  Many walkers and joggers use this closed street as a pleasant cut through utilizing a remaining and intact sidewalk.  However, this space could be a great asset to the surrounding neighborhood with a few minor improvements.  The addition of some outdoor seating, a climbable sculpture, and signage could transform this former street into a small occupiable park  - in a neighborhood with very few parks.
properties.title: SW 50th Street Pocket Park
properties.details: Have a pleasant place to sit or play.

comments.comment: This is terrific!

properties.description:
Bayfront Books is pop-up library that will take place once a month, for six months at the site of the original M.D. library on Bayfront Park. The project will divide the park into 5 areas: 

1) Library area: With comfy chairs, tables, & book/magazines for people read.  
2) Theater Area: Bayfront Park has the Tina Hills Pavilion right there! We could perform Shakespeare...in the park, tell kid stories, and hold lectures throughout the day.  
3) Coffee/Food Area 
4) Information Area: Get information about the library system and other causes. Register for a library card & learn how to support the libraries!
5) Kid's Area: Puppets! Facepaint! Story-Time!

We would also bring a mobile wifi signal to the park.
properties.title: Bayfront Books
properties.details: Bayfront Books is first and foremost an effort to give the public more information about the Miami-Dade Library System. People need to know how budget cuts are threatening the libraries, and need to be shown just how amazing a resource a library is to a community.  This project will showcase everything a library can be on a micro scale. By creating a public space that fosters learning (both individually at the Library Area or in groups at Theater Area), entertainment, advocacy, and self-exploration we can, hopefully, show people that a library is much more than a repository of old books; its a cultural meeting center for the whole community.

comments.comment: This is an outstanding idea, with multiple benefits to the community.
Love it.  Do you need  books?
THANK YOU!  GREAT IDEA!!   Libraries are indeed about services and information. Remember also to inform the public of how our mayor wants to kill them off.

properties.description:
Let's set up temporary street trees on one street in Miami Beach between the parking spaces. Currently the City does not plan to have street trees on any of the east-west streets. Detailed plans prepared for the City and ready for construction lack this improvement. Let's show residents and local officials how great it would be. Streets should be safe, comfortable and interesting to pedestrians and in Miami that means lots of shade. 

If there is enough funding let's actually install trees on one east-west street. Between ten and twenty trees is all we'd need to line both sides of the block.
properties.title: Street Trees for Miami Beach's East-West Streets
properties.details:
Walk Miami Beach. 

Miami Beach has a great street network, walkable block sizes, a mix of uses, a mix of residential unit types but tiny, unshaded side walks on its east-west streets and the City has no plan to improve the situation. 

The treatment we're proposing has already been built on Espaniola Way: tree boxes between parking spaces. Physically it is possible. 

We need to find a way to install many more trees throughout the City.  Let's challenge the idea that trees need perfect conditions. Let's give the trees as much space as we can, they won't complain. Miami Beach is the perfect place to raise the standard of street design until street trees are the default.

properties.description: We want to build Disc Golf courses in our County and City Parks. This will be an economic investment with a great ROI that will offer people of any age, health and skill level a chance to play the sport for almost free. Just need a disc to play and you are playing a sport alone or with your friends and family. The sport has been in the Miami for about 30 years now. Disc Golf has grown in popularity and is now one of the fastest growing sports in the world. As an example: Charlotte, N.C. just had their Worlds Championship there 2 years ago and they have over 30 courses in a 30 miles radius for anyone to play. Finland a small Scandinavian country installed 60 courses just last year alone. Bring Disc Golf to our parks so more families can play together. Families that play together stay together.
properties.title: Disc Golf courses for open spaces in public parks- health/entertainment/recreation and tourism
properties.details:

I have a senior that is 104 years old learning to play, so any age can play. The TEEBOXX- is an Automated Retail Center. This TEEBOXX will give the parks a revenue center for their ROI. Please go to: www.teeboxx.com 

In Miami we have been teaching these organizations to show our commitment to growing the sport: Miami Dade Special Olympics, Seniors at Leon Medical Center, ECO Adventures summer school programs, Public schools, Private schools, Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts, Chamber of Commerce South to name a few. We have even organized events with the Miami Dade County Parks.

properties.description:
The wall of a mechanical room for the Metro Rail could double as the site for a living art wall.  This site could host temporary or seasonal artistic installations.  For instance, maybe the first artwork could be a thoughtfully laid out series of bottles with fresh herbs growing in them.  

Next, maybe an artist wants to graft a sculpture to the wall; they could utilize some of the existing plants from the first artist in their sculpture.  There could even be a constant theme maintained by all participating artists that there has to be a living (vegetation) component to each of their works.
properties.title: Living Wall Art
properties.details:
The purpose of the living wall art site would be to allow an undesirable space to grow into a place where people experience beautiful local art and become attached to a place on the M-PATH.  

By allowing a small space to become an area that provokes thought, catalyzes discussion and leaves a lasting impression on those that experience it, this small installation on the M-PATH has the ability to foster an intrinsic connection between the users and their environment.

comments.comment: love this idea!

properties.description: After having visited Phoenix, Arizona where orange trees are common trees you see as you drive along public areas; or after visiting Israel where fig trees are also common along public areas and anyone is allowed to pick the fruit, I think native fruit trees, like the Florida orange, grapefruit, sapote, and other trees, should also be planted along road medians, rights-of-way, and public streets.  These trees will not only provide much-needed shading, tree canopy and beauty to South Florida, but will also be a source of food for anyone to access, including the homeless.
properties.title: Native fruit & citrus trees along medians and public right-of-ways
properties.details: So that people could have access to healthy food sources.

properties.description:
We have located a vacant site in Little Havana that we could potentially use as a community garden. 

Approximately half of it would be used for growing fruit trees and edible perennials (6 papaya, 3 banana, 2 passionfruit, 1 mango, 1 avocado, 1 starfruit, 1 mulberry, 1 guava, a sweet potato/boniato area and a yuca area). The other half would be used for raised bed gardening which focuses on annual vegetables and herbs. In addition, we will be installing a chain-link fence around the site (doubling as trellis), a composting area, tool shed, and a table under a canopy which could be used for classes and having meals.  We will also be installing an automated irrigation system for the garden.
properties.title: Little Havana Community Garden
properties.details:
Have more exposure to the process of growing organic fruits vegetables and herbs. Students will be brought to the site for educational and hands-on gardening field trips where they will get to taste produce that is grown as locally as possible.  Community members will be involved on a regular schedule and receive produce in exchange for helping take care of the garden.

The benefits of community gardens are many, including: 

- Educating others on how to grow food and eat healthy
- Gardening is therapeutic, social, and fosters teamwork and community
- Saving money on otherwise costly organic produce
- Beautifying a public space
- A great way to exercise
- Serving as models for future community gardens

comments.comment: Dylan, this is amazing work! Keep it growing!
I love the idea of continued beautification of Little Havana surroundings, and especially with an eco -friendly project.  Very inspiring even for meditation activities and the appreciation of nature
Also wanted to mention that this would be a partnership between Rescue Earth ( rescueearth.org ) and Ready-to-Grow Gardens ( ready-to-grow.com )

properties.description: Building on the successful partnership between Buskerfest Miami and the 2013 Public Space Challenge winners Fresh Start Farmer’s Market, we seek to augment  2014 Public Space Challenge winners by providing supplemental street performers for their respective initiatives and events. We will work with interested Public Space Challenge winners to curate suitable artistic offerings in the form of “pop-up” performances during their projects. We will continue to expand our network of local artists by recruiting street performers from communities and neighborhoods directly linked to the public spaces being activated by the challenge. Through this effort, we will bring street performance not to just one public space, but to many areas of Miami-Dade.
properties.title: Our Miami Amplified!
properties.details: Through partnership with other Public Space Challenge winners, we will jointly offer a platform for local musicians, dancers, acrobats and actors to showcase their work and we will connect a wide cross-section of the citizens of Miami with its burgeoning artistic community. These “pop-up” performances will have the added effect of increasing awareness of and promoting advocacy for street performance in Miami, which will continue to activate these public spaces in the future. Street performance in public spaces provides a spontaneous and yet, more intimate artistic experience for community members than traditional venues offer.

properties.description: The proposal is to utilize the public plaza facing the New World Symphony Building and create a Recycled Fashion Show and a recycling fair. It is a competition that invites students to create and model their recycled outfits to compete for scholarship prizes. The outfits must display high quality of craftsmanship, unique material usage, innovation in design, and they must be fully wearable. Aside from the fashion show, the space itself is transformed architecturally through the planning of every detail, from seating arrangement to runway path. The fashion show becomes a non-conventional performance engaging the space and the public realm. All art installations and fashion runway are constructed solely from collected recycled materials.
properties.title:
Eco Couture Recyled Fashion Show
https://www.facebook.com/ecocouturefiu
properties.details:

properties.description: Take the somewhat vacant and under-appreciated FEC train tracks that run up the east coast of Miami and add a path to the side of them on the right of way. Rail With Trail is a safe way to utilize this unused space. It allows urban mobility for those who do not wish to drive a car or can not afford to do so. It creates a ladder of opportunity to connect some of the poorest neighborhoods in Miami with some of the densest employment centers, as well as connecting the proposed Coastal Link commuter rail stations to neighborhoods north or south of them. The greenway could be landscaped with native plants, wildflowers, and possibly shade trees depending on the amount of land available.
properties.title: FEC Bike/Pedestrian Greenway
properties.details: Imagine being able to ride your bicycle from El Portal to Downtown Miami in 20 minutes without all the broken glass, exhaust, potholes, and angry motorists—and with far fewer street crossings! This would be a huge benefit from anyone commuting downtown from the northeast by bicycle, or in the other direction, anyone wishing to go from a community along the M-Path to Wynwood, the Design District or Little Haiti, for example.

If not cost prohibitive, perhaps a few segments of the pathway could be sheltered with sails or something to provide temporary protection in the event of a heavy storm?  Please keep up the good work and let's make this a reality.

properties.description:
UPG Garden Centers on 6.5 acres will become epicenters of change in Miami!

They will provide the resources and know-how needed to grow food in the city, especially in food deserts. Low-income families living in apartments will each have their own 70 sq. ft. raised-bed organic Family Gardens. Food forests will allow access to fresh fruit and other produce in public areas. Composting will provide high quality soil and amendments. Nurseries will provide a flow of fruit trees, heirloom vegetables, and native species for projects.

The Neighborhood Transformation program will help homeowners, businesses and public spaces plant eatables and natives as landscaping.

UPG Volunteer Staff and Volunteers will do the majority of the site preparation, but eventually the families themselves will be responsible for their own gardens. Outcomes include organic food for better nutrition, exercise from gardening, cost savings for fiscal sustainability, and protecting Miami from Sea-Level Rise (SLR) through reduction of pollution caused by chemical farming and long-range transportation. Natives will provide food and habitat to wildlife. As the Garden Centers grow we plan to offer Family Gardens to 500 families (35,000 sq. ft. total). Nurseries will expand to at least 20,000 sq. ft., including a large shade house. Fruit trees will capture carbon from more SLR protection and provide shade for walkers or mountain bikers.
properties.details:
Food is among the most fundamental human rights, yet thousands of families in the Miami area live in food deserts. The only food they have access to is fried fast food and corner-store snacks. This high-fat and high-sugar diet is killing them.

We are working to change this, to create new traditions of self-reliance, and at the same time, new opportunities for education and economic empowerment.

Big problems require big solutions. Each UPG Garden Center will provide essential resources: Family Gardens for those living in apartments, composting, soil, seeds, plants, trees, and experiential education.

Nurseries will grow fruit trees and vegetables for Urban Agriculture, and Natives for Urban Forestry and Neighborhood Transformations.

Butterfly Gardens will give life to rare and even endangered butterflies.

Children will grow up knowing that they have the power and the knowledge to make the world they live in a better place because they have done it!
properties.title: Urban Paradise Guild Garden Centers
properties.name: Urban Paradise Guild Garden Centers

properties.submitter_name: The City of Miami Black Police Precinct and Musuem
properties.description: SHIELDS & WHEELS BIKE SAFETY DAY will occur in an unused vacant lot under the highway in Overtown.  It is an interactive day where children, youth  and adults in partnership with Miami Police Department and the City of Miami Retired Black Police Officers are taught and made to enact bicycle safety rules through a series of drills and maneuvers.  Not only will this create an opportunity to use vacant land for fun while learning safety but also allow the community to interact with police officers building a trust and bond for future interactions.
properties.title: Shields and Wheels
properties.details: transform a vacant lot into a location bustling with activity. The Overtown community SHIELDS & WHEELS BIKE SAFETY DAY is a fun, interactive family activity that fosters a safer transportation environment.  Communities like Overtown rarely have opportunities to be taught safety measures while having fun with local police officers.   In 2009, the City of Miami initiated and is in the process of cultivating a Bicycle Master Plan to make bikes an easy alternative to automobile use as well as recreational enjoyment for its residents.  Shields and Wheels ensures that all communities are included in making bicycling safe.

properties.description: We have located a city owned lot on which we would like to create a community garden. The north half would  be used for growing fruit trees and edible perennials (6 papaya, 3 banana, 2 passionfruit, 1 mango, 1 avocado, 1 starfruit, 1 mulberry, 1 guava, a sweet potato area and a melon area). The other half would be used for row crops focusing on annual vegetables and herbs. In addition, we willhave a composting area, tool shed, and 2 tables which could be used for classes and having meals.  We will also be installing an automated irrigation system for the garden.
properties.title: West Grove Community Garden
properties.details:
Have more exposure to the process of growing organic fruits, vegetables and herbs as locally as possible. Community members will be involved on a regular schedule and receive produce in exchange for helping take care of the garden.

The benefits of community gardens are many, including: 

- Educating others on how to grow food and eat healthy
- Gardening is therapeutic, social, and fosters teamwork and community
- Saving money on otherwise costly organic produce
- Beautifying a public space
- A great way to exercise
- Serving as models for future community gardens

comments.comment: Bad idea at that location. Put this project in Coral Gables!
Inappropriate land for the project. Land to build a house.  Avoid code violations when propose projects.
Great initiative, wrong place!

This project is not feasible for 4 basic reasons:
1 - The space is very little: this lot (less than 5000 sq ft) only would fit a mango tree and and avocado tree fully grown, and these 2 trees would fill the lot.
2 - Maintenance Cost: who will maintain and take care of this project? There should be at least one paid person by the government to be taking care of the plants, some other people teaching classes about agriculture and at least another one to supervise all the time so nobody gets in when it is closed, and damages or steals the fruits. I am tired of seeing people breaking in and getting into houses that are in foreclosure, and people breaking into properties that have fruit trees in houses that face the streets, stealing the fruits and damaging the plants. In other words, it is not feasible. In the future, the government stops sending funds for the model garden and this ends up again being an empty lot.
3 - Residential Zoning, no agrigultural. Where the lot is located it can't work any agricultural project. This is a residential area.
4 - Real needs of W. Grove: West Grove needs affordable housing for Low income families that can stay in W. Grove.

Conclusion: There are a lot of places where agricultural activities are allowed, with larger lots, and it is chosen the incorrect one. The person that is planning this project is dedicated to fruit gardens, so I don't think there's a legitimate interest in helping people, but for personal interest.
Great initiative to promote healthy eating for the community. Best of luck!

This lot is residential, and only houses can be built on it. It is not allowed for agricultural activities (according to Miami 21). What the Grove need are affordable houses in its residential lots for the families.
This sounds wonderful and you certainly have the chops to make it happen!
Address of the site is 3749 Oak Avenue

properties.description:
This installation creates an active zone from the usual static transition zones of our urban infrastructure like bus stops and train stations.  The urban swing set, not only creates a space for people to immerse themselves in healthy playful activity while waiting for the bus/train, but also creates a musical experience, to enliven the urban (morning rush) atmosphere.
This project will be organized by A.L.T. (Active Living Team) Non-profit organization with the support of local artists, architects and community organizers.
properties.title: Pop-up Pedestrian Playground
properties.details: The atmosphere created promotes not only healthy and physical activity, but helps create a social environment for our Miamians to connect and begin to look forward to their daily commute.  Instead of sitting or standing stagnant at a bus stop, they can interact and engage in physical entertainment.

properties.description: Imagine that you are out for a walk in your local park and you come across a sculpture that looks like a large and inviting umbrella. Under this umbrella are seats in which you can sit underneath and you are instantly shaded from the sun or protected from the rain.  As you approach the sculpture and come closer and closer you hear something.  The sound that you hear is music.  And the music that you hear is classical music to be exact. These sound umbrellas can be a place for people of all ages and to stop and listen to the beautiful sounds of an amazing genre of music that has remained with us for hundreds of years.  This will be a place to contemplate, meditate, study, or just sit and enjoy.
properties.title: "Sound Umbrellas"
properties.details: These "Sound Umbrellas" will serve multiple purposes. They will be a place to sit and relax, a place to be protected from environmental conditions, and a culturally educational outdoor space. Classical music, although popular within a select audience, is not mainstream. I think that having this music made accessible to a large audience can give those who are not exposed to it a taste of what they are missing. Studies have shown that classical music deters crime, can heal the sick and can be a great study tool. I want to design these umbrellas so that people can be exposed to music in a public outdoor space.

properties.description: Imagine an application that allowed a user to point their smart phone to an icon pictured in front of historic sites around our town. This will prompt a video detailing the history of the site on our very own Miami Virtual museum application. It will be funded continuously by the historic sites advertising their tours and rates and tourists will love to have the application when visiting our awesome city.
properties.title: Miami's Virtual Museum
properties.details: Learn more about the history of our wonderful city, discover hidden treasures scattered and forgotten to time, and provide cultural awareness for our residents and tourists alike.

properties.description: During World War II, Mot of the hotels in Miami Beach were taken over by the U,S, Army Air Training Command in order to billet airmen who trained at the local airfields. One-third of all the aircrews that took part in the air war over Europe were trained in Miami and Miami Beach. There are hundreds of photos taken by photographers, residents and the soldiers themselves that depict the war years on Miami Beach. My idea would be to install free standing metal photo engraved plaques along the sidewalks throughout Miami Beach's parks that depict photos of the hotels, soldiers, etc. during the war years. This would complement the art deco history of Miami Beach and would enhance a tourist's or local resident'sexperience when visiting Miami Beach
properties.title: World War II History Walk
properties.details: experience the unique history of our local area.  Much of the greater Miami area was populated after WWII by the veterans who trained on Miami Beach and were shipped off to foreign shores. After the was they wanted to return to the place that gave them great memories where they experienced the sun, sand, and surf of Miami Beach. By installing these pedestal mounted photo engraved plaques along areas where our local residents and tourists visit, it would enhance their experience and educate both young and old on a forgotten history of MIami Beach. Over 530,000 airmen trained and billeted in the Miami -Miami Beach area and several thousand of those that trained here were lost in the war and were never to return home alive.

properties.description:
Digital  identification on the Metro Rail trains to identify whether it's a Green Line train or an

Orange Line train. Currently the only signs are  placed on the front of the train.

Passengers boarding the train that need a specific train usually has to walk to the front of the train to check or ask someone.
properties.title: Is This a Green Line or Orange Line Train?
properties.details: Know specifically which train they are boarding, especially when you board at Dadeland South.

properties.description:
Wynwood is a vibrant art, commerce and business destination in the core of Miami, Florida. It’s an area that thrives on color, life and character. With more street art than anywhere in America, Wynwood is defined by its unique look and feel. It gives people a visual sense of place and it’s where they want to live, shop, visit, eat, drink and just be. Wynwood is the definition of urban renewal. 
   In order to improve sidewalk visibility at night, while illuminating the vibrant art that defines the community, we will develop, install, and maintain Wynwood-style signage that clearly defines the art district’s boundaries. The BID will also work to develop and install pedestrian signage that directs people to Wynwood attractions and enables vis
properties.title: Wynwood – Our 24 Hour Outdoor Living Museum – See It Shine
properties.details: See Wynwood’s role as a globally-recognized center for art and culture with visibly clean and safe streets that facilitate an improved pedestrian experience through a vibrant and colorful physical space. Wynwood street art is the most engaging, appealing and attractive art for residents, visitors and tourists alike.

properties.description:
The public space challenge got me thinking. I propose to create and install brass plaques embedded in the sidewalks in front of three lesser know but historically significant downtown establishments from the past. The buildings still exist but the plaques will tell their story. I see the plaques as a cross between a star from the Hollywood Walk of Fame and a historical identification marker. The plaques would graphically depict the place in its hay day and include relevant information. 

I see the project as a gift back to the pioneers of the downtown area and a reminder for the present community that there is a rich history underneath our feet if we take the time to investigate.
properties.title: "RECLAMATION POINTS PROJECT"
properties.details:
I was heading to the Olympia Theatre the other day and while I was walking through Downtown, I came across a familiar sight. I stopped to watch the tearing down of a beautiful old 1920’s apartment building. I wondered if they would try to keep the building’s facade for its historical value. I’m sure many of the people that once lived in the building have left us, but as I witnessed the destruction first hand, I felt their loss. With all of the redevelopment in the downtown area there is a wave of “the new” that is quickly washing away the city’s history.  

I’ve been working on a research article about an old downtown billiards club called Jeff’s 50 Club. It was located at 50 SE 1st street and operated during the 1930’s. It's perfect!

properties.description:
The Solar InfoPod is a solar-powered cultural information and phone charging station to be located within the Downtown Miami area. This sustainable and low cost iconic urban amenity will increase pedestrian activity and can be digitally fabricated in order to generate an exciting and playful form in the Miami urban landscape.

The Solar InfoPod can be very easily replicated and installed in other areas of the city as well, transforming these spaces and increasing pedestrian interactivity with this Solar InfoPod way-finding information system. Additionally, with the potential sponsorship by wireless service companies and the proliferation of these units throughout the city, this concept can transform and enhance pedestrian connectivity.
properties.title: The Solar InfoPod
properties.details:
With the implementation of this idea, pedestrians will be able to gain vital information about local and cutting-edge cultural activities as they occur, while allowing them with a means to charge their phones. It will also provide users with the possibility to find a shaded place to sit and rest after a long walk or to get temporary shelter from the rain.

Since solar power is the main source of power for the Solar InfoPod, this will serve to heighten awareness of the potential for harnessing solar power in South Florida. The Solar InfoPod’s design and form will become an icon in Miami’s urban infrastructure.

properties.description: Let’s test the potential for Washington Avenue to assume her true identity as the gateway to South Beach. The broad street lined with coconut palms is home to diverse businesses catering to all walks of life. Juice and coffee bars rub elbows with burger joints and sushi restaurants. Tattoo parlors and head shops brush up against world-class cultural institutions. Despite the throngs of beach goers and tour groups passing through this corridor, Washington remains a neglected sibling next to her sister avenues Collins and Ocean. For blocks, the street is inhospitable to the average passerby. A small green space intervention offering shady repose and a place to people watch would do wonders to remake the Washington Avenue experience.
properties.title: Shading the Seedy Avenue
properties.details: Washington Avenue at 10th Street is an uninviting crossroads with tremendous need for urban acupuncture. What if we offered an alternative to the current shuffle of pedestrians along the Avenue, beginning with The Wolfsonian’s own slightly shabby front yard? Imagine a sustainable garden with public seating on the sidewalk/plaza in front of The Wolfsonian. Transforming a now uninviting block, the new green space will inspire wonder and a sense of tropical lushness with two large vertical gardens flanking the museum entrance. Two Water Benches installed beneath the trees will provide shaded seating and serve as reservoirs for excess storm water runoff that will be used to water the gardens. With the City, we can model a green streetscape.

properties.description: The wooden Miami Beach Boardwalk, a national treasure, has been demolished for two blocks at 29th-30th Streets as part of a deal between Marriott and the City to construct the Miami Beach Edition Hotel and Residences (fomerly the Seville Hotel).  Walkers and joggers have to climb down from the Boardwalk and walk on the sand for two blocks, then climb back on the Boardwalk. My proposal is to work with the developers and the City to build a wooden-planked detour flat on the sand for those two blocks, adding shrubs alongside. This would  allow for an uninterrupted Boardwalk experience, while still allowing access for the Edition.  It could be the pilot project for a Friends of the Boardwalk association.
