properties.description:
The Virginia Street Farmers Market at the M-PATH concept stems from both need and opportunity.  Given the residential densities surrounding the area, the vast pedestrian and bicycle traffic along this corridor of the M-PATH, plus the adjacency to the Coconut Grove Metro Station, the geographic location for a farmers market &/or hub for healthy foods vendors in this place appears to be ideal.  

Currently, this is not a "place" but a "space".  The location lacks significant environmental character or a sense of identity.  By initiating a healthy foods vendor-hub here, the neighboring Crossfit gym members will naturally gravitate to and support the businesses.  Motorists, commuters and recreational users will respond to the urban attractor.
properties.title: M is for MARKET!  Virginia Street Farmers Market at the M-PATH (from SW 31st Ave.  to  SW 30th Ave.)
properties.details:
By developing this concept, many people will benefit, because: 

Nearby residents will be able to walk to local, healthy food. 

Travelers along the M-PATH will enjoy the amenities and beauty. 

Commuters will gain a place along their way to get healthy foods. 

Motorists may have reduced number of vehicles on the roadway. 

All ages, backgrounds and types of individuals can enjoy, share. 

Local businesses, citizens and groups can engage, unite efforts. 

People can use the Metro Rail to access this from other stops. 

This activation of the M-PATH will increase overall trail use. 

Improved safety can result from more "eyes on the path". 

As "normal users" increase, "abnormal users" decrease. 

Themed events can invigorate operations.

comments.comment: I agree. Looks like fun and great idea
Excellent idea!

properties.description: CURRENTLY, AH WE WA STREET IS AN UNPAVED ROAD LEADING TO AN EXISTING BAY FRONT NEIGHBORHOOD PARK.  THE IDEA IS TO CONVERT THE ONE BLOCK UNPAVED ROAD INTO  SOLAR PANEL CANOPIED PATH WITH WALKWAY AND GARDEN PATCHES THAT CAN BE MANAGED BY EACH OF THE NEIGHBORHOOD RESIDENTS.  EACH RESIDENT CAN MANAGE ONE PATCH ENABLING COMMUNITY BUILDING AND CONNECTION, WHILE BEAUTIFYING THE NEIGHBORHOOD. THEIR WOULD BE VARIOUS COMPOSTING BINS, SO THAT THE NEIGHBORS CAN MANAGE THEIR OWN COMPOST AND REDUCE THE TREE LITTER THAT THE CITY NEEDS TO COLLECT.
properties.title: AH WE WA COMMUNITY GREEN PATH AND GARDEN
properties.details: THE SOLAR PANELS ENERGY CAN BE FED INTO THE GRID AND REDUCE THE NEIGHBORHOODS ELECTRIC BILL.  THE CANOPY CAN BE LACED WITH BUTTERFLY PLANTS TO SUPPORT POLLINATION AND BEAUTIFICATION.  MANY OF THE RESIDENTS IN THIS NEIGHBORHOOD ARE ALREADY INTERESTED IN REALIZING THIS PROJECT.  WINNING THE PUBLIC SPACE CHALLENGE WOULD HELP CATALYZE THE IDEA.  CURRENTLY, WE HAVE A ZERO LOT PARK AS OUR ONLY RESIDENTIAL GREEN SPACE.  THE ONE BLOCK AH WA WE GREEN PATH AND GARDEN WILL HELP BRING OUR NEIGHBORHOOD TOGETHER, WHILE REDUCING OUR POWER BILL, ENABLING A FARMER'S MARKET CONCEPT AND GIVE US A PLACE TO WALK WITH OUR KIDS AND DOGS WITHOUT FEAR OF TRAFFIC.  REGARDING THE SIGNIFICANCE, AH WE WA MEANS 'VETERAN TWO SPIRITS'.  OUR NEIGHBORHOOD THANKS YOU!

properties.description:
The Nature Links Conservation Leadership Program is envisioned to be a collaborative effort to enhance continuing education and job training for employable young adults with intellectual disabilities roughly 22 to 30 years of age.  The aim of the program is to provide specific skills for employment outcomes within parks, farms, gardens, and other private businesses and public agencies, while providing basic models of continuing education and environmental leadership that empowers students to promote conservation goals to the broader population. Those projected to be part of the collaborative include the City of Miami, the Va Key Park Trust,  MD County Parks and Recreation, Fairchild Tropical Garden, Montgomery Botanical Center, the University of Miami’s Mailman Center for Child Development, UM’s Center for Autism and Related Disabilities (CARD), UM’s Inst, for Public History, Miami Dade College, Miami Science Museum and others. 

We also have two other programs that need funding, the Nature Links Culinary Arts Program and our Saturdays By the Bay Program on Virginia Key Beach Park.
properties.name: Conservation Leadership Project
properties.title: Conservation Leadership Project
properties.details: Because young adults with intellectual disabilities have little to do these days and their interest in learning work skills can, for many,  best  be developed in relation to the natural world. All to many of this population sit home watching TV/internet.  However, we will also have them videtape and edit their work, presentations by others, trips - in order to edit the material and present it on our website. www.naturelinks.net

properties.description:
The Historic Virginia Key Beach Park "Tea House" will be the focal point and meeting place inside our native plant nursery area for environmental educational sessions, nutritional studies, farmers' market activities, yoga, tai chi, meditation and evening community dinner parties and gatherings. The Tea House itself will be a simple wooden structure, closed to the outdoor elements only by screens and curtains, decorated with local community art, pottery and local vegetation. The native plant nursery programming would be coordinated by the Virginia Key beach park Trust and City of Miami Naturalist while nutrition and well-being will be coordinated by our community partner, Zen Village.

The Tea House would also be available for local environmental organizations to use as a community meeting and planning space. Rain water capture, solar energy and wind energy would not only be topics of educational classes and study but could also be put into practice on the historic beach park initiated by the Tea House.

The Tea House would be known throughout south Florida as a natural and welcoming space for collective thought and fellowship to restore our community and embrace nature.
properties.name: Virginia Key Tea House
properties.details:
We hope to create a catalyst for environmental education and understanding, fellowship and community well-being.

The Tea House project is located on Historic Virginia Key Beach Park, a newly restored and re-opened 82 acre public beach park, formerly the "colored only" beach in Miami-Dade County during segregation. The Historic Beach Park sits on the island of Virginia Key, a 1,000 acre natural barrier island in Biscayne Bay. Once heavily targeted for commercial and high-rise development the Historic Beach Park was rescued by a large cross section of South Florida residents that demanded that the island remain a natural ecosystem and the City of Miami created the Virginia Key Beach Park Trust manage the restoration and re-opening of the Historic Beach Park to the public.

Virginia Key is the last large parcel of natural undeveloped land in the City of Miami, the Virginia Key Beach Park Trust and its restoration of Historic Virginia Key Beach Park has been a beacon for the local rally cry to "Make Virginia Key Miami's Central Park." We hope the Tea House will be the place where that rally cry grows into a regional chorus.

properties.description: Ke’Ara has created a Farmers’ Market on Wheels providing access to local, sustainable, and organic goods throughout Miami-Dade to eaters like you. We offer the freshest local produce from farms located throughout the state, the finest locally produced specialty food items, and eco-friendly/holistic goods and products. The Mobile Harvest Market will have a regular weekly schedule, reaching multiple neighborhoods each day and targeting communities that are most underserved in terms of food access. This concept is based on a proven model that has been very successful and impactful in other major cities. Ke’Ara will foster community engagement and establish strong working partnerships with key stakeholders including health centers, schools, and other community-based organizations to maximize our outreach. Ke’Ara is able to add to the capacity of existing community health programs and school curriculum by utilizing the Mobile Harvest Market as a platform to educate youth and families around healthy eating, meal preparation and urban agriculture. Ke’Ara Mobile Harvest Market will allow local farmers and producers to sell their goods as soon as they are harvested so you can enjoy them as fresh as possible while also creating another outlet for selling their products thus providing a consistent market for the food system. The market will also provide access to those that don't have transportation, time, or knowledge to acquire healthy, local, sustainable, organic goods.
properties.name: Ke’Ara Food Collective Mobile Harvest Market
properties.title: Ke’Ara Food Collective Mobile Harvest Market
properties.details: “Ke’Ara” comes from the indigenous words meaning People (Ara) of the Earth (Ke’). At Ke’Ara Food Collective we believe that through a collective process we can accomplish great things by focusing on sustainability, biodiversity, conservation, food security and health. Our desire is to help in protecting the earth and assist towards developing our own truly resilient community in Miami-Dade through all facets revolving around our food system. When measuring sustainability in our community, we’ve found that one of the most underserved areas is its diverse relationship it has with the food we grow, buy, and eat. There is substantial research indicating that the local food movement has a high success rate in foods that are minimally processed, in season and locally grown, like those available at farmers’ markets and backyard gardens. The processes to grow these foods are generally the most earth- and climate-friendly. One of the reasons is because the energy needed to store and transport the food is removed from the equation with less harmful greenhouse gasses being emitted into the atmosphere. Why import avocados from Mexico when they grow in our own “backyard”? We are confident that our project will also begin to tackle food security issues for those without access to healthy, fresh food by providing an expandable market for farmers and producers, convenience for those that don’t have the time to seek them out, and distribution for those without transportation. Ke’Ara Mobile Harvest Market has been designed to find solutions for all of these problems.

properties.description: Colony1 will be an art and environmental research facility in Miami providing a centralized hub for collaboration between art and science through a residency program, on-going public workshops, lectures, on-site demonstrations, and community outreach programs to bring sustainability to South Florida. Part contemporary ecological urban think tank, part community center & public gathering space, Colony1 will be a catalyst for innovation led by international, interdisciplinary arts & science partnerships of emerging talents in the areas of ecology, sustainability, conservation, technology, urbanism, architecture, design, visual & performing arts, and education.
properties.details:
As we begin to feel an impact of current environmental changes due to global warming, we see that South Florida is one of the first impact sites of sea level rise due to the melting of the world’s major glaciers. More and more species are disappearing from South Florida’s eco system, which depends upon this diversity for environmental balance. Without our unique wetlands, flora and fauna we begin to lose a key component in a much larger picture of environmental stability. Our coral reefs disappear, sea temperatures rise and transitioning factors bring weather extremes.

We believe Miami should strive to be the “greenest” city in America.  Mayor Rahm Emanuel in Chicago has stated he wants the city to be ""the greenest city in the world”, and that he is committed to fostering opportunities for Chicagoans to make sustainability a part of their lives and their experience in the city.  Miami has more resources to become the “greenest” city than Chicago. There is no reason that every resident should not be gardening, harvesting rainwater, utilizing solar energy and creating rich soils with compost. Our city has unique weather, allowing all year growing conditions. There could be fruit trees in public spaces, back yard gardens or even rooftops, providing residents with seasonal fruits all year and restoring a natural canopy cover to Miami, making summers more energy efficient and pleasant. Colony1 is a model system of these points and hopes to inspire and facilitate this sort of strategic urban growth.
properties.title: Colony1: An Art and Environmental Research Facility
properties.name: Colony1: An Art and Environmental Research Facility

properties.description:
The Health in the Hood community vegetable and botanical gardens provide green spaces, healthy foods and environmental and health education for children and families in disenfranchised neighborhoods and food deserts.

We aim to provide healthy foods, physical fitness and environmental and health education for children and families who reside in disadvantaged neighborhoods.

Heath in the Hood installs and maintains large scale vegetable gardens in three of Miami’s most disenfranchised communities: Overtown, Liberty City and West Coconut Grove. These are three of the largest food deserts in the metro Miami area. The vegetables grown in our gardens are distributed to provide free fresh produce to children and families living in these food deserts.

We host free produce give away events, donate produce to local markets that lack fresh fruits and vegetables and provide hands on urban gardening opportunities for children and families. We also aim to provide health and environmental education workshops and physical fitness classes for residents in disconnected communities.

Our vision is for improved health in low-income communities with children and families actively participating in their health. Using a multi-faceted approach to address community health and environmental issues, in conjunction with public schools, local businesses, government, civic leaders and community experts, Health in the Hood provides green spaces and healthy living opportunities in communities of need.
properties.name: Health in the Hood Urban Gardens and Physical Fitness Classes
properties.details:
Health in the Hood aims to eliminate the environmental/community challenge of  food deserts and lack of green spaces in low-income communities.

A food desert is a district with little or no access to large grocery stores that offer the fresh and affordable foods needed to maintain a healthy diet. Instead of such stores, these districts often contain many fast food restaurants and convenience stores. According to the Miami Dade Health Department about 250,000 Miami-Dade residents live in low-income areas that have poor supermarket access and higher than average death rates from diet-related causes.

Residents living in food deserts very often lack the resources needed to make healthy food choices, like transportation, nutritional education and money. Local stores in food deserts offer cheap, packaged, sodium and preservative filled foods and little to no fresh produce.  Families are forced to feed their children unhealthy foods in order to put meals on the table. Poor diets lead to obesity in children and adults. Overweight and obese individuals are at increased risk for many diseases and health chronic conditions, including: high blood pressure, type 2 diabetes, heart disease, stroke and gallbladder disease.

Families residing in food deserts also have little access to health and environmental education.  This creates a palpable disconnect from the source of healthy foods and how to include them in daily life.  Our urban gardens provide hands on health and environmental education for children and families in 3 of Miami’s low income neighborhoods.

We aim to increase access to health education, physical fitness and healthy eating for children and families who reside in disadvantaged neighborhoods.

properties.description:
Urban Oasis Project is in the process of crating a mobile farmstand market to increase access to fresh local food across a wide area of underserved Miami- with three days a week planned to serve Liberty City, Hialeah and Goulds/Naranja. Making multiple stops during the day with a refrigerated truck outfitted to be attractive and enticing, the farmstand will represent numerous local farms.    
   This idea would provide an expansion of the market, providing funds to hire a nutrition and cooking expert to do on-site demonstrations of low cost, quick, healthy meals, and to provide educational materials such as recipes and shopping guides.
properties.title: Mobile Farmstand Market cooking demonstrations and educational outreach
properties.details: Transportation in Miami can be very difficult, and proximity to food options often determines what consumers purchase. By having numerous 2-hour stops, this mobile farmstand will provide an exciting neighborhood gathering spot to focus on healthy (and delicious!) eating.  People gathering  at outdoor markets create public space to share conversation, ideas and a sense of community.  Talented local chefs imparting knowledge and recipes takes the mysteriousness out of how to utilize new and unique local produce to maximize flavor and nutrition, as well as inspiring dialogue on how to meld various items with our many diverse food cultures.

comments.comment: AWESOME!!!!
Great idea.

properties.description:
As a food lover and someone who loves outdoor gardening I see the benefit for low income communities in both the US and around the world. 

I am passionate about Aquaponics cause I love fish and veggies. Plus I recognize the system is ecologically friendly if done right, and self sustainable. 4 years ago I dreamt of buying containers and and setting them up as Urban Greenhouses. The tech was expensive but now has dropped considerably in price. 
With funding we obtain materials after receiving land use rights. Average estimated cost per unit could be between $15000 to $20000  for material costs. We find volunteer labor for setup. We then build the system onsite at the property and produce both fish and plants for eating.
properties.title: Containerized mobile Aquaponic food systems.
properties.details:
These systems have ben studied around the word and are estimated that 20 foot system can feed up 10 people for every 20 feet used. The more get we add he better. If we build these systems then we can prove they work in our cities. We can then take abandoned properties and modify them for these uses. 

This offers us: 
Unity in communities. 
Food security by reducing foreign imports in our food production.
Shops like whole foods can buy more locally stimulating local economics. 
Education centers for both domestic and foreign interested parties. Making Miami a farmers learning hub for a future in which food systems will be stressed cause of rising population.

For more info email me at: erikmaguina@bellsouth.net.
Thank you

properties.description:
The Edge-of-the City Farmers' Market would improve our community by creating an outdoor, open-space market venue for local farmers, horticulturists, artisans, and artists to showcase and sell their fresh fruits, vegetables, orchids, ornamental plants, crafts, and art.

The land-use is currently classified as "undeveloped", but a private real estate company has plans to develop it. In the interim, let's put it to use as a farmers' market!

It would create a fun, healthy, family-friendly destination for the people living in the sprawling, suburban communities in the western areas of greater Miami (and all Miamians) to visit on the weekends by cycling, walking, riding public transportation, or driving.
properties.title:
Edge-of-the-City Farmers' Market

(To Promote Healthy Eating, Active Transport, and the UDB!)
properties.details: With a new farmers' market in the west, people will come to appreciate the importance of agricultural (and cultural) production in our community. They'll draw the connection between agricultural land-use on the periphery of our community and the food  stuffs that flow through our city's food network. Our beloved Miami metro region continues to sprawl in the west with single-family residences, exacerbating traffic congestion and diminishing quality of life. The proposed location is outside of the current Urban Development Boundary (UDB), but is still within the area known as the Urban Expansion Area, which the County has deemed the appropriate location for the UDB to be expanded to. Let's celebrate local produce while highlighting the UDB.

Who is planning to develop this land? Please call me, 305.343.4468 --Hold the Line would like to be aware of any expansion plans. WE can't continue to sprawl west. Thanks for making the connection between ag lands out west and food. People forget where their food comes from.

"The land-use is currently classified as "undeveloped", but a private real estate company has plans to develop it"

This idea -- of establishing a farmers' market at the edge of the city, near the Urban Development Boundary -- reflects the will of many, if not, all participants at the recent West Kendall Planning Charette, hosted by Commissioner Juan Zapata (District #11), on March 1, 2014: (http://kendallcorridor.wordpress.com/2014/03/03/march-1-public-workshop-citizens-presentations/).

Thanks for your support for this initiative, which reflects the collective will of the entire community!
Yes, brilliant. About time! Thank you, Matthew Toro for starting this initiative.

This would be a great use for Kendall's undeveloped space. Many communities in south Florida already have their own Farmer's markets, it would be great for our residents to have our own instead of having to venture out to others and also making Kendall a more self sustaining community.
This is a no-brainer

I've always felt West Kendall has lacked an outdoor farmer’s market for quite some time. With the closing of the nearby U-Pick, this seems like a great proposal to serve an underutilized area and provide fresh foods to the local community, without the hassle of driving many more miles down Krome Ave. This would also help the roadside vendors/farmers by increasing their consumer base significantly. Great idea!

properties.description: My idea is to create a sustainable community program that can 1. recycle usable wastes (like cardboard boxes, used coffee grounds, etc.), and 2. turn them into usable fresh healthy food that can be enjoyed by the people running the garden and also used to feed the local homeless population. We can easily grow mushrooms that are both nutritious and have proven medicinal properties by recycling "waste streams" from the many offices and businesses in the area. --empty land or warehouse space.

The idea, materials, and needs are universal, so it has the ability to grow and "mushroom" into something much bigger and with far greater impact on the world community. What we do here, we can do almost everywhere.

How much would it cost to begin? Why this location, and who has the land rights? Who is going to manage the project? It's a nice idea, but could it be worked by high school students who need community hours to graduate, plus add to their college applications?

properties.description: Provide an engaging and interactive sportsmanship program in public parks for children. With help of volunteers and part-time qualified coaches each park will engage in team sports such as; soccer, flag football, basketball, baseball, volleyball. The idea is to reach as many low income families as possible while promoting leadership, team work and sportsmanship. Properly promoting this initiative for Miamians to enjoy organized spo

Children need sports and sports need children. Kids engaged in sports and activities throughout their childhood are more likely to feel better about themselves. This idea will use public space to teach and mentor children while doing something fun and of course free of charge, an incentive for most parents in Miami. 
Most Professional leagues have adopted and promote a stay fit theme for kids and adults. We would like to do the same with the "Public Space Challenge" and allow Miamians an opportunity to play for free in an organized sport. Ultimately, attracting sponsors and philanthropist to continue the initiative.

properties.description: is to create a universal, adaptive playground that would enable disabled and able-bodied children to play together. This adaptive playground, to be located on 76th Street and Collins Avenue in Miami Beach, would include special equipment for disabled youngsters, including special swings with back supports, wheelchair accessible ramps and level roundabouts. The playground would include raised sand tables for sandcastle building and a sensory board for children who are autistic or visually / hearing impaired, and decorative sculptures.  The Sabrina Cohen Foundation, a nonprofit dedicated to providing a better quality of life for people living with paralysis, is in discussions with the City of Miami Beach about the location.
properties.title: Playground for ALL
properties.details: have a playground in which disabled and able-bodied children would play together. Children’s playgrounds are not just for recess, they are where youngsters learn to play games with rules, build relationship skills and forge friendships that last a lifetime. Disabled children are shut out from this experience, learn they are “different” and are also invisible to able-bodied youngsters. By playing together in an adaptive playground, they would not only get exercise, but they would also learn to like and respect each other for their similarities, not their differences. Such an experience would engage the parents of these youngsters as well in a spirit of inclusion that would carry over from the playground into other areas of everyday life.

properties.description: This epic idea has the ability to not only change the public space but change lives of underserved youth that have fallen victim to violence and crime by providing positive alternatives for these youth. VIBE 305 Café will use the public space of 20 NE 29th Street in Wynwood, which has already been procured for this project, and place a food truck / trailer on this property. The project will then train inner-city boys to work & run the VIBE 305 Café & also allow them to showcase the many diverse talents of our inner-city youth via their works of art and music. VIBE 305 will be a point and place of pride, where they could grow, learn, expand their horizons & forge new pathways to a better life all the while learning essential life skills.

With this multidisciplinary education, we can change these youth’s entire world – but in order to do so, we must raise their consciousness; the only way to change their world is to raise their general consciousness. VIBE 305 Café - Striving to create individuals that are going to change the world.

This is a spectacular idea and project!

The Empowered Youth organization works very hard and devoted to the wellness of the inner-city boys and their futures. The VIBE 305 Cafe and Youth Artistic Showcase brings yet another well planned and needed program to Miami.

I love it, love it!!! This is what I'm talking about. Go Miami Foundation! The project will then train inner-city boys to work & run the VIBE 305 Café & also allow them to showcase the many diverse talents of our inner-city youth via their works of art and music. Please like their page and vote!!!
Wonderful concept!  I know these young men and they are hardworking and ready for this challenge.
Great idea! would love to see it come to fruition
Everyone please spread the word and help us gain support!!
This is a brilliant idea! What a great opportunity for those that had no hope which will allow them to grow and be an example!
A wonderful space for interactive art and community activities as well as social enterprise and all run by the young men! Perfect!
yes! Fantastic idea for boys…promotes work and civility! kiss er great an this will be amazing asset to neighborhood!

THIS IS FANTASTIC AND A BEAUTIFUL community-enriching idea. There are many models like this in other cities, such as "HomeBoy" Food and Catering Company in Los Angeles.  They are great infrastructures for young people to learn how to run their own business and learn their strengths.  FINGERS CROSSED FOR VIBE 305! (Could it include Vegan options?!?!   )

This is an awesome and creative idea that will change the mindset of many, open up opportunity for not only the youth but the community. I am so proud of this wonderful organization, the journey they have traveled and strides they are making each and every day in Miami. I see the strength and power of Empowered Youth moving acoss the US and touching the lives of many.
Great concept and well worth the community of Wynwood! It will only add to the vibrant artistic and culinary growth of the community as well!
What a great idea ! I think getting these kids off the street and into a working environment will greatly help the community!

properties.description: In this corner that's of little current use, there could be a family-friendly musical mini-park for everyone to play with and enjoy.  Durable, outdoor instruments could be installed and visitors would be allowed to perform publicly and in perfect harmony.  Or, users can simply make incoherent noise pollution that's as unique as their taste in music.
properties.title: Mmm- Musical Mini-Park
properties.details: Experience musical diversity.  Enjoy the freedom to attempt foreign instruments and create new sounds, while in a social, community-based setting.  Teach children musical lessons or exercise with an older adult who may want to mix the business of working out with the pleasure of friendly company.

comments.comment: It's difficult to think of how taking this idea to reality could be anything but positive.

Anything involving music in the community is a plus in my book!  Wonderful idea and so nice that it is family friendly, interactive, educational and fun, and can be enjoyed by individuals of all ages! Should definitely put a smile on a lot of faces in the community!

Love the idea of elderly and children for demographics.  Also, was outside Wholefoods the other day eating lunch and a random piano in Sarasota started playing that they have put around town.  What a nice random thing and changed the ambiance for all around to enjoy.  PB
My boys would love it! Ages 3 & 4

Great work.
Keep it up .
great idea for unused space Looks safe as well

properties.description: This point along the M-PATH is currently adjoined by a Yoga studio, martial arts instruction and zen sculptures.  As a straight portion of the M-PATH, setback as far as possible from US 1, there's shade and a serene environment that could likely lend itself to supporting a handful of small meditation spots.  These spots can be circular, paved areas next to and around the M-PATH and might include a typical feature of a zen garden, such as a sculpture or statue.  Small plantings could further help as an addition, to create an environment that promotes relaxation for all ages and types of visitors.  Furthermore, a local studio instructor may be happy to manage the space and assist in promoting group events in the family-friendly mini-park.
properties.title: ZEN-Friend Park
properties.details: The idea is to allow all types of M-PATH users to enjoy the beauty and serenity that comes from Zen-gardens.  Active users can actual meditate or stretch and exercise in the area and passive users can watch them, study the details of the garden and share in the collaborative, free-flowing atmosphere.  This proposal could invite more users to the M-PATH and potentially instill greater perceptions of safety and security for everyone in the area by increasing the number of "normal users" and "eyes on the path".

comments.comment: Cute idea :D
Meditation lowers blood pressure and cortisol levels and enhances well being.  It would be a great addition to the area.
Clever ideas

properties.description: We could set up an interactive museum focusing on the history of public television production and broadcasting in the Miami area. The courtyard and grounds of our studio will be developed with outdoor displays featuring highlights of public television in Miami, along with presentations, games and even a mini outdoor studio for the chance to become a part of television history through an ongoing community awareness campaign. While open to all, the museum will be geared towards a safe and fun place for kids to discover and learn about public television.
properties.title: Create a pop-up interactive museum of public television and its community impact in Miami
properties.details: Visitors could come and view presentations chronicling the development of public television in our community and its ongoing impact to the public. They can also participate via a mini outdoor studio where they can film segments on how public television affects their lives in the past, present and future, with a chance of that segment becoming part of a community awareness campaign. Visitors will also be invited to bring memorabilia/toys/premiums gotten from past pledge drives featuring their favorite public television programs, to share with the public and/or use in their video segment.

properties.description:
Opa-locka’s Magnolia North Neighborhood has been selected by KaBOOM!, a national nonprofit that envisions a great place to play within walking distance of every child in America to serve as the location of a Community Built Playground Project. In order to receive the playground, our project team must raise a total of $8,500 towards the Kaboom playground by December 2013 as well as additional money to cover associated costs. We are all very excited to have this opportunity bought to the Magnolia North Neighborhood which will ultimately provide a safe play space for our kids.

Over the past year, residents of Magnolia North have expressed their concerns for a safe place for our youth to play. These concerns have led to community driven initiatives such as the Pop Up Park which promotes living an active and healthy lifestyle until permanent park space could be located in Magnolia North and now a Kaboom Playground build which fills the void of access to public park space. Through the Collective efforts of residents, the City of Opa-locka, South Florida Regional Planning Council (SFRPC), the Opa-locka Community Development Corporation (OLCDC), and sponsors we have been granted this special opportunity to improve recreational activity through a community built playground for our kids.
properties.details: There is no playground or green space in the Magnolia North Neighborhood. Kids lack access to near public, green, and playground space. As a result of not having a park in the neighborhood kids are forced to play in the streets in front of their homes. An Open public playground will enable community involvement and interaction, as well as provide a safe place within walking distance for the kids of the Magnolia North community to play.
properties.title: Magnolia North Playground
properties.name: Magnolia North Playground

properties.description: Designate different areas within Highland Oaks Park to create gathering places that have shade and seating for conversations that bring a community together.  One example would be an off leash dog area for the neighborhoods directly surrounding the park.  Another would be a basketball court area to encourage all ages to play outdoors - with shaded seating area for spectators.  This is an unincorporated area surrounded by different cities that have amazing public spaces for community building within the city.  This area does not have any such areas within its boundaries.
properties.title: Community Building in Highland Lakes
properties.details: Meet neighbors and collaborate on different ideas that enhance a community, such as beautification of an area, and security ideas to name a few.  If you don't have kids in schools or activities, in the community it is difficult to meet neighbors. We have a playground for children but if you don't have young kids or school age kids the opportunity to build community doesn't exist within the unincorporated boundaries of this area. Off leash dog area allows other groups of individuals to form a community, and basketball can also be a way for adults to meet other adults.

properties.submitter_name: Theodora Long/Marjory Stoneman Douglas Biscayne Nature Center, Inc.
properties.description: The oceanfront is a magnificant place at Sunset and beyond.  The Marjory Stoneman Douglas Biscayne Nature Center has so much to offer the Miami-Dade residents and visitors in environmental educational talks, guest authors, videos and movies.  It is a shame that Crandon Park cannot be enjoyed by the general public for evening events with an educational purpose.   The Crandon Park Master Plan does not allow for this to take place.   This needs to be addressed so that our residents can learn about the importance of preserving our natural environment for future generations.
properties.title: Open Crandon Park for evening events!
properties.details:
Educating the public on conservation and preservation of our natural environment is an important mission in the future of our world around us.  Drinking water, weather, pollution, use of plastics and environmental awareness is of great importance and something the general public really needs to be made aware of.  What we each do daily in our lives, affects everyone.  

One person can make a difference.  It is now time to make this known to everyone.

comments.comment: Great Idea!

properties.description: US 1 is a disaster from Brickell until Kendall. By adding a bus and car pool lane it will take cars off the road, speed up transit for commuters, spare the air, and improve the quality if life. People will be motivated to car pool because those lanes will be less crowded and faster. Buses will be better than sitting in traffic behind a giant SUV while the driver is texting and oblivious. It is time to deal with the traffic  nightmare.
properties.title: Make a bus and car pool lane on US I.
properties.details: The is no space for all of the cars on US 1. By providing incentives to carpool and or take the bus, people will be willing.

comments.comment: That's what the metrorail is there for.

properties.description:
Safety and beautification idea:

If you are a pedestrian or biker and want to cross the highway at the pedestrian crossing over to Brickell Ave, I wonder each time if I will survive !  As a pedestrian it feels quite threatening to wait at the crossing, first of all there is little time, the distance is very long and the speed limit for cars is to fast. Also the intersection looks very brutal and anesthetic.

Instead, why not make a circle in the middle with a green landscape of palms including a new green pedestrian crosswalk, lined with trees to soften the area?
properties.title: Soft Crossings for Miami!
properties.details:
The new green circle crossing would give a signal for protection and safety, shade, soft touch to the environment ( which are us people ) and provide as a landmark between Brickell Ave and Key Bicayne. 

PS: The bike path and landscaping along the ocean shore is very nice, though it would not hurt to continue in the same manner with trees after the Sea Aquarium so one can bike in safety and shade to the end of Key Biscayne :-)

properties.description:
Upgrade the  existing pedestrian crossings on Brickell Bay Drive with signage, markings, and lights.  Use raised and well-marked pedestrian crossings to force vehicles to slow down. 

Enforce current speed limit with signage and blinking speed indicators like the ones on Brickell Avenue.
properties.title: Pedestrian Safety on Brickell Bay Drive
properties.details: ... cross Brickell Bay Drive with safety, without the constant fear of being struck by a speeding vehicle.

properties.description: Add protective barriers along Julia Tuttle Causeway for bike riders. As it exists now, there is nothing between the speeding cars and cyclists. This is dangerous!
properties.title: Bike without fear
properties.details: Adding a barrier will help us cyclists feel safe enough to ride our bikes to and from Miami and Miami Beach. This will also encourage more people to ride their bikes over the causeway. Healthy, enjoyable, and better for the environment!

comments.comment: YASSSS!!!!! I always thought it was a shame more people/bikers cannot use such a beautiful stretch of land....
Yep!
YES YES YES! maybe something like this http://www.cyclehoop.com/product/cycle-access-and-facilities/armadillos/

A better bikeway is needed here. 
It might be more effective to build it on the south side of the existing barrier.
Hey Prem... yes yes yes! We need this.
I agree we need much more space for cyclists
three cheers for this idea

properties.description: The width of the road and the radii of the turns indicate high speeds.  With signs existing on US-1 close to the corner, do motorists have enough time to react?  Reducing the width of the roadway,a road-diet, might serve to heighten the awareness and sensitivity of those who pass through this interchange.  The proposal here is to thin the intersection slightly, so that users of the path and roadways are traveling at a slower speed and are attune to the traffic calming measures.
properties.title: Safety FIRST
properties.details: Arrive safely.  People should feel safe crossing most streets, if they're obeying traffic laws and regulations.  We believe that more people would embrace the decision to cross multimodal paths if users were traveling at slower rates of speed.

comments.comment: Hi, I was actually noticing the width of the roads down coral way and miller drive and other avenues... They are wide because the law states cyclist are to use the roads. I would suggest adding the signs of "Share the Road" and painting the symbols on the roads, that will help cyclists eventually. By narrowing the roads and adding the bike lanes there the cars will have no choice but to share. I agree with you that the cars come at us in turns fast and the way that the pedestrian and bike paths along US1 and the MPath are inconveniently hazardous for the people on foot/bike.

properties.description: There's currently a free standing curb that is a danger to pedestrians, bicyclists, and anyone who doesn't see it.  It seems to only serve the purpose of dissuading motor vehicles from passing through, so it would seem logical that an improved solution would eliminate the danger of the free standing curb, continue to prevent autos from accessing the thruway from the corner and increase the  overall beauty of the space.  The proposed solution removes the curb and installs a planter so that pedestrians and bikes can still pass through, the danger of the curb is removed and the the motor vehicles are still prevented from access, all in a bundle that increases the general beauty of the corner because of the added planter and vegetation.
properties.title: Safe Passage:  Obstacle Removal, Planter Installation
properties.details: This proposal should be done so that: the general public and all users of the space are more safe, the area can be beautified and improved aesthetically and the M-PATH corridor will be further improved and quality and character of this node accentuated.

comments.comment: Good idea and reduces loitering and clutter

properties.description: There exists an ideal Courtyard  Garden that sits in the middle a beautiful Spanish style edifice, as well as a large parking lot between two buildings. The  addition of brilliant colors, stage, lighting, and sound could  transform this space into a true gathering place for our children and youth that is safe, educational and entertaining. Working in cooperation with an organization focusing on these types of endeavors across the country for the past 25 years, Partners for Sacred Places, we feel confident that the doors to the community  will be opened and the impact will be felt for years to come.
properties.title: Innercity Arts Project
properties.details: With the reduction in school  budgets and economic challenges, many of our children and youth in Innercity do not have opportunity to be inspired, engaged and interested in the arts. The immediate target population would be families in the 33142 zip code, where  the  median household income is $26,484 and 35% of residents have income below the poverty line. Theatre, Dance and Music of varied genres would be  introduced, shared, and taught by those willing to give back to Our Miami and to impact the lives of our young people.

properties.description: To transform an empty 6000 sq ft lot in the heart of Downtown Miami, on historic Flagler St., into a grassy outdoor public theater for wall casting family friendly films at night; host plays; present dance performances, live music, etc. The empty lot, which won't require much detailing, would act as a cultural component to the historic Olympia Theater at the Gusman, a mere block away, whilst enhancing the potential future of Miami's budding Downtown district. This cultivation project aims to stimulate community growth in an otherwise bleak zone of Downtown through family gatherings & events.
properties.title: Ad Hoc Cinema: an outdoor gathering house; wall casting films from around the world & more!
properties.details: While other major cities have successfully revitalized their Urban centers, Miami's Downtown district has yet to fully integrate a healthy circuit of cultural activities after normal business hours. Ad Hoc Cinema would provide a healthy anecdote to this ongoing dilemma, by creating a destination for the surrounding communities to gather throughout the week. A successful model for this project is the Soundscape Cinema Series, located on the grounds of the New World Symphony in Miami Beach. This "free" family friendly outdoor event has become the longest running wall cast series in S. Florida, and has spawned others like it around the greater Miami area.

comments.comment: I would love to go to something like that!
Great concept. You have my full support.
Perfect place for a low-cost outdoor theater! We have thought the same thing for years!

properties.description:
Off SW 1st Court & SW 7th Street there is a grassy area where the M-Path trail comes to a dead end at the Miami River. You can take a left and there is a river walk to The Latitude residential building; however to the right, the river walkway has not yet been developed.

This is a beautiful public space area with benches and gorgeous view. Unfortunately not many people go back here and the there is only one fairly new restaurant "The Fox Hole" currently in business. 

I think that creating a Saturday market with fresh veggies, crafts, art, & food where the M-Path ends could attract people , business, and raise awareness and push for the trail along the Miami River to be completed to allow for pedestrian connectivity in downtown Miami.
properties.title: Greenway Riverday
properties.details:
Creating a Saturday Market in the north end of Brickell along the Miami river where the M-Path ends would bring people together to enjoy an existing public space. People could sell/buy local fruits & Vegetables, foods, crafts, and art while enjoying views of the Miami River. This area is accessible via the M-Path and the Brickell Metrorail station, metromover, and Trolly. 

This event could bring more business to this area that currently has low traffic of pedestrians.

comments.comment: Great idea!  The intersection of the M-Path and the Miami River Greenway could be a super activity center.
The link above is to a larger scale Saturday market I used to go to growing up in Alaska. Just an example of types of activities that could occur.

properties.submitter_name: TJ Marston / WALK Landscape + Urban Design
properties.description: The aim of this project is to challenge the question of a temporal PLAYscape acting as a catalyst for urban growth. The site is the host of numerous Art exhibitions during this time drawing thousands of people and economic benefit to the area. During the event the tents are placed on permanent poured concrete slabs. However, during the remaining 11 months of the year, the slabs lie vacant and fenced. No trespassing. Our idea to improve the area is to activate the site during the remaining 11 months of the year with temporary recreational and programmed events. The temporary PLAYscape will house a skate park, hard-court soccer fields, basketball courts, volleyball courts, batting cages, mini golf, along with plaza and outdoor market space.
properties.title: Trespass
properties.details: The people of Midtown and the surrounding communities of Wynwood and Edgewater lack recreational space. With access to this large vacant site and minimal improvements, the site could serve as a recreation hub for the area and catalyst for urban growth. This can be achieved with simple interventions such as paint, lighting, movable equipment and furniture. The planting could be donated by the property owner and serve as a nursery for future development of the sites.

comments.comment: I agree with the need for utilization of this space and really like this idea.
AWESOMENESS - we need more open spaces like this in Miami

This is a big idea that can be achieved with the right support and low budget. The residents in this area lack open active, passive and recreational spaces and must stare at this void throughout most of the year. Great way to lure in prospect residents to area!

properties.description: make the public realm more accommodating to persons who are deaf, blind or have other similar disabilities.Deaf and blind persons have unique needs in public spaces that may not be addressed by requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act.Spatial orientation and awareness are particularly important to maintaining a sense of well-being, so it's critical that spaces be open and free from barriers in 360 degrees. For example, curved walkways at corners are much better than right angles.  Providing landscaping and lighting at the edge of sidewalks better define the public realm and make it safer for those who are disabilities.  Signage can be provided in braille.The project would be to implement such improvements within the project area.
properties.title: North Miami Streetscape improvements to accommodate disabilities and all members
properties.details: start developing the public's awareness. Especially public spaces should be planned for all persons, including those with unique needs or disabilities. By focusing on one public area and drawing attention to their purpose, these guidelines could start to be implemented more broadly in public places.

comments.comment: Alexis - these are much more in depth than the ADA requires, and would both be aesthetically pleasing and Functional.  Excellent Alexis
Wow!! a great idea!!!
these are great ideas! we would all benefit from these ideas in North Miami
I am so proud of you Alexis. Such a great idea!!!
i AM ALWAYS PROUD OF YOU ALEXIS
This a very good idea Alexis many individuals with disabilities may experience balance  and physical problem as well ; So is important to make the environment safer.
This is a wonderful idea to accommodate people with disabilities and all members of our community .Great Job!!!!
Great Job Alexis
Awesome!!! Good Job!
What a great concept!
Great Job Alexis!
Excellent!  Go Alexis!
So proud of this site!

properties.description:
Fort Dallas Park is an important historic site – part of the actual birthplace of the City of Miami. At the park, the Miami River is just about the width of the Grand Canal in Venice – with historic Downtown Miami on the north bank and Brickell on the south.  So why not a GondolaFest transporting passengers from Fort Dallas Park to the landing at the Miami Circle in Brickell?

Fort Dallas Park includes the Palm Cottage, which is listed on the National Register and designated locally as a historic landmark. Palm Cottage was one of at least thirty houses built for workers constructing Henry Flagler's Royal Palm Hotel, formerly located at the mouth of the River and the terminus of Flagler's Florida East Coast Railway.
properties.title: GondolaFest at Fort Dallas Park
properties.details:
. . . experience, if only for a day, the physical relationship between Miami’s historic Downtown and Brickell, not from high up on a bridge in the midst of noisy traffic, but from the river’s edge.  The GondolaFest would be a celebration of Miami’s rich history and provide fun for the whole family.  The festival might be developed as a new component of the Annual Downtown Miami Riverwalk Festival and would connect Miami River Greenway sections on both sides of the river BY WATER! 

In the year 2000, Mayor Richard Daley brought gondolas to the Chicago River (pictured above), so why not Miami?

comments.comment: I love this idea!!
I like this idea.  Is there any way to receive information about when this would be taking place so that me and my wife might participate - Troy.goings@gmail.com

properties.submitter_name: Alicia Levy (Liberty City resident; Board of Directors, Miami Children’s Initiative)
properties.description: Wouldn’t it be nice to sit and smell the flowers? This empty lot could be improved by establishing a covered, outdoor seating area. Comfortable benches could be set up in a circular arrangement, and a covering could be built that would have floral vines growing throughout it.  This would not only provide much-needed shade to Liberty City residents such as myself, but it would also be visually pleasing and good for the environment. This project would be in collaboration with the Liberty City Collaborative and Miami Children's Initiative.
properties.title: Sit and Smell the Flowers
properties.details: Our neighborhood needs outdoor seating.  This covered seating area would give us an enjoyable way to get outdoors and engage with each other. Providing shade would allow us to take advantage of the area throughout the day and during the summer as well. In addition, all age groups can enjoy this space. By setting it up in a circular fashion, kids could play in the middle and allow parents to keep an eye on them. And who doesn’t like to look up and see a bunch of beautiful flowers!

comments.comment: Great idea.  This would help increase Miami-Dade's tree canopy which is one of lowest in the country
Lovely - promotes our connection to nature and our own human nature.
Love this idea! So needed!
Great place to be quite.
A beautiful idea!

properties.description:
The Borscht Film Festival presents short film screenings, introduces regional filmmakers to Miami and will introduce a feature length film at this year’s events.

Our festival has been wildly successful, showing to packed crowds at the New World Symphony Wall, the Gusman, & the Arsht. For this year’s festival, we would like to space-make, allowing attendees & Miami citizens to re-imagine the potential of the Miami Marine Stadium as a venue for not just concerts & sporting events, but also Film Screenings. 

By collaborating with the city & Friends of Miami Marine Stadium, we will assist in beautifying and making it functional & safe for events to take place in, near or around the stadium, bringing more attention to an iconic Miami venue
properties.title: Waterfront Film Festival to renew Miami Marine Stadium as a unique event venue in Miami!
properties.details:
By hosting a major event in front of or in the stadium, the general public would be able to reimagine an iconic structure & it’s functionality for future events, especially those relating to film. 

Tours are given at the stadium during the day but it is generally off limits at night. Attendees will be surrounded by water taking in a reimagined classic Miami film, all with the beautiful backdrop of downtown’s skyline. 

Any funds raised during the event would directly benefit the Friends of Miami Marine Stadium’s efforts to rehabilitate the landmark venue, as we would put them towards restoration, beautification & safety efforts for the event.

properties.description: Installing "Big Belly" solar waste compactors on the two blocks of Surfside's downtown.
properties.title: Fill the Belly ~ "Big Belly" Solar Waste Compactors
properties.details: The continuing revitalization of Surfside's two block downtown is bringing area residents and visitors alike to this quaint seaside community. With increased pedestrian traffic comes increase trash. "Big Belly" solar waste compactors educate people on recycling while being environmentally friendly themselves.

properties.description: The entrance to the Miami-Dade County Public Schools main building located at 1450 on NE 2nd Avenue is not very representative of the outbreak of art-conscious revitalization this neighborhood district is currently undergoing. We would like to create a Neighborhood Art Atrium to be enjoyed by all including the installation of seating and tables, a small stage, bike racks, and plants. We will hold a student mural design competition judged by a board of local Wynwood mural artists who would select a winner and mentor him or her through the process of painting the mural. The mural would be inspired by the recent Broad Prize Award in Education, whose sculpture design was created by artist Tom Otterness, famous for New York subway installations.
properties.title: The Neighborhood Art Atrium
properties.details: The community would benefit by a lively city streetscape that would complement other landmarks in the vibrant Wynwood and Performing Arts District neighborhoods in its vicinity. The atrium’s stage would be a new site in the community for outdoor events to be held. M-DCPS and other neighborhood employees would have an outdoor area to enjoy breaks since many workers in the area already come to the M-DCPS employee cafeteria for economically-priced meals. All visitors would be welcomed by a public space that would now fit right in with the ever-changing artsy neighborhood around it.

comments.comment: This is sorely needed in this neighborhood! The buildings around it are blossoming and with incessant budget cuts to the school district, it becomes increasingly difficult to conduct vital upkeep of M-DCPS buildings.

properties.submitter_name: AMAR SAWHNEY,PROFESSOR OF ARCHITECTURE, MIAMI DADE COLLEGE
properties.description: My idea is to bring people of all faith in a creative space, my students have been working in a design studio over 4 years on this public space project. The important point is to develop a centrist urban space for all people of all faith can experience a sustainable urban space in downtown Miami near wolf son Campus. The site is between NE 3rd st and NE 3rd street next to metro mover.
properties.title: SUSTAINABLE PEACE CENTER
properties.details:
MIAMI NEED A PUBLIC SPACE WHERE PEOPLE FROM ALL RACES CAN ENJOY PUBLIC SPACE  AND COMMUNICATE WITH EACH OTHER AS PEOPLE DO IN  London AND ROME.
STUDENTS WERE ASKED TO CREATE AN URBAN SPACE NEXT TO WOLFSON CAMPUS.

comments.comment: I love this idea!
Downtown is the perfect location for this peace center. The concept to bring people together is commendable.

Dear Carla,  an aesthetic design that inspires unity. Well wishes. 
dhsnova08@aol.com
Align w/ the Peace Center!

properties.description: Replace two blocks of Surfside's downtown with permeable sidewalk pavers.
properties.title: Flowing Underfoot ~ permeable sidewalk pavers.
properties.details: Enjoy an enhanced pedestrian experience while creating a better system for water absorption.

properties.description: During 2013, The Olympia at Gusman Center began the instantly popular “Jazz Lounge” series. Boasting free admission, cocktails, and some of the best jazz ensembles around, the Jazz Lounge attracts over 100 individuals to downtown Miami on second Wednesday evenings between 6 and 9 pm. The main lobby is transformed into a cabaret with tables and a small stage; providing an intimate performance venue. The events are free and open to the public and can accommodate audiences of up to 250 individuals on the lower level of the theater’s main lobby.
properties.title: Lobby Lounge at the Olympia Theater at Gusman Center
properties.details: The Olympia Theater in the heart of downtown Miami was Miami’s first cultural center, circa 1926. The Olympia is a living symbol of all that is positive and progressive in The Magic City. This national treasure will mark its 89th anniversary in 2015. At that time The Olympia will expand its “In the Lobby Lounge…” series to include programming on all Wednesday evenings—a traditionally dark night in theaters. Jazz will continue on the second Wednesday of the month, with other performing arts genes, including singer/songwriter, edgy/comedy, and spoken word/poetry, each taking one Wednesday monthly.

comments.comment: Absolutely LOVE this idea. This historic gem is the ideal place for Downtowners to gather after hours for live jazz
Fantastic!  I  agree!
That would be amazing. The Olympia Theater is such a great venue for that.
Check out pics from previous Wednesdays at http://ow.ly/vzWZn

I have been to the Wednesday events and think that the idea of opening the theatre mid-week for cocktails and a little light entertainment--FOR FREE--is a wonderful service for downtown residents and people who work downtown.

properties.description: The Miami Design District in the 41st Street area!
properties.title: Creating an Urban Edge
properties.details: Urban space is valuable real estate and too much of it is underused. UrbanEdge is a collection of landscape framing and furniture elements designed specifically to help designers make more effective use of under utilized space. The collection looks at the urban fabric with a fresh eye. Informal, dynamic site elements including bar height rails, stools that swivel, and planters that also serve as seats, define edges, activate corners, create niches and furnish lively outdoor settings that leverage available space and create a sense of place.

comments.comment: This just invites people to come and check out the space, what a cool product!
Gorgeous.  Can I move there?
What a space, love it!

properties.description: provide ADA accessibility to the park, which has a nature trail leading to views of the adjacent canal with seating areas for “creative thinking and writing” such as poetry.  The area provides a unique nature trail feeling in a local suburban neighborhood.
properties.title: Poetry Park
properties.details: ALL enjoy the park and quality of life in the Miami Lakes community.

properties.submitter_name: Theodora Long/GROVE PARK HOMEOWNERS ASSOCIATION, INC.
properties.description:
Chain-link fences with locked gates are stopping Miami-Dade residents and visitors to open spaces along the Miami River. 

Our idea for improvement is for these enclosed areas to be opened to the residents and visitors of Miami-Dade County so they may enjoy the waterfront of the Miami River.   

There is over eight acres of covenant designated public donated land preserved for public use that is now closed to the public.  This land could become part of the Miami River Greenway from N. W. 12 Court to N. W. 15 Avenue.  This land also encompasses under the SR 836 Expressway.

properties.details:
The Miami River residents near this area, are an urban community with thousands of under-served families.  It would allow for leisure, relaxing moments for these families to sit along the waterfront.  These families do not have much greenery surrounding them in the inner city and this would provide a much needed paradise.   It would also serve as a example of various marine related job opportunities to the younger inner city students watching the tug boats, large freighters, 
yachts, sailboats, fishing boats, etc.  

Grove Park is a historic neighborhood along the Miami River.  We would like to make this vista open to all our neighbors in the surrounding Little Havana area.

properties.description:
Host a Miami Bike Festival at Tropical Park to promote biking throughout the community. The event will act as a celebration of biking culture, encourage youth engagement, and foster awareness about biking safety. Considering the many biking organizations and events throughout Miami, such a festival would provide an arena where the community as a whole could congregate to watch, participate, interact, and share the joys of cycling. 

Possible Events & Activities:
Paved and Off Road Trail Rides
Cycling Games and Activities
Teaching Station for Kids 
Family Bike Rentals
Bike Decorating Stations
Biker Awareness Safety Campaigns
On Site Repair and Tuning
Antique Bike Show
On Site Bike Store
Host a Race/Miami Bike Polo
properties.title: Miami Bike Festival
properties.details: By bringing together cycling enthusiasts from our community we are not only celebrating the joy of biking but also making the streets safer, encouraging a healthy and environtmentally friendly mode of transportation, and making it more accesible for everyone. Currently there are several cycling organizations such as Emerge Miami, Miami Bike Scene, Miami Bike Polo, as well as thousands of passionate bikers. By providing them with a day to gather and enjoy their hobby together, show off their bikes, teach their kids, and share with friends, we can create an event that can have a lasting impact on the community. The more organized we are as a community the more recognized and respected we will be on the streets.

comments.comment: Love the idea! This is something that is really needed to help move the biking community forward in Miami. Hope to see it come to fruition!

properties.description: is to create a “zen” place where residents can “get lost” in their own Triangles. These unused lots sit on prime real estate with a local density of approximately 5,000 residents within just a few blocks. The Triangles would feature walking trails of mulch, designated “earthing/grounding” areas of grass, stones, sand & soil where they can walk barefoot (without having to worry about pet feces), a walking meditation labyrinth and native flora and plants to encourage mindfulness practices. The lots can also be programmed with group meditations/yoga. Modern science has thoroughly documented the connection between inflammation and all of the chronic diseases, including the diseases of aging and the aging process itself.
properties.title: Biscayne Zen Gardens
properties.details: have a peaceful place to reconnect w/ the Earth & quiet their minds, restoring balance in the mind & body. The process of grounding/earthing & walking meditations reduce stress & have been scientifically proven to have multiple health benefits. When you ground to the electron-enriched earth, an improved balance of the sympathetic/parasympathetic nervous system occurs (systems that determine if you’re operating in permanent stress-mode or not). Earth is a natural source of electrons, essential for proper functioning of immune systems, circulation, synchronization of biorhythms and other physiological processes and may actually be the most effective, essential, least expensive & easiest to attain antioxidant.

properties.description:
Tactical urbanism (TU) is a form of rapid prototyping in the urban environment. Parklets, intersection repairs, guerilla gardens, and other TU interventions serve as minimum viable products that quickly validate an idea, test its impact, and hopefully catalyze a long-term solution. 

TU projects are often considered to be “lighter, quicker, cheaper” to implement than the more permanent infrastructure they hope to inspire. However, many of tools and materials necessary to deploy TU interventions are often out of reach. The Tactical Urbanism Arsenal would serve as a collection of equipment and resources for those seeking to use TU to improve their neighborhoods and communities.
properties.title: The Tactical Urbanism Arsenal
properties.details:
The Tactical Urbanism Arsenal (The Arsenal), seeks to be a self-sustaining lending library for the tools and equipment necessary to implement TU projects in the Miami area. Rentals from the Arsenal would fall into two categories: 1. tools (power tools, safety signage, etc.)  2. Ready-to-deploy TU equipment such as temporary crosswalks, planter box barriers, parklet decking, etc. 

Revenue from rentals would help fund community TU workshops.

Funds from the PS Challenge would help to establish a pilot year for the Tactical Urbanism Arsenal (find space, create an initial set of TU materials, and launch a website). Among other community projects, the Arsenal would directly support fellow PS Challenge winners.

properties.description: Is to make this pair of under-utilized and often trashed public lots into true public spaces by adding small but popular, recreational installations such as tables, chairs, chess tables (designed in partnership with local artists), wooden sun chaises for lounging and sunbathing, bike racks, mulched walking paths, native flora (including a mini butterfly garden), swings for the trees and picnic tables to demonstrate how a few simple, yet multi-generational and XX items can activate an empty lot. The project would also demonstrate using the already planted trees for much needed shaded areas in sunny Miami. Parks & Rec maintains MPP so it’s hopefully not too much of a hassle to maintain these two small lots a block away, long-term.

There are approximately 5000 residents w/in a few block radius of North Bayshore Drive, between 17th - 20th streets & another couple few thousand are added from the three major hotels within 2 blocks and other locals who come from outside this area for the park and water access. While MPP is amazing, there are not enough resources to satisfy this dense population. Additionally, it would add some life and color to the back of the buildings, where residents often pass by on the way to local transit as well as the local Publix & local restaurants/shops on Biscayne between 17th + 19th streets, where right now all they see are empty lots that sit along Biscayne.

properties.submitter_name: Katherine Irene Cespedes- Miami Dade College
properties.description: This project takes as its model one of the most culturally and intellectually rich historical centers in my childhood's homeland--El Correo Central de Lima, Peru. Structured much like the Government Center, el Correo Central had ample open spaces for people of all walks of life to meet. Unlike the Government Center though, el Correo Central teemed with resources for visitors to learn about the city's cultural, intellectual and artistic heritage. It housed scores of news-stands and sitting areas for people to pick a book on any subject and explore it in depth. These news-stands and sitting areas in turn, made of el Centro a hub of intellectual life, literacy and cultural enrichment for all. Government center can also become exactly that.
properties.title: Miami Meets World in Just One Spot: Government Center Goes Global in Mind, Heart and Spirit
properties.details: By setting up news-stands and sitting areas--that are much like a massive Barnes-and-Nobles--we provide intellectual and interactive resources for visitors to learn about Miami's rich history, arts and culture. And in so doing, we are insidiously driving cultural change from the ground up...While Miami has long been criticized by the Northeast of the country as "shallow" and "intellectually bland," a colorful but contained environment that provides world-class intellectual and cultural resources in print, free live performances and facilities in which to nurture an intellectual life--7days a week, 365 days a year--will transform Miami into the new Cambridge of the South. The world, indeed, will be visiting it for creative inspiration...

properties.description: Despite its name-only status as a Veterans Park for 40 years, very few  know about Wayside Veterans Park and almost no one uses this beautiful, undeveloped gem on US 1. Along with with proposed Dog Park enhancements by the Village of Pinecrest , there should be more than the current sad little simple plaque.  Seating, educational displays, a memorial wall, and ADA-compliant access in a new Veterans Reflection area of the park would create a real memorial. Flags representing the military branches would raise visibility to thousands that pass by daily on US 1. We must improve this embarrassing lack of recognition as people finally begin to use  it as a community gathering place. The least used park in Pinecrest, this space such potential.
properties.title: Honor Miami-Dade County's First Veterans Dog Park with Meaningful Memorial
properties.details: Come out and enjoy a highly-demanded amenity (dog park), and also remember and learn about those that sacrificed so much. Veterans Dog Parks are a growing trend statewide and nationally. What better way to honor our veterans than a vibrant, living space full of families and their pets, enjoying their freedom in the Florida sunshine. A plaque is not a memorial, especially if there is no handicapped access! It is obvious that the memorial aspect is grossly inadequate, if this beautiful park can “hide in plain sight” on a major highway for decades. Surely there are artistic, creative ways to activate the memorial as a destination. The dog park is expected to be wildly popular, and our veterans  deserve a first-class memorial along with it.

properties.description:
This proposal contemplates the  creation of a OPEN  gallery whose content will be curated by attendees themselves. This will be Miami contemporary “Salon des Refuses”. Everyone would be welcome to contribute and exhibit work of different media without  necessarily its inclusion be mediated by a curator or museum staff. The themes could be announced beforehand but also there could be more flexibility regarding the media and themes this space will broaden the definition and scope of the established gallery spaces and provide a venue to people to network and let their work shown. 
This intermittent gallery will float throughout different public  spaces in Miami there could be gallery happenings from Mary Brickell  to South Miami.

properties.details: broaden their understanding of art or what makes art . A place that is democratic , welcoming and inclusive where they can exchange ideas about their work and others.

properties.submitter_name: The School of Communication Norton Herrick Center for Motion Picture Studies at the University of Miami
properties.description: A four-film series  to be screened in the outdoor courtyard of the Glenn H. Curtiss Mansion and Gardens in Miami Springs. The movies would be linked by themes related to the achievements of aviator, inventor, and developer Glenn Curtiss as well as to the South Florida land boom of the 1920s. On the National Register of Historic Places and owned by Miami Springs, the Pueblo Revival-style Curtiss Mansion is seeking ways to heighten its public profile and provide education about the accomplishments of Curtiss. (He developed  Hialeah, Opa-locka, and Miami Springs in the 1920s.) The series includes three silent films (Wings, The Thief of Bagdad, and It), with live musical accompaniment (by Frost School of Music)  and the sound film Cocoanuts.
properties.title: MOVIES AT THE CURTISS MANSION: RECALLING THE LAND BOOM ERA
properties.details: Come together in a collective environment to view historically significant films as they simultaneously experience this unique built environment. Bringing large groups of people into public spaces is fast becoming a lost cinematic practice. There would also  be at least two educational components, as each film would be introduced and discussed by a cultural expert in addition to a brief presentation addressing Curtiss's  contributions and/or relevance to the program. This film series would fulfill a core mission of the UM's Norton Herrick Center, which is to provide educational enrichment to the South Florida  community and advance the study of film and media.

properties.description: Our idea is to create a Chess Park in Florida City. Permanent chess tables would be installed in an existing park, or in one of the many empty lots in the City. The Florida City Chess Park will feature permanent chess tables where spectators are always welcome and open tables are free for public use. It is a well documented fact that playing chess can have beneficial effects on learning and development, especially when it's played from a young age. Chess can also: raise IQ, help prevent Alzheimer's, increase creativity, improve memory, improve concentration, increase problem-solving skills, and more...
properties.title: Florida City Chess Park
properties.details:
A Chess Park in Florida City will attract and engage community members across the spectrum of generations, backgrounds and nationalities. Schools can organize Chess Competitions; neighbors can congregate together to play and share quality time together, retired citizens can connect with other members of the community and also teach the younger members how to play the game. These strategic connections and new relationships will also help to unify the community and create more user-friendly spaces in Florida City.

A Chess Park in the city of South Florida would benefit everyone!!!
