properties.description: Is to create a Civic Plaza for the citizens of Key Biscayne. The space was designed to reflect the tropical island’s laid-back lifestyle: water, casual movable seating, and trees and palms to provide shaded areas. In essence, the water, coconut palms and tropical hammock trees represent the historical background of Key Biscayne as a barrier island and coconut plantation. Fish and turtle shell tiles (art in public space) as well as native rocks are also some of the materials incorporated into the design to be reminiscent of Key Biscayne’s history.
properties.title: CIVIC CENTER PARK KEY BISCAYNE
properties.details: Conceived as a space for all age groups to gather and provide opportunities for different activities such as games, informal concerts, or other civic activities. This space, now a fenced dog park, could be the “living room” for the Key Biscayne family, with an interactive fountain for children, a place to sit and relax,  and perhaps have a coffee or ice cream. In short, the plaza  will help people reconnect with nature and each other, in a lush green tropical oasis.

comments.comment: A tremendous concept to enliven a relatively "empty" space.  An outdoor "living room", which emphasizes our sub-tropical environment, is a perfect solution of landscaping, shade, textures, views, & passive activities!

properties.description: Imagine being able to play a video game while you wait at a Metrorail stop, or while you are lounging at sunset on a blanket in the middle of South Pointe Park.  Now imagine being able to play with anyone sitting and standing around you.  A multiplayer game experience can create connections between community members while also bringing simple entertainment to our county’s parks and public spaces. The game would be controller with a player's smart phone with the larger game happening with a big screen projection or monitor.
properties.title: Atlantis Cinema - A Massively Local Multiplayer Game Experience
properties.details: I want to give the community a reason to get together and interact with each other by playing a game, and also revitalize underutilized spaces.  All you need is your smartphone.  Starting with public spaces such as the North Beach Band Shell and Southside Park, people can join together in a public space to play a game that is simple, not language specific, and appeals to anyone looking for something fun to do.

properties.description:
The idea is to create a permanent life size chess park design for public and student  recreation. 

The Life Size Chess Park would consist of a permanent giant outdoor chessboard made of black and white tile squares and life size ( 4-6 ft King ) chess pieces. Staggered stadium benches at each end will allow folks to see over one another and the giant chess pieces, so as to understand and enjoy the game.
properties.title: Life Size Chess Park Design
properties.details:
The Life Size Chess Park is a part of our commitment to encouraging the FIU community to utilize outdoor green spaces and take part in activities that will allow them to grow in a holistic manner. Playing chess is a way for young people to enhance their critical thinking skills, and to be part of a goal-oriented community that gives them the confidence needed to succeed in school. The idea is also to attract our local farmers market to hold their weekly gatherings there as well. 

As part of the area enhancement, FIU would provide landscaping surrounding the Chess Park, thus adding a complete therapeutic, enjoyable and sustainable environment.

properties.description:
As the sun sets later each day it brings with it the desire to spend every possible moment outside. 
Summer Movie Nights @ Our Biscayne will transform 4 parking lots along south Biscayne Boulevard in Downtown Miami into outdoor movie theaters for one spectacular night. Pack a picnic, a blanket or your favorite beach chair and spend the evening sipping local brews as you take in one of your favorite films on a big, outdoor screen. This free admission event will bring together film enthusiasts, families and downtowners alike.
properties.title: Summer Movie Nights @ Our Biscayne
properties.details: With no more Miami Heat games to attend, you’ll be looking for something fun to do after work. Summer Movie Nights @ Our Biscayne will provide you with an evening of entertainment, a great first date venue, and a place to meet your friends for a cold one. We’ll again partner with the DDA, the City of Miami, and the Miami Parking Authority on this project. Roll out the red carpet and get ready for movies like the unforgettably terrifying Jaws, everyone’s favorite alien E.T. and 1985’s highest grossing film, Back to the Future.

comments.comment: Wow, love it!
Movies in Bryant Park is one of the most popular and awesome summer offerings in NYC. I've no doubt this would get the same reception. Great idea!
Fantastic idea!  Living in DT, It would be nice to lot have to drive to sobe or coconut grove to go to the movie.
Everyone likes a good movie!
I like it!!! It is in my neighborhood so really hope you win!

properties.description:
The Ludlam Trail is a 6.2 mile corridor runs through the heart of Miami-Dade County, and together with the M-Path and South Dade Trail, would form an uninterrupted regional trail network from Homestead to Downtown Miami to Flagami. It directly connects to 4 schools, 3 major regional parks, and dozens of neighborhoods, and will reach over 34,000 residents who live within ½ mile. 

While implementation of the trail is a long term goal, in the short term the idea for the Open Space Challenge would be a pop-up trail from SW 60 Street to SW 66 Street. The trail would convert the former rail corridor to make the space usable by local residents.
properties.title: Pop-up Trail
properties.details: People will be able to use the trail to run, walk their dogs, or go for a stroll! Children will be able to walk to/from school safely and avoid Miami traffic.

comments.comment: I like it.

properties.submitter_name: Interact Club , Cutler Bay Academy of Advanced Studies
properties.description:
Turn the large empty space adjacent to Miami Heights Elementary School at 17661 SW 117th Ave, 
Miami Heights, 33177-2324, into both a chess park with umbrella shaded tables with permanently affixed chess boards  surrounding a children's playground using construction cast-offs on the other.
properties.title: Intergenerational Activity Park
properties.details: Young children could play in the park while older children, parents and grandparents could enjoy playing checkers or chess and, if needed, watch over the younger children at play.  The school could be encouraged to develop a chess team to compete within the school or with other schools.

comments.comment: Mary, we corrected the map location for you!
I placed the marker at the wrong place.  How can I move it to the correct address?

properties.description: Install a mini-park, gathering and rest area here.
properties.title: Time : To Meet
properties.details: Rest in the shade.  Collect yourselves until you meet with others.  Small, unique, activated nodes allow for easy reference, making for wonderful gathering spaces.  This particular area would not need a large-scale gathering area, and may be more comfortable and enticing to passerby if a smaller scaled spatial hierarchy subdivided pockets of the mini-park for only a few people, so that it's not a space to accommodate maximum capacity but a place for clusters with levels of privacy.

properties.description: Our idea is to create a "Walking Labyrinth" at the "Mayor Roscoe Warren Municipal Park" in Homestead. This project would be fairly easy to implement and it's basically maintenance free. A labyrinth is a meditation tool consisting of a walkable single line path. Walking the labyrinth reduces stress and quiets the mind, it offers a sense of clarity, peace and serenity. Walking a labyrinth can help center the person or help resolve inner discomfort and still the mind. This park is already popular but its use hasn't been maximized.
properties.title: WALKING MEDITATION LABYRINTH
properties.details: Labyrinths have been around since ancient times. Today, you can find labyrinths in many sites, medical centers, parks, schools, prisons, playgrounds, retreat centers and hospitals. A labyrinth in Homestead would offer the community a place to gather and be peaceful. It would be an inviting way to exercise outdoors in nature, a calm environment, a place where people could regain balance. Labyrinths appeal to people from all backgrounds and walks of life, so a labyrinth in the Homestead community would be of benefit to everyone.

comments.comment: Love it!
Awesome idea!! =)
Serenity gotta love that concept. Fred Unconditional LOVE
Oh, Suzanne, I totally agree that this would be a great addition!  I hope you get to do it!

properties.submitter_name: Ray Breslin, Collins Park Neighborhood Association
properties.description: Collins Park is the epicenter for Art and Culture in Miami Beach and the center of the Collins Park Neighborhood; home to Miami City Ballet, The Bass Museum of Art, The Miami Beach Regional Library, SoBe Institute of the Arts, the Botanical Garden and the Holocaust Memorial and yet there is no cohesive programming to activate the Park. Collins Park ArtScape is trademarked and currently on the first Friday of each month along with the Museum's "Beats after Sunset".  We want to add programming to the park to coincide with this monthly neighborhood event and then grow it from there. All the needed infastructure  is in place. Our collective desire is there. All we need is the seed money to get it started. Miami Foundation can give us that seed.
properties.title: Collins Park ArtScape is way more than just a walk in the park. It eclipses all art forms.
properties.details: Many neighborhoods have ArtWalks. Our neighborhood encompasses, visual art, dance, theater, music and much more in a small 3 square block area. That is why we trademarked Collins Park ArtScape and have already invested in a logo. However, for it to be successful. we can't just have locations around the park, we must include the park. Since the park is owned by the City and very seldom programmed, it has become a recluse for the Homeless. The Collins Park Neighborhood Association which encompasses all the cultural institutions, hotels, restaurants plus residents want to work together as a whole to program and activate this park for the community and tourists alike. We are working with the City to add activities but not any cultural programs.

properties.description: By improving the Museum of contemporary art (MOCA)’s plaza on 125th street.  Our design uses the space’s existing concentric paving pattern, but we propose removing pavers to create circular sod mounds for people to hang out while increasing green/pervious area.  By adding water jets, other “circles” will be converted into participatory fountains, activating the space and complementing the existing more contemplative water feature.  The City Hall’s façade panels will be used to display art or to host events such as movie nights adding to the already successful “Jazz at MOCA”. The idea is transforming this desolate place, lacking cohesive design into an active space that takes advantage of a prime location within this urban district.
properties.title: ACTIVATING “MOCA” PLAZA ON 125TH STREET IN NORTH MIAMI
properties.details: Come together, pause and reflect a while, people watch and get to know their fellow citizens in the community.   With a simple gesture – and relatively low installation and maintenance cost – the plaza could become part of people’s daily routine, especially if events are scheduled for community celebrations. We also hope that the playful integrative design will attract people to MOCA’s art exhibitions, and ultimately, will provide a viable civic plaza in the heart of North Miami.

comments.comment: Looks great to me!!  Is it being done?
This is an amazingly simple and elegant transformation of an important urban plaza in the heart of North Miami.

properties.description: The project is to create a small urban space that will bridge the difficult crossing of SW 8th street from the Florida International University Campus to the City of Sweetwater. The plaza will be dedicated in honor of the victims of Brothers to the Rescue. The intention is to create pedestrian friendly and bike friendly public space that will connect various forms of public transit, in what is currently a treacherous and dangerous path to cross.
properties.title: Brothers to the Rescue Memorial Plaza
properties.details: The project will create an example of high quality public space, that embraces the integration of public transit, pedestrian and bike transit. It will provide shaded seating and restore a historic bridge that crosses the Tamiami Canal. It will also become an example on how to properly beautify and engage the Canal as a flood control system for the neighborhood.

comments.comment: There is a need to set an higher quality of urban  space if you wish to properly honor the Brothers to the Rescue.  Everyone should be thankful to NC - office who did this conceptual design and Ricardo Vadia  and RRAC University Apartments, LLC who agreed to  help pay for  the effort  that  sets a high standard for others to follow.  Now it is up to Sweetwater to insist  on such design  quality or dishonor the memory.
Hope it happens
I hear there is a plan for a pedestrian bridge over 8th street. I would really like them to add bike infrastructure to the planned bridge.
Awesome!
I think this is a beautiful idea!

properties.description: Turn an ill-kept track field across from an elementary school into a simple, paved plaza with elevated stage space and room for booths and temporary structures. The plaza would provide a central location for recurring events (i.e. farmers markets) and community meetings. Neighboring schools and community groups could use the space for their events. A mural wall could encourage a new piece by local young artists yearly, and the natural green space will be a welcome change from the urban sprawl.
properties.title: A Public Plaza for Liberty City
properties.details: In years past, Liberty Square was walled off from the rest of Miami in an effort to segregate black workers from their wealthier employers. Today, Liberty City seems equally forgotten and outside of Miami's consciousness. Abandoned buildings and empty lots line the major thoroughfares and businesses are few and far between. A public plaza would help create a sense of community and unity in the face of segregation and violence, and open a space for positive and productive interaction. It could usher in new dialogue about health and safety in the neighborhood, with farmer's markets, health fairs, fitness classes, job fairs, and seminars.

properties.description: At this location, adjacent to the M-PATH, the driveway in front of the  motorcycle shop is unpaved, yet completely appropriate for a continuation of the driveway / service drive that's currently west of this location.  By simply paving the ground (where vehicles are already traveling), having an artist creatively mark the grounds and columns with motorcycle and antique car-themed art, this space can be transformed into a place where groups meet up before going out, before road trips and simply to socialize.  The motorcycle shop adjacent to this location could serve as the management and retain the organizational documents for reserving the space for one's club.  As with all public space, reserving the space would be free, but now organized.
properties.title: Moto Meet Up!
properties.details: This proposal would craft edge conditions and define a space that has been underutilized.  By formally dedicating this area as a meeting place for specially themed groups, the place can emerge as a common ground, where multiple groups share the same land.  Everyone can potentially benefit from the opportunity to use the land, and everyone can enjoy looking at both the people and their show vehicles.  Additionally, while there's a history in the motorcycle culture of turf related and segregation of groups, this concept would aim to unite groups, people and their cultures under the common interest of preserving the space and promoting the place.

properties.submitter_name: Lynn Dannheisser, Sunny Isles Beach Foundation
properties.description: Create public space in The City of Sunny Isles Beach that will use the creation of art to bring our diverse community together as a means of fostering civic dialogue & creating gathering spaces. Phase 1 involves placing art easels in Town Center Park for public use. Sunny Isles Beach is known as an urban, tourist destination that provides access to South Florida beaches, luxury dining & hotels. It also has “state of the art” park facilities. The idea is to work with the City to address its permanent population as well as the thousands of new & existing immigrants from Russia, South America & Europe who seek to make Sunny Isles Beach their home by bringing together this culturally diverse community through grassroots art programming.
properties.title: Using Art to Create Gathering Space by Placing Art Easels in Town Center Park in Sunny Isles Beach
properties.details: Gather both foreign and local residents as a community in an outdoor, public “studio” venue, accessible to anyone, to engage in the creative process and “activate” this particular public space. Phase 1 includes placing art easels in Town Center Park. They may be part of “master” art classes to be given in the future. Additional phases may include creating an “art wall” in the park to be utilized by local artists on a monthly or quarterly basis to publicly create & display their art. Once again, the idea is to engage the public in the process & create community dialogue around art, simultaneously beautifying the City’s facilities, creating a place-making activity, & drawing our diverse community together.

properties.description: The project is the renovation of the Caribbean Market Place (CMP), an iconic structure celebrating Haitian culture in the heart of Little Haiti. This anchor of the community has won the Florida Architecture Award (1990) and the National Architecture Award (1990).   The structure uniqueness lies in its history, inclusiveness, and representation of the Caribbean as a whole.   The proposed project is to fund cultural and art programming at the newly renovated Caribbean Marketplace. An Arts and Crafts venue that predominantly highlights Haitian arts and crafts alongside arts and crafts from other Caribbean countries and other cultures to reflect the true essence of Miami, a melting pot and conduit to the Caribbean.
properties.title: Caribbean Marketplace in the heart of Little Haiti
properties.details: Experience a truly Caribbean market experience via vendors selling traditional fruits and foods, handicrafts, clothing and more! The Caribbean Market Place came from the Haitian concept of “Marche en Fer”, the Iron Market in Haiti located in the capital, Port-au-Prince. The most popular outdoor market in Haiti, it attracts both Haitians and the Diaspora for a classic Haitian experience of everyday life. The CMP in Miami much like the Marche in Haiti is a place where both locals and tourists alike, come to purchase and see the creation of crafted goods and art. The location’s open floor plan would allow for large special events including conferences, community meetings and cultural activities and showcase arts and creations of the Caribbean.

comments.comment: Excited at the idea to shop at the Caribbean Market Place to purchase  authentic Haitian specialty items!
Can't wait to see the music concerts and dance performances in this great space!
An original Gigerbread House style in Miami ? It's Awesome!
It is really a good step for our community.
This venue is going to anchor Little Haiti as a hot spot for Afro- Caribbean  fun.

properties.description: The idea is to educate children in the under-served area of Allapattah about alternate forms of transportation and energy by installing an electric vehicle charging station and solar powered cell phone charging station at Moore Park, 765 NW 36 Street. The park provides thousands of children after school, camps, football, baseball, basketball and tennis. The stations will raise awareness among park users, and deepen their understanding of environmental issues confronting Miami-Dade. Situated side-by-side, the charging stations will include community seating. Bee Free Media will transport residents for free via an electric car to the neighboring communities which may not be aware of the newly renovated Moore Park, a secret gem in Miami.
properties.title: “KNOW MOORE MIAMI:” AN ALTERNATIVE TRANSPORTATION & ENERGY EDUCATION PROJECT
properties.details:
Moore Park’s community center is LEED certified. By installing the stations, park users will learn about LEED as well as alternate forms of energy and transportation. Through an interactive touch-screen dashboard users will watch videos and test their knowledge on alternative transportation and energy. 

The stations will also create a community meeting place where park users can engage in conversations and inspire youngsters to take action and become part of the solution. Because this idea is not just about observation but rather interaction, an electric car will transport residents connecting the immediate community with others in its radius including Midtown, introducing them to the resources at the Park in addition to the stations.

comments.comment: Terrific!
This is what I've been waiting for!

Great idea to go green keep Miami clean when I come visit!

Very innovative and 21st century idea that will grab the attention of our youth.

great idea!
Innovative idea- bringing the community together through green education.  Love it!
I really like this idea.  Hope they make it happen
I love Moore Park.  Great for running. Can't wait for it to re-open.
Having a place to charge my cell phone when I'm out enjoying this park is a wonderful addition.
Brilliant & Clever!  "Know Moore, Miami," to avoid no more Miami.

properties.description: Create a gathering place for the Miami businesses that have participatied in WPBTs KidVision VPK (a free online educational program for prek children) so families and children can visit them in real time. Each business would come with activites for children to do. KidVision VPK has been to 27 locations in Miami - New World Symphony, Gold Coast Railroad, Biscayne National Park, Jungle Island, Camera Copters, Zoo Miami, Marlins Park, Sun Trust Bank, Public Library, National Weather Service, Miami Science Museum, Miami GROW, ReThink & Reuse, Whole Foods, WDNA, Skyward Kites, Miami Smiles Dentistry, Miami/Dade School Bus Depot, Johnson & Wales, PAN performing arts, Miami Gymnastics, Flag & Banner Co, Lowes, Sam Ashe Music, and WPBT2.
properties.title: An Outdoor Classroom - Visit KidVision VPKs virtual field trip locations in one gathering place!
properties.details: KidVision VPK is a production of WPBT2. The program uses vitual field trips with lesson plans to teach children skills they need to start kindergarten. The gathering would bring these field trips to life both for the families that attend and the locations that have contributed to the progam by hosting a field trip. The Miami businesses could promote the event and pass out information about their location. The event would go beyond just the day itself as families can see the vendors again on the online program and also visit the location, now that they have established a relationship. The gathering would create a learning community between families and businesses.

properties.description:
The M-Path Park Project is a grassroots initiative to bring a multi-modal park to the Downtown Dadeland community.  The core elements of this project involve community organizing, community planning, and a pop-up park event, all culminating in an eventual self-sustaining M-Path Park.  All elements within the M-Path Park vision sketches are interchangeable. These are all just concepts made to provoke thought. Most of the elements in this sketch are modifications that are not expensive, but would require time and commitment to change current land use policies.

The effort to reduce the ill effects of suburban sprawl serves as the challenge that awaits the next generation of society.  Fortunately, through new research in transportation planning and New Urbanism principles, cities are beginning to better understand the intricate roles they can play in the complex issue of urban sustainability and quality of life.  Today, Transit Oriented Design/Development is understood to have certain core principles which include wide sidewalks, increased density, increased building heights, mixed use zoning and most importantly, accommodating and efficient transit infrastructure.  The M-Path Project is essentially an experiment in transit oriented development for Greater Miami. 

In order to reach the ultimate vision of M-Path Park becoming a self-sustaining multi-modal park that serves thousands of visitors, it must first journey through a complex process of community organizing, project planning, fundraising, programming and ultimately, community buy-in and municipal support to sustain the park.
properties.details: Downtown Dadeland is understood as one of Greater Miami’s best examples of a thriving, self-sustaining urban core. The only critical element missing from this bourgeoning economic and cultural node is an OPEN GREEN SPACE. In order to make Downtown Dadeland a true Live, Work and Play community, it must find a venue that would allow local residents to find nearby recreational opportunities in which they can conveniently engage. Transit connectivity, compact development, mixed-use zoning, a diverse population, the Metro Rail, Bus way, M-path and US-1 make this an ideal place to promote sustainable living and effective transit systems, two elements of dire need for the future of Greater Miami.
properties.title: M-Path Park Project
properties.name: M-Path Park Project

properties.description:
In an effort to encourage sustainable landscape practices, Arquitectonica Geo wishes to transform an existing under-utilized neighborhood parklet into an edible garden and community gathering space. With the addition of a low-maintenance edible garden and a winding pavilion that accommodates a variety of outdoor activities, we envision a vibrant park that becomes the center of community interaction in the West Grove.

If our design is implemented, the West Grove will enjoy a revitalized, attractive public space in their neighborhood that fosters community interaction. Residents will have easy access to fresh fruit, while enjoying the new amenities in the park. Families can take their kids to the park for the swings. Near-by employees can take their lunch breaks in the picnic area. Weekly events, such as Farmers Markets and block parties can take place in the pavilion.  The park will also help rebuild The West Grove’s depleting identity and expand on its rich cultural heritage for being a close-knit community and one of the first neighborhoods to have a luscious edible landscape.

We plan to approach a local university to provide the community with workshops centered on nutrition, cooking and health in general- utilizing the fresh items grown in the garden.  Not only will the garden serve to beautify the public space, it will serve a need to help people incorporate healthy living options into their lifestyle.  Additionally, this space could help promote community engagement, as residents look to the edible garden as an example of how to improve other public spaces/vacant lots.
properties.details:
In a recent Miami Herald article, the West Grove was described as “the Miami neighborhood that time forgot.” Indeed, the West Grove was once a vibrant place, rich in culture and history. Settled by Bahamian Sailors in 1873, neighborhood residents were proud to be the first black community in Miami. According to Thelma Gibson, who grew up in the west Grove, early settlers “planted crotons, almond trees, sapodillas and sugar apples. You could walk the street and pick the fruit.” Much has changed since then.

The once bustling Grand Ave, is now dotted with vacant lots.  Recent development has taken over the luscious edible landscape that used to thrive there. Through our project we hope to bring back a piece of the Grove’s history by planting a self-sustaining edible garden in our chosen site. We also hope that this project will strengthen the West Grove community by providing a central gathering space.
properties.title: Vacant to Vibrant: Revitalizing a Community Park in Coconut Grove Village West
properties.name: Vacant to Vibrant: Revitalizing a Community Park in Coconut Grove Village West

comments.comment: What a wonderful idea for the Grove!

properties.submitter_name: Tina Cornely Founder of Bridging Humanity
properties.description: With an increasingly mobile public, there is no better way to attract and retain visitors while showcasing our beautiful city.   These free internet/charging stations will provide a valuable public service to our visitors and locals alike while reducing our carbon footprint.
properties.title: Free Solar Charger/Internet Kiosk
properties.details: This project will help Miami become a more sustainable visitor friendly city and will also provide energy and internet access during blackouts, storms or other natural disasters.

comments.comment: Great idea!!! I'll be glad to be part of it!
I really like this idea.   I would love to partner with you for my project, Sound Garden.

properties.description:
Almost every major city in the states have one. A place built with shipping containers for people to gather, a place where art, music,shopping and food come together.

With thousands of containers stacked up all around the city it's inevitable not to think of ways on how to reuse this strong and easy to relocated steel boxes. The idea would be to turn this metal boxes into usable spaces by recycling and giving a new life to the containers.
Each container serves a different function weather is a store, a food/bar pod or an art gallery with common areas for music and performances. 
The park can expand if needed and its relocatable. Using vacant lots throughout the downtown and midtown areas as temporary sites
properties.title: Container Park
properties.details:
This park will provide affordable spaces for artist and vendors that otherwise could not afford the high rent prices in Miami to sell or exhibit their work/product. 
Shipping containers are relative inexpensive and can be modified without much cost therefore allowing tenants to pay a fraction of the cost of rent compared to other places. Containers are easy to move around and are weather tight, and with the proper insulation and ventilation they can create comfortable spaces where business can flourish.
At the center of the park will be a playground for the little ones and a stage for live performances where people can enjoy a band or play, while having a bite or a drink from the businesses around without having to leave the park.

comments.comment: SUPER Idea! If this doesn't get picked - email me at tjsuccess09@gmail.com - let's make this happen!
Recycle in a big way.  I like this, great ideas here.
YES!

properties.description: We could use our parking lot either on the studio lot or across the street and hold a food festival complete with Food Trucks and perhaps some offerings from cooking schools such as Johnson & Wales, FIU School of Hospitality, and Le Cordon Bleu to name a few.  A farmer's market could also be included in this festival to bring attention to local growers in the South Florida region.
properties.title: Check, Please South Florida! Food Festival
properties.details: It's a great way for foodies to enjoy our local cuisine and gives students and their schools to showcase their cooking talents.  It also puts a spotlight on our diversity through food.  They always say food brings people together.  The event would be open to all.

comments.comment: It's a great way for foodies to enjoy our local cuisine and gives students and their schools a chance to showcase their cooking talents. It also puts a spotlight on our diversity through food. They always say food brings people together. The event would be open to all.

properties.description: Is to install UNI's which are portable pop-up reading rooms that can be dropped into almost any available street-level location. Part library, part classroom, the UNI will provide a place to gather around books, right in the heart of neighborhoods all across Miami. The purpose of the UNI is to share books, showcase the act of learning, and improve public space. It is intended to be a new resource for a city, providing residents with a place to gather and contribute to their own well-being and advancement, as well as that of their neighborhood. My mission is to make reading and learning more accessible and prominent in our city.
properties.title: UNI in Miami
properties.details: ..live in a well-educated society, let’s build cities where learning experiences are prominent, accessible, and enjoyable. Let’s show off our best teachers, librarians, and educators doing great work, and give them opportunities to adapt their craft to a public setting. The Uni takes learning public. Many urban residents, especially children, do not have easy access to books and places to read outside of school. Book stores are closing. Public libraries in many cities are underfunded. Electronic communication, video games, and online socializing are sapping more and more of our attention. We seem to be losing touch with books at the very moment, and in the very places, we need them the most.

properties.description: This "retention pond lake" site in the corner of heavily trafficked Crandon Blvd. and E. Enid Drive remains uninviting even though it has a lovely gazebo due to the minimal landscaping and deep slope that makes it difficult to reach the water .  We hope to redesign the curvature to make it more natural looking, adding stones, planting native trees that grow in brackish water and bird and butterfly attracting shrubbery.
properties.title: Lake Park - creating a natural landscape to encourage native wildlife and human enjoyment.
properties.details: The park, situated in our main street, is an easy find for any island resident and visitor by wakling, biking or car since there is free parking down E. Enid Drive.  Plants will be labeled and visitors can learn about native trees, wildlife in natural setting.

properties.description: Install a giant boulder (about the size of a VW Bug) at the entrance to FIU's South Campus surrounded by a hardscape area for gathering. The boulder would be an ever-changing canvas for FIU students, clubs, faculty, and community residents to paint. They might paint messages, fraternity and sorority letters, artwork, etc.
properties.title: Art Rock Plaza
properties.details: Art Rock Plaza would be a place to gather and interact -- in an artistic way -- with the space around them. It would also serve as a point of interest for people to check out what the boulder looks like from day to day...what is the message on the boulder today?

comments.comment: Very cool!!

properties.description:
Bring Miami into the 21st century by providing a place where the community can foster new ideas, prototype designs, start companies and grow together through innovation, design, and technology. We can create a sustainable local makerspace, somewhere in the Wynwood Design district where people can come and learn/teach/use technologies that are not available yet for home use. 3D printers, Laser Cutters, Vinyl plotter/cutters, embroidery, textile, fabrication tools, access to expensive computer programs like AutoCAD, Maya, 3DS  MAX, etc.

Funding could come through OurMiami, but also like the TechShop in San Francisco, CA, we could obtain corporate sponsorship to help the space grow and thrive.
properties.title: Tech Shop/Maker Space Miami
properties.details:
This would be based on the TechShop in San Francisco. TechShop is a vibrant, creative community that provides access to tools, software and space. You can make virtually anything at TechShop. Come and build your dreams!

This can infuse Miami with new local businesses, new local jobs, and entirely new technologies and innovations (for example the Square App was prototyped and designed originally at the SF TechShop.

comments.comment: This is a great idea! I, along with others I know have had so many ideas that have never gone beyond conception because of the difficulties both financially and in accessibility to build professional, realistic prototypes. Hope this takes off!
Check out this video of the SF TechShop - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ls9xwt6F3mo

properties.description:
Make a green + ocean blue meeting place for miamians to relax & mingle in the old, abandoned & scenic bridge under Rickenbacker. 

Nature meets forgotten human creation.

Similar to the NY High Line (Old railway -turned-park: http://www.thehighline.org)

The old bridge under the Rickenbacker Causeway is a beautiful place to see both sides of the water + watch the boats pass by. 

Can be monetized w/ markets & events (parties, outdoor screenings, etc). The NY High Line also has donations and festival events aimed at fund raising.
properties.title: Miami's Low Line (Miami's version of NY's High Line)
properties.details:
Possible activities + areas:
- Designated fishing dock area with fishing info exhibit
- Kid's space (w/Educational info)
- Reading/Relax block (Staircase type seating grates)
- Green gardens with local flora
- Bike parking + info for bike community
- Farmer's market & Food trucks (Imagine: Fish it + cook it right there!)

- Temporaries: Art exhibits, parties, cycling community meetups, children educational programs,

comments.comment: You had me at fish it and cook it.This would be a perfect re-purposing of space that really captures the Miami spirit. Good stuff.

properties.description: The Overtown neighborhood is rich with history & stories untold.  As the community rebuilds,  these stories of Overtown's past,  present and of the future aspirations of  neighborhood stakeholders should be captured, shared, and preserved for posterity.   Colorful kiosks should be placed strategically throughout the neighborhood as a gathering place for residents and visitors to mingle & share stories.  The  physical neighborhood is undergoing major developmental changes which will impact residents & drive a largely tourist populous to the area. The interactive kiosks will loop thru existing recordings and be used by visitors wanting to leave behind their own fond memories and regards on Overtown's progressive resurgence
properties.title: Overtown Time Capsule .....history in the making. .
properties.details: Interesting and unique experiences drives humans to visit new places.  Miami relies heavily on the Tourism Industry and depressed neighborhoods like Overtown need that cultural tourism boost to jumpstart its local economy and effectuate change at the ground level that will translate into jobs,  business  opportunities and the rebuilding of the physical environment.  The kiosk concept complements ongoing activities going on in the area to attract visitors such as the cultural tours and programming of cultural institutions like the Historic Lyric Theater Cultural Arts Complex.

comments.comment: It will become safe once we support the area and bring visitors to the place.
I would not encourage tourists to travel to Overtown to learn about the community until it becomes safe enough for pedestrians.

properties.description: Transform the swath of dark, fenced-in, unused underpass spaces that effectively cuts Overtown in half into a linear park that becomes a center point of the community.
properties.title: Overtown Underpass Park
properties.details: With the existing structure providing shade and protection as well as a footprint for a great public space, there's enough space to create a regular market (no need to rent tents), public art exhibit, music jams, basketball courts, skate park, outdoor movie space, gathering space for teens, children's activity, bbq cookoffs -- the possibilities are endless.

comments.comment: BTW, I submitted a separate idea right next to yours called Overtown Underpass Beautification
Love this, but just don't know if we could do all this with $10K. Perhaps start with just beautification of the underpass and sidewalks so that we can connect the community.

properties.description: To make an environment statement about the value of urban canopies. Tree sleeves are colorful, knitted covers that wrap around branches and trunks. They are unique, attention-grabbing pieces of urban art.
properties.title: Tree Sleeves
properties.details: Gain a further appreciation for the quiet giants which stand as a pillar of our natural environment.  Trees provide urban communities with breathable air, CO2 reduction, shade, heat sinks, animal habitats, and spiritual centers.

comments.comment: Environmental** !

properties.description: This year we were selected to receive a small grant from Disney's Friend for Change to restore and create a Monarch Waystation at my son's existing garden. Monarch Waystations are places that provide resources necessary for monarchs  to produce successive generations and sustain their migration. The monarch migration is truly one of the world's greatest natural wonders, yet it is threatened by habitat loss in North America. Milkweed is the only host plant this butterfly can have during caterpillar stage.  Similarly, without nectar from flowers these fall migratory monarch butterflies would be unable to carry on their migration. My idea is to take the school garden idea and help restore public spaces, playgrounds, parks, highways .
properties.title: Monarch Waystations
properties.details: So that  people can help the Monarch's migration and so that we send the message that we need to stop huge developments from eliminating precious habitat loss that is vital to our pollinators. The use of herbicides and frequent mowing along roadsides has converted much of this habitat to grasslands habitat generally lacking in food and shelter for wildlife. Although some states have started to increase the diversity of planing along roadsides, open public spaces, parks milkweed, these programs are small. I believe that in Florida we can make a difference. People can start creating Monarch Waystations at  parks, along roadsides, and other unused plots of lands so that our future generations can continue to enjoy them and Learn from them

properties.description: Transform bus stops in the Kendall area into interactive planets within our solar system. Each bus stop along the route will correspond to one of the nine planets and have views of planetary scenes, information about each planet and its surrounding satellites, as well as an audio tour accessible through smart phones or tablets. The installations will glow in the dark, revealing beautiful landscapes of the entire solar system after the sun sets and bring inspiration and enlightenment to the suburbs.
properties.title: Ride the Nebula: Experience the solar system in Kendall
properties.details: Take a planetary tour while riding the public bus transit system and enjoy a fun, interactive, and educational experience. This project will promote the use of the public transportation system in Miami-Dade County and create a series of positive and enriching activities for patrons in their everyday travels.

comments.comment: Cool idea
Amazing idea to engage the community in science!!!

properties.description: EXILE Books is a temporary bookstore housed in a refurbished toll booth that is temporarily installed in public locations throughout Miami to activate the environment and engage the local community. The bookstore will educate the public about artist's books and publications and introduce accessible, affordable art to the mass public. In addition to the retail store, there will be events, workshops, presentations, and performances that will engage local artists, encouraging collaborations, creating a shared platform for exchange. Each location will focus thematically on the local community- Little Havana's Maximo Gomez Domino Park would be the ideal location to explore the theme of identity and immigration.
properties.title: A mobile pop up artists bookstore to activate a public space
properties.details: EXILE Books will provide access to materials and resources that are not currently available in Miami. These books are conceived of as works of art in and of themselves. The titles will represent a broad cross section of diversity of the community, and are intended as mass communication and dissemination of information. From radical zines to an exquisitely executed printed manuscript, there will be materials that will appeal to everyone. EXILE will engage the viewer, inform its audience, and energize the environment. Nothing like this exists in Miami, and I think this city is ready for an experimental artist's bookstore.

comments.comment: Great idea. Just what Miami needs.
Everyone deserves a chance to read!
WOW! What a unique idea…build it and they will come … and learn and converse and create and be inspired.
I'll come by for some Cuban coffee and a cigar if you win!  Good Luck!
Really cool.  Long overdue in our diverse community.
Love it!!!
Love this idea!!  Wonderful use of public space and such a creative way to educate our diverse community.  You have certainly thought outside the box-- way to go!
Very, very creative and energizing idea. Good for the community.

What a fantastic idea!  Great for the community.
I agree with Summer -  cutting edge!!!
What a wonderful example of a positive influence!  Good going!!
Community involvement and participation are vehicles for positive impacts.   Love the idea!!!
Great idea. Very cutting edge.

properties.description: Work with an area art school to create a solar powered lighting display on Surside's public beach during Art Basel.
properties.title: Beach It Art Basel Style ~ beach solar powered lighting display.
properties.details: Open to the public, this free event would bring the awareness of art and the environment to a wide range of people.

comments.comment: Cool! As a Surfside resident, this sounds really neat!

properties.description: Establish a competition for area university architecture schools for captivating bird houses that will encourage wild life conservation on one mile of beach dune.
properties.title: Hello Birdie ~ install architecturally interesting bird houses at public beach accesses in Surfside.
properties.details: This involves young adults in an environmentally focused project that benefits the local ecology and inspires those who come to see the bird houses.

comments.comment: This is my favorite one. Perhaps one could be placed in the small dog park as well?

properties.description:
NE 3rd Avenue is an ideal place to pilot a lighting program  to help create a “old town square” feel for this street that is experiencing a great revitalization. There are numerous new restaurants that have opened and will be opening on this avenue.  It will be the home of Miami’s first “Parklet” and various other investments have been made to improve the facades of these establishments.  Yet at night it is still dark and in need of complimentary lighting.  The avenue is not very wide and is only 2 blocks long.
This creates a very pedestrian friendly area.  To further the sense of place we suggest stringing “old fashioned” bulbs across the avenue to create an old town square feel for these two blocks.
properties.title: NE 3rd Ave Lighting Project
properties.details: Residents and visitors will be able to slow their pace as they experience this striking and yet cozy environment.  We believe it will have the affect of slowing people down as they stroll down the avenue to choose among all of the new restaurants in the area.  After dinner they may decide to lounge at the new Parklet as well.

comments.comment: Great idea!

properties.description: Install beautified trash and recycling bins in the Coconut grove neighborhood. This project would have a contest to develop designs for trash and recycling bins in the grove. Trash and recycling bins with the winning designs would be installed in the Grove.
properties.title: Beautiful Trash
properties.details: Have a cleaner and more beautiful neighborhood through (1) addition of art on trash and recycling bins and (2) reduction trash in the neighborhood due to increased awareness and use of recycling and trash bins.

properties.description: Allow families, clubs, organizations, individuals to plant flowers and low level shrubs along the walkway suppounding this park that make a design or statement for the community to enjoy. Water spigots would have to be placed every so often for the planters to use to keep their area alive. Suggest a space along the walkway of about 10 feet deep and 20 feet wide.  Those that do not maintain their area would forfit the use and it would be assigned to another interested party
properties.title: Ground Graffiti along the walk ways of Chuck Pezholt Park.
properties.details: go to the park and enjoy the ground grafiti or floral murals as they exercise or enjoy a stroll with their family

properties.description: Everything is changing: How artist create their artwork; acquire information; invest their time & resources; strive to become successful & live their lives. So I’m changing too. My name is Baye. Allow me to introduce myself, by focusing on making Miami an appealing place to live work & play. My general obligation bond represents a comprehensive effort to improve residents’ quality life by creating an artistic, urban & fashionable ambience. I’m honored to introduce you to an exciting and innovative idea, to redecorate sixteen of the historical bus stops in Liberty City. It’s just the proper improvement that needs to exist in the vision of our children. Liberty City is full of culture & history. Now it’s time to exhibit its beautification.
properties.title: Waiting For ColorSwarm - The ColorSwarm Bus Stop Design
properties.details: As a native of Liberty City, I've dreamt of hand-painting each location with a mixture of my designs, blending traditional images with themes dedicating to Say No to Drugs, the unfortunate children that are mentally, physically & spiritually indisposed. Another, devoted to our historic & present leaders who have made an impact within the community. Using spirited colors & motivational messages modernizes & improves the populace, providing outstanding demonstration of how talented & special our artists are in the community. The essence of my art will strengthen their sense of attachment. Colors are therapeutic. I use vibrant colors intentionally to naturally stimulate the mind, body and soul. Where you live is much more than your address.

properties.description:
The Hanging Light Garden consists of the placement of digitally fabricated light fixtures integrated with low maintenance plants under the rails of the Metromover along NE 15th. Also, where possible, green wall can be inserted in key areas to help enhance the experience.
The playful forms of the lamps and the green walls will soften the hard surfaces and the linear character of the architecture of the surroundings.
properties.title: Hanging Light Garden
properties.details: The Hanging Light Garden will improve the physical conditions of this portion of the underside of the Metromover. Not only will this intervention make the area more beautiful, but it will make it more secure by introducing more light and by creating a more inviting atmosphere. This will create the right conditions to promote human interaction in an area that people usually ignore.

properties.description: Use lighting (a la MacArthur Causeway bridge) and street art (a la Wynwood Walls or the  “Beautiful Bridge” project under the Avenida Figueroa Alcorta pedestrian bridge in Buenos Aires) to beautify the underside and columns of the MetroRail portion of the MetroRail/TriRail transfer station and thus establish the west gateway into the 79th Street Corridor community.
properties.title: Outdoor lighting/street art project for the MetroRail station at 37th Avenue an
properties.details: ...sense they are entering the 79th St. Corridor, a focus of ongoing revitalization efforts.  This is the location of the MetroRail/TriRail transfer station, which with the nearby Amtrak station and bus connections at street level, forms a primary transit hub for the region. The station literally marks the westerly portal into the corridor, but the area under the MetroRail station is little more than a barren wasteland. To create a discernible gateway, we wish to create a street art and lighting design to embellish the underside of the station, including the columns. The median under the station and land adjacent to the station could be used as space for complementary art installations and events.

comments.comment: I would love to visit that street art project.
Beautiful Project.
Good idea! I like this lighting.
Awesome!

properties.description:
Our idea is to create a series of cheerful painted murals for the exterior walls of the Homestead Public Library. Members of the Homestead and Florida City community would be invited to participate in the design and painting process under our professional direction.

The architecture of the library building already features perfect paneled "canvas" sites for these murals, which would be rather easy to access by people of all ages as they work together towards a common goal.
properties.title: Homestead Branch Library Community Mural
properties.details: This collaborative creative effort would help bring the community together, attract visitors to the library and bring beauty and pride to the city.

properties.description: Our idea is to simply paint a series of 36 electric poles with friendly colors and whimsical patterns. These poles are located the western stretch of Palm Drive, which currently serves as the gateway route most used by local visitors and international tourists visiting the Everglades National Park, Alligator Farm, Robert is Here Fruit Stand, Schnebley's Winery,  and other local attractions. This particular stretch of Palm Drive currently lacks the welcoming energy that our visitors and local residents deserve. The "Painted Poles of Palm Drive" project would be an easy, but effective, way to create an intentionally cohesive, welcoming and cheerful grassroots expression of the community for all to enjoy.
properties.title: Painted Poles of Palm Drive
properties.details: Members of the community will be invited to come together to participate in the painting project. This cost-effective solution will build new relationships, and bring renewed pride to the neighborhood while also welcoming visitors to the magnificent sites within Florida City.

comments.comment: Beautiful! I love it!

properties.description: Art has a unique power to transform lives, as artists at Miami Lighthouse who see only through touch know; they adapt to their blindness through tactile art, often discovering new talents. Our Ceramics Program participants will expand collaborations with acclaimed artists, like Jedd Novatt (sculptures at PAMM) and Carlos Alves (exhibits throughout Miami), to create touchable mosaics. Their work, displayed at galleries such as AC Fine Art, will be featured in public spaces in diverse neighborhoods. Sighted artists work with our visually impaired artists and are eager to take the collaboration further with public exhibitions that capture the essence of tactile expression by placing ceramic art to enrich the communities where displayed.
properties.title: It Feels Like Miami: Touchable Ceramics in Public Spaces
properties.details: Enjoy beautiful ceramic mosaics both by using their sense of sight and touch, and by touching learn how the blind explore the world though other senses. People will “see” blind and visually impaired artists in a new light and learn that vision loss does not preclude, but may even enhance, artistic ability. This project would educate the public about the possibilities of tactile creation and demonstrate our motto, “It’s possible to see without sight™.”

properties.description: The Honors College at FIU is joining forces with a developer to bring a unique and creative beautification project to the downtown Miami area. Each semester, students in the Inhabiting Other Lives course research and explore the Miami River. Students then display the data through artwork using a technique known as art-mapping. This year, students are collaborating on a very different and large-scale project. Mantecon approached the Honors College with a challenging project – a 30 foot high by 20 foot wide mural that will be displayed on the façade of a new building he is constructed alongside the Miami River. The building will face I-95 and is expected to be completed in early 2015.
properties.title: FIU Miami River Mural
properties.details: FIU student artwork will be building a bridge between the community, Honors College, and Art and Art History. Beautiful artwork will be showcased prominently in a high-traffic area.

properties.description: Prizm will work collaboratively with a number of local cultural organizations to organize a series of innovative exhibitions at the Marquis in Downtown Miami that will visually present dialogue that addresses the African Diaspora’s contribution to the shaping of Miami’s cultural and urban landscapes.  Our collaborations will grant access to all demographics that live in the South Florida community, youth and adults.
properties.title: Prizm
properties.details: Prizm will give the City of Miami’s residents the opportunity to enjoy and learn more about visual artists from diverse backgrounds and how their works are seminal to the continued growth of Miami’s arts and culture scene.  Prizm will culminate with our annual blockbuster event, Prizm Art Fair, showcasing visual artists from the African Diaspora whose works reflect global trends in contemporary art. It will be held during Art Basel | Miami Beach at the Marquis Residences in Downtown Miami.

Thank you Dr. Danger for your support! We hope you'll join us at Prizm this year.
This sounds like a great venue for the growing arts culture in south Florida

properties.description:
By discarding the perception  that public artworks are static objects, Pharaohs Dance RE-Mix will extend the experience of viewing the public artwork Pharaohs Dance Plaza, located at the Arscht Performing Arts Center in Miami.   By presenting a free dance and theatrical performance  staged on location at Pharaohs Dance Plaza.  The performance is based on narrative content and abstract images depicted in the Plaza art work design and concept.

Pharaohs Dance RE-Mix, is a collaboration between  Miami artist Gary Moore and choreographer Rennie Harris Pure Movement Project.  This will be the first ever choreographed work specifically created for an existing public artwork in Miami.
properties.title: Pharaoh's Dance RE-Mix
properties.details: Pharaohs Dance RE-Mix offers an example of how a cross cultural multi-disciplinary collaboration may showcase the breadth of the Miami’s art scene, while reflecting Miami’s cultural identity and enriching the vitality of an international city.  There is also the added value of creating an awareness, which shows the variety of alternative programming contexts for other creatives to consider in the future, other than traditional offerings.

comments.comment: I have been doing tai chi gong dancing on your marvelous art installation since the day you completed it .  I danced as if everyone was looking.  Some did give a look often  given to "loco" locals...smile,
I greatly enjoy all of Gary Moore's work and believe  Pharaoh's Dance will be an inviting way to greet guests at the Adrienne Arsht Center!

I love the colors and design. Looks like a Great space to work in.

Lovin the vibe and the colors . . . very nice addition!!!

The design really compliments the space. You get a warm sense of invitiveness and place where you could just sit and think. I like it.

Seeing my creative family in Miami truly excites me. Praise Yahweh
LaSharown
Beautiful design that I always admire leaving an evening of dance inside the theater.  The thought of viewing dance at Pharaoh's Dance will be the ultimate experience! I say RE-Mix!
Beautiful design and colors
WOW!! The Rhythm  of Dance can be felt on the site.

properties.description: The walls of many buildings along the M-PATH weren't intended to be especially inspiring to viewers, because the path was originally a service drive for the rail.  At the same time, people enjoy movement through interesting and changing scenery more than an environment lacking scale, detail or an absence of visual stimulation.  The facade along this site is one of many buildings that could partner with a local artist or group who wanted to showcase an idea while simultaneously improving users of the M-PATH's experience.  Lighting, as another PSC proposal suggests, is clearly welcome here.  Grazed lighting could illuminate sculptured facade treatments or highlight pieces of art, while uniform path lights can unite the entire corridor.
properties.title: Hidden GEMS
properties.details: The installation of hidden gems of art and appropriate lighting is meant to provide users of the M-PATH with an improved experience along their journey.  The more that people enjoy the path, the more they and others will use it.

comments.comment: Let's not forget about the columns - that's the biggest opportunity for beautification of the M-Path, for both the pedestrians and bikers and the motorists, who have to stare at concrete walls for miles on end! Great idea!
Good idea if they could be mounted so changes can be frequent

properties.description: Partner with a collective of local artists to display seasonal showings along the Metro Rail Columns.
properties.title: Rhythmic Beauty
properties.details: Enjoy the journey and remember their experience.

comments.comment: From what I've been explained, plants aren't allowed on the columns.  If art and painted columns aren't allowable either, it's time to change policy.
QR codes could deliver audio commentaries, recorded by the artists, to provide further insight into their work.

I've thought of something similar, not necessarily seasonal, if we had a Banksy here, an Os Gemeos, they should stay there forever and be protected.

It wouldn't just be nice to walk in here, it'd be nicer for the people in traffic on US1 everyday, would improve the quality of life majorly.

I always think of this as I drive and bike under these thousands and thousands of columns which are nothing but Canvases begging for great streetart.
Good way to encourage casual walking

properties.description:
Classical Revolution South Florida (CRSFL) would to continue enhancing Miami's Wynwood Arts District with our proven brand of high-quality chamber music for everyday people in everyday places (Cafes, Bars, Restaurants, Galleries, Public Space, etc).  Our musical services are typically provided at no charge.

While Wynwood and the surrounding Arts District seems like a logical place to perform regularly, CRSFL strives to enhance any area of S. Florida that desires chamber music or is in need of affordable culture.  With support, we can travel to just about anywhere in the Tri-County area. 

While most CRSFL music is deemed "classical",  we also perform modern & experimental chamber music, including arrangements of pop songs.
properties.title: Classical Revolution South Florida: High-Quality Chamber Music for the Masses!
properties.details:
Our goal is to provide free chamber music presentations at free venues where folk can easily and casually gather together to enjoy live chamber music.  Unlike halls presenting chamber/classical music in a quiet institutionalized setting in set chairs, CRSFL encourages audiences to eat, drink and socialize while musicians are performing, similar to enjoying any modern live music. 

While most free shows feature rehearsed or familiar ensembles (string, wind, brass, piano, mixed, etc) , CRSFL encourages and welcomes participation from any and all trained  instrumentalist via sight reading, adding chairs, or trading chairs. Moreover, we welcome guest ensembles and soloists in an open-mic format.

comments.comment: We need more live music!

properties.description: Crosswalks along the abandoned Ludlam Trail are non-existent. This project will entail artfully designed crosswalks that will alert motorists to the fact that people are actively using the trail.  We will work with local neighborhood artists and hold a design competition to identify the most beautiful crosswalk designs.
properties.title: Intersection Repair
properties.details: The Ludlam Trail is a 6.2 mile corridor runs through the heart of Miami-Dade County, and together with the M-Path and South Dade Trail, would form an uninterrupted regional trail network from Homestead to Downtown Miami to Flagami. It directly connects to 4 schools, 3 major regional parks, and dozens of neighborhoods, and will reach over 34,000 residents who live within ½ mile. Making sure that people can safely cross at minor intersections is an important life safety project that will also help beautify the neighborhood!

comments.comment: I agree. We need to build this trail, and line it with beautiful native South Florida flora.
This idea should also be used at the intersection of the M Path park  where it connects to the Ludlam Trail and the Snapper Creek Trail!  Right now it really does feel like a service alley...

properties.description: Like many Miami residents, the Metrorail is a necessary mode of transportation for me despite the horrible lack of coverage, unexplained delays, and dismal service. Elected officials seem unconcerned and many of these problems are outside the scope of this challenge. However, I do believe with a little money we could make the Metrorail experience at least slightly more comfortable and enjoyable for riders. I would use the money from the Public Space Challenge to hire local artists and musicians to create murals and play music in Metrorail stations, plant native plants, and put up interactive community boards for people to post ideas as well as get information about local events in each neighborhood.
properties.title: Metrorail Station Makovers
properties.details: Our surrounding environment directly affects our personality and mood.  By making the Metrorail stations more comfortable and interactive environments to be in, I would hope to provide people with less stress and promote more conversation among fellow riders.  Not only that, but community boards providing information about the different neighborhoods at each stop would encourage people from different communities to interact.   Finally, for some tourists the Metrorail is their first introduction and final goodbye to Miami. It would be nice to show that a city renown for its warm style and culture supports those qualities everywhere, from Brickell to Earlington Heights.

properties.description:
is to make artistic seating from a selection of debris that is meant for disposal from various construction sites in Miami-Dade. The benches or single seats would be located in Wynwood and in the Design District. 
Bases of the chairs or benches could be made from a section of old sewer pipes or rusted machine parts or any heavy piece that functions well as a base. The seat could be made from a slab of old concrete or other durable debris. Resin could be poured over rough surfaces to make the seats comfortable.
Backdrops to the chairs could be constructed from concrete with an abstract mural painted on it.  An awning could be added, like those at bus stations.
properties.title: MIAMI STREET FURNITURE
properties.details:
enjoy a totally artistic place to sit in Miami's famous art districts. 
There are so many construction projects going on in our cities that the supply of thrown-out material is virtually endless.
MIAMI STREET FURNITURE would be kind to the planet as we recycle old metal work, concrete and other debris from our buildings and streets. 
This idea could expand to many areas in Miami-Dade.  Each seating unit would be a truly unique and original piece of art.
The painted mural backdrops would enhance the seating. My preference is for abstract designs to be painted behind the "furniture".

properties.description: Launch an improved and professionally designed VolunteerCleanup.Org website where people can HOST, FIND and JOIN litter cleanups in parks, waterways and the shorelines in their neighborhoods. Hosts that commit to at least 1 monthly cleanup will receive cleanup “kits” (biodegradable trash bags, gloves and a ‘Volunteer Cleanup’ sign). We will drive traffic to the site through grassroots marketing and signage at cleanups to engage citizens who notice what we are doing. I began doing waterway cleanups on my own in my kayak, and have expanded my effort based on media attention, city awards and the growing interest of passerby’s and organizations who want to join me to protect and beautify our public spaces for the enjoyment of all.
properties.title: Volunteer Cleanup Website
properties.details: Make an extraordinary impact on a multitude of public spaces across Miami on an ongoing basis. Volunteers will enjoy the natural beauty of our parks and shorelines while helping to improve and protect them, and keep our environment safe and clean. Cleanup events educate participants and observers of the importance of reducing, reusing, and recycling single use plastic. Volunteer Cleanup events bring people together, help to build community by contributing to a common goal and allow people to give back, get some great outdoor exercise and have fun at the same time. Extensions are partnering with community groups, churches, clubs, and schools to drive participation and provide community service hours to students or those ordered by courts.

comments.comment: Jim, I totally agree. It has a tremendous impact when you do a cleanup, not only on the shoreline but on your whole mindset.  it really makes you rethink your consumption patterns and change your behavior to make a conscious effort to reduce your waste and properly dispose of it

Ugg.. There is so much trash along the shorelines. I wish people would stop littering, but I like the educational component of this with students. Maybe we can teach the next generation to stop littering so much, and maybe them going out and picking up the litter will give them a visual understanding of why littering is bad.

properties.description:
Twenty years ago the downtown Dadeland area (where the Snapper Creek Trail, the M Path, and the Ludlam Trail meet) was envisioned as a vibrant urban destination.  While Downtown Dadeland became a reality, sadly, the canal frontage at Dadeland Mall (one of the country's best performing indoor malls), North Dadeland Station, and the new condos still turn their backs on this potential opportunity.  http://doverkohl.com/project.aspx?id=14&type=0

To nudge the public consciousness on the remarkable opportunities here, have an art contest for a street mural from SW 84th St to the M Path along SW 70th Ave.  Have foodtrucks and a pop up farmers market along the M Path Park, extending to SW 84th St, with on-street parking and a bike corral.
properties.title: Where the M Path, the Ludlam Trail and the Snapper Creek Trail meet
properties.details: Travel by bike along any of our major urban trails and have these them intersect in a celebratory public space, shared by urban residents, commuters, and shoppers alike.

This will be a major interchange of bike paths in ten years.

This is a fantastic idea! My self and the M-Path Park Project fully support!
I like the idea of connecting the islands of activities, of making the connections greener, more accessible to bicyclists and pedestrians.

properties.submitter_name: American Institute of Architects Miami Chapter
properties.description: Is to create an opportunity for pedestrians in Downtown Miami to engage with the downtown culture by building a series of6-7 foot tall orange palm trees, symbolic to Miami, with a square cut out that frames views of the block.  Pedestrians very often  miss seeing the potential of a block as they move about from point A to point B. The cut out trees would be placed at key locations along NE 1st Avenue drawing attention to some of the historic buildings and cultural venues.  A blog (and social media sites) would be created—and advertised on the tree—that would ask viewers to login and discuss what they saw and how they would connect the dots of the venues to improve the block.  The trees could also have historic and cultural information about
properties.title: Framing Downtown Miami
properties.details: Stop for a couple of  minutes and see the city from a different perspective.  The trees will bring attention to the existing history and culture in downtown. The blog will provide an opportunity to collect comments and ideas on what how to improve conditions or just generally make the block a better place.  Some of those ideas could actually be added to the trees from time to time.  The project will enable individual interaction with public spaces.

comments.comment: Love this idea.

properties.description: The idea is to select certain sidewalks areas around our city and paint instructions for different times of dance: tango, foxtrot, salsa, waltz, et al. There would be brief directions for rhythm, accompanied by numbered footprints for two people doing a movement of a particular kind of dance. (Please refer to the attached photo).
properties.title: Sidewalk Dancing How-To
properties.details:
This idea addresses:
1. A low-cost visually appealing element in different communities across our city
2. A potential gathering place or impromptu interactions by pedestrians 
3. A convergence of dance and urban life in a simple, aesthetically pleasing way
4. A fun diversion for children

comments.comment: Love this!

properties.description: The project will invigorate the Little Santo Domingo business corridor.  Themed art pieces and murals showcasing the Dominican culture will be placed throughout the corridor and seen by countless individuals in cars or on foot. Highly visible, monotonous facades will be transformed into images invoking Dominican themes and better relating to human scale. Publicly displayed art pieces will introduce art to the masses. People will be intoxicated by the vibrancy and diversity of the area as the streets come alive with lingering pedestrians spontaneously interacting, works of art and facades transformed by vibrant murals. While walking down the streets enjoying native landscapes, visitors will experience a voyage through this Caribbean island.
properties.title: Little Santo Domingo Art In Progress
properties.details: Little Santo Domingo Art In Progress will revitalize Miami's Allapattah area and transform it into a welcoming place for residents and visitors. By highlighting the art of the Dominican Republic and emphasizing the uniqueness and culture of this area, this project will transform this neighborhood and foster cultural exchange and dialogue among patrons to the area.   It is a dynamic destination fostering economic growth where people can enjoy the street scapes, murals, sculptures, sounds and cuisine.  This project creates an opportunity to include this area in the City of Miami’s network of distinctive open spaces where art has become the spark to bring artists, residents, visitors, government and cultures together.

comments.comment: This sounds like a grewt project

properties.description: is to offer a channel of short-form locally-produced arts commentaries, poetry, historical notes, music and other cultural programming that can be accessed through mobile devices and online. Geographically-dispersed QR codes that are engraved, painted, embossed and printed provide the local delivery system. QR Culture Snap would piggyback with public beautification and tourism programs, media outlets, artist residencies, transit systems, festivals, schools and businesses to give free espresso-like culture charges at any hour. The region’s general profile would also get a boost by giving visitors free doses of information and entertainment.
properties.title: QR Culture Snap
properties.details: scan a small QR code plaque at a bus stop and listen to a poem on their phone; stop along the M-Path or Lincoln Road to hear sound art inspired by nature or historical briefings; scan codes at air and cruise ports for lively tales about Chalks seaplanes or a Jamaican sea shanty; snap codes at the Wynwood Walls, Lyric Theater, Barnacle and other landmarks for location-sensitive media tidbits. Local creative endeavors – large and small – will receive a showcase, and audiences will be empowered to share their experiences globally. This flexible, renewable project will heighten everyone's appreciation of the region’s uniqueness. A health component can be incorporated through messages from regional hospitals, such as currently heard on WLRN.

properties.description: The creation of a public garden path sculpture in Edgewater would encourage arts advocacy, promote sustainable and environmentally friendly practices and awareness, and provide a site to galvanize the surrounding community (which includes many students of the Art Institute and the Young Arts Foundation). Lapiz would invite participation in environmental stewardship, foster a pedestrian-friendly community, and buffer the impact of the many residential and commercial developments in Edgewater (high density zoning leaves little room for green space or community engagement).  Titled "Lapiz" ( the looping foot movement in the tango), the garden would  incorporate green features, including rainwater collection and solar powered night lighting.
properties.title: Lapiz: Elevated garden path sculpture
properties.details: Walk the looping garden trail, enjoy a community garden with edible plants and herbs that provides a space for aromatherapy, composting, and garden workshops, a sculpture and performance space, as well as a venue for artist and environmental workshops, discussions, and events. Thus, the project would combine art, garden and gathering to assist in sustaining and maintaining community arts and the health of our Biscayne Bay and green spaces.
