properties.description: Local community and users of the  Metromover can work together to  fill  the empty spaces with shrubs and sturdy plants.  Students from local schools may participate in art contests and the winning entries will be displayed temporarily or permanently on the walls of the Promenade. The Promenade may also be used as a  weekly gathering point for local walkers and runners.
properties.title: Beautification of the Eleventh Street Promenade.
properties.details: This project, if successful , may be used in other Metromover stations as it will build a stronger community.

properties.description: Create a media campaign asking each beach visitor to deposit 3 pieces of beach trash in the bins when they leave.  Add a non-obtrusive and collaborative message to bins, such as "contribute to beach beauty."
properties.title: Clean beaches
properties.details: Become agents of environmental beauty and learn to litter less.  Waste could be reduced to what washes ashore with a method of removal.

The sponsor  will be identified by a sign.
properties.title: Greening  Land. Spaces Metro Rail
properties.details: Beautiful spaces would make us proud of our city and would serve to calm stress and road rage.  It will also enhance Miami for visitors.

properties.submitter_name: Robert E. Gutsche, Jr., Sean Christopher Lewis & Moses Shumow
properties.infolink: Similar community theatre performed by our team members: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YKhApI0Ht9I
properties.description: This pop-up community play about life in urban trailer parks peppered throughout Miami-Dade would take place in the Biscayne Shores and Gardens Park, next to Biscayne Breeze Mobile Home Park on Biscayne Boulevard. This short-term participatory community performance will be informed by interviews and participation with community members to tell their stories of living in Miami. This play will shed light on people’s homes and public spaces often ignored by the public and marginalized through policy yet that holds beautiful in their hidden meanings, memories, and the lives within. “You Are Here, The Places You’ve Never Been (A Play)” takes people to these spaces to improve community and interpretations of private-public spaces.
properties.title: You Are Here, The Places You’ve Never Been (A Play)
properties.details: Come together to tell stories about these overlooked public-private. Our team includes park residents, FIU faculty, students, and the Working Group Theatre company. We will spend several weeks this summer interviewing and writing with residents and culminating with live readings promoted through local media, recorded, and distributed through multimedia. Residents will perform, read, write, and produce the play. A forum will follow one performance to discuss with local officials and residents the use of public-private spaces and the benefits/costs of incorporation, the appropriation of property/resources that’s contributed to the exclusion of these spaces from civic life.

properties.description: This project involves the creation of large canvas painting areas for local artists to exhibit their talent on a rotating basis. The proposed location is in the rear of the parking lot associated with 1000 E. 16th Street (corner of 10th Avenue) in Hialeah. This space is a "focal point" in the newly established Hialeah Arts District. As part  of the beautification of this space, locally designed landscaping  would be added including  customizable objects of art such as large flower pots.
properties.title: Public Outdoor Art Exhibit Space In Newly Established Hialeah Arts District
properties.details: The establishment of this Art Exhibit will attract artists by providing a public area for them to display their talent and will attract art lovers thereby supporting the conversion and economic viability of the area.

properties.submitter_name: Miami Children's Museum/The Children's Movement of Florida
properties.description: Inspired by the work being done in Reggio Emilia, Italy, our idea is to publically showcase the work of our community’s children in locations throughout the city where “traces of children” may not be expected -- more specifically, at a Metro Mover stop. In doing so, our hope is to create public spaces of “visible learning” where the creativity of our community’s children is openly recognized and appreciated. This approach – consistent with Reggio’s view of children as the “collective responsibility of the community” – will be instrumental in helping us redefine and reimagine our community’s investment in children. Furthermore, this public exhibition of art will contribute to the beautification of the community’s exterior.
properties.title: Traces of Children: Public Spaces of "Visible Learning" Through Children’s Art
properties.details: This idea would make our Miami better by providing a public space where Reggio Emilia’s community-focused approach to early childhood investment could be modeled and replicated. This would help Miami by contributing to its beautification, via the exposition of various artistic products, and by introducing an innovative and imaginative community-based approach that could potentially help expand community-wide support for programs, initiatives, and policies that address the early learning needs of our community’s children. This idea would thus help Miami by (a) helping beautify a public space, (b) encouraging and facilitating creative expression in our children, and (c) expanding awareness of and support for the community’s children.

comments.comment: Great Idea.
Great work, keep it up!
love it!

properties.description: Miami Rep company to perform  public Shakespeare  productions for free. Monies will go toward hiring actors and design team to create a repertory  theatre  company whose job it is to take the classic Shakespeare plays and bring them to the public in a way that is fun, relatable and  authentic.  Funding a full time  cast/troupe. Will allow the actors to train  throughout the day and perform throughout the nights/weekends.  The Haitian cultural center lends itself to a home for these actors  as well as a place to perform although the troupe can travel around town!
properties.title: Miami  Shakespeare. Theatre
properties.details:
The theatre group can use Shakespeare and public places as a solid backdrop to explore the differences and similarities between our races and ethnicities and thus create community!
For example, a classic. Shakespeare play  Mid Summer can be cast and performed to relate to Miami and all of our mixed cultural relationships!
 We can Miamify the plays  in style and thus bring clout to our young culture and modern Miami  appeal to the classics.

properties.description: Display art pieces along the bike path that runs under the metro rail. Specifically the Metro Rail columns could be used as the canvas. The art pieces could be grouped by neighborhood which would allow for a space where all of Miami could express itself together, to show how while individually each neighborhood has its own flavor, together we are part of Miami. This would be a great way to show off local artists and could even showcase youth artists. This could even be the site for a Miami Festival, where participants could walk through each section of the Metro Rail Path where organizers from each represented community could present food and culture from each community in a way that brings us all together.
properties.title: MetroArt
properties.details: This would provide a place for us all to come together while recognizing our individuality. Miami could benefit from more cohesion and a sense of common culture and experiences.

properties.description: Miami Light Project will commission and present a pop-up community play created by Sean Christopher Lewis and Working Group Theater. The community-based project is about urban trailer parks peppered throughout Miami and will take place in the Biscayne Shores and Gardens Park, next to Biscayne Breeze Mobile Home Park on Biscayne Boulevard, near NE 116th Avenue. The short-term participatory community performance will be informed by interviews and participation with community constituents to tell their stories of living in Miami.  The interviews will be used to create the play, “You are Here”, which will be performed in the tent villages and empty parks housing immigrants families throughout the area.
properties.title: Theater Production, "You are Here"
properties.details: This play production will shed light on people’s homes and public spaces, where are ignored in by the public and policy, marginalized by financial inequality and health disparities – yet beautiful in its hidden meanings, memories, and the lives from within. The site specific performances invite audiences to communities they might otherwise never visit and demand that they share with members of their community often relegated to being invisible.  The play, “You are Here”, is an innovative way to take people to a public space, shape the social character of Miami, and contribute to a community sense of belonging.

properties.description: Produce a series of murals at Miami Marine Stadium as a way to raise awareness of the efforts to revive the stadium complex for public use.
properties.title: Art | History - Mural Project
properties.details: Return to the Marine Stadium and enjoy this unique Miami historical treasure.  In addition using urban art to activate public works efforts is helpful in cementing Miami's image as a unique location for travel and conventions.

comments.comment: Love it! :)

properties.description: One Saturday a month, a variety of local musicians would play (one per car) on the metro rail from Dadeland to Downtown.
properties.title: Music on the Metro
properties.details: In addition to creating a festive environment in an underutilized space and exposing residents to new artists, it would increase weekend ridership, decrease vehicle traffic and increase foot traffic into the downtown shopping and arts area.

We held a music festival which turned the metromover platforms into performance spaces  for local musicians, poets, theater companies etc. We would be happy to help support this iniative through our performer network and otherwise. Justin@buskerfestmiami.com

Signage/posters might help create awareness of the project so that it's not perceived as a nuisance, as would selecting the rear car of the train.
Love your idea!

properties.description: Our goal is to promote the arts and spread joy in our community by bringing unique and innovative street performance pieces to the streets of Miami, for free. The performances will take place on a regular basis and our aim is to bring them into all the neighborhoods. Artists and performers will have a chance to showcase their own work, and additionally to collaborate with other artists in order to create groundbreaking performances unlike anything that has ever been seen before.
properties.title: The Happy Miami Project
properties.details: Our main goal is to generate joy in the Miami community by providing free entertainment for our residents. Our secondary goal is to further the performing arts and art appreciation by making them more accessible and affordable to the public. Our final goal is to showcase the incredible talent, rich diversity and culture that Miami has to offer for the world to see by spreading our performances across social media and through "performance marketing".

comments.comment: Thanks for the comment! Not quite, rather than being an annual festival, The Happy Miami Project seeks to create street performances throughout the various neighborhoods on a regular basis. It will be both innovative and spontaneous in nature.

properties.description: Transform at least one highly visible Metro/M-Path area with mosaic art as an inspiration for the artistic development of the entire path. Artists could be invited to mosaic metro rail supports and stations along the path, using historical, immigrant, flora and fauna themes (see link for ideas). Artists and themes could be chosen by the communities located at each station and potentially involve local students or at-risk youths in the design and/or execution of each installation. Large ceramic tile companies would be pursued for tile donations for use in each project.
properties.title: International M-Path Mosaic Project
properties.details: take more advantage of the M-Path for commuting, exercise, art appreciation. Gathering places would emerge along the paths (think 5ks, food trucks, art walks, etc.). It would also encourage the use of urban transport in general, as commuters stuck on US1 traffic would view the mosaics and perhaps consider using alternate urban transport.

properties.description:
Shifting Nature consists of a series of site-specific 3D audio experiences that feature Miami-based artists and musicians. 
The 5-10 minute stories are site specific and make references to bits of our local history. The 3D audio files can be downloaded to any mobile device and can also be accessed through the SoundCloud App (all for free). The 3D recordings do not need any special equipment other than regular, stereo audio ear pods or headphones.
Each story will feature musical performance(s) by a Miami-based artists. 
In the sample provided here, the musical improvisation is by former New World Symphony fellow, Hannah Whitehead.
properties.title: Shifting Nature
properties.details:
The purpose of these audio experiences is to provide a calm space of introspection from the busy life in these highly transited areas.
These audio and musical experiences will also provide an entertaining entry point to local histories and perspectives for tourists and locals alike.
Other locations will include
-The New World Symphony Park
-South Point Park
-Lincoln Road
and others.

comments.comment:
I also found this other quote inspiring:
from "The dismemberment of Orpheus: towards a Postmodern Literature"
by Ihab Habib Hassan

"The Word" of Alien Enemy imprisons 'thee"… Prisoner come out." Obscene idealist, satiric and visionary, lacing scientific jargon with poetic hallucinations, William Burroughs finally denies not only the Word but also the Flesh. His true aim is to free man by making him bodiless and silencing his language.

Natasha I came across these today, which made me think of your comment about oral histories and the impulse to use them in a sort of ephemeral, more poetic manner: "…Like old maps stored in the British library, beautiful but no longer of any use (…) Clifford Geertz, who may or may not have known [Jorge Luis] Borges, put it like this:
'Cultural analysis is (or should be) guessing at meanings, assessing the guesses, and drawing conclusions from the better guesses, not discovering the Continent of Meaning and mapping out its bodiless landscape.'" (Geertz, 1973: 20 Investigating sociological theory by Charles Turner)

Thanks, Natasha. Though these draw from history and I do love and want them to include oral histories, I see them more as experiential than factual. Because they are part of a larger discourse, I am thinking right now to include similar voices (coming from different people) e.g. one older, positive voice; one younger, rougher POV voice and a neutral voice. In this way all the audio pieces will share a similar style and may link back to an actual narrative somewhere... I am also thinking that the younger woman's voice can each time be that of a different female artist living and working in Miami. I really appreciate these thoughts and your time!

Great idea! 
Providing a personal perspective through oral reminiscences gives a community ownership of these pieces. Existing oral history collections can be utilised, or new interviews can be recorded on site --either way, this is a fantastic way to preserve local histories and  to create a lasting legacy .
The use of story characters is also smart. It stimulates everyone's imagination. They bring the history of a place to life in an entertaining and personal way. This is better than video because the imagery belongs to each listener.

properties.description: is to design a liminal space , a place of transition, and connectivity. The "bridge" close proximity to the PAMM and new Science Museum will make a space under the 836 MacArthur causeway an urban landmark enhancing its symbolism as a celebratory entrance to downtown Miami. It will be creating a threshold between the boulevard waterfront and the Arsht Center.
properties.title: THE LIGHT BRIDGE
properties.details: Instead of expending several hundred million dollars in a “signature” bridge this overlooked space over Biscayne boulevard  can be re-purposed. An electronic billboard such similar to those in Times square in NYC or Picadilly Circus in London, will be placed on the structure  to announce events or simply as art installation. Underside 836 light fixtures will be activated by the flow of vehicular movement.  Luminous colors would change the urban character of an abandoned, dark and unwelcoming space.

properties.description: Working with public artist Markus Tracy, we propose to create text-based artistic markers painted on surfaces that map the fun, unusual, interesting, and historic places in the North Miami area, bringing a new public engagement of unnoticed places and unknown histories. An interactive app will help direct and inform participants and tourists in the city to discover the sites. People stumbling upon them will find their curiosity sparked and will be able to scan a QR code to access relevant site specific knowledge. By using Creole, Spanish, and English it will reflect and celebrate the diversity of North Miami's neighborhood. This interactive mapping will prompt the viewer to ponder personal, cultural, social, and environmental landscape.
properties.title: TEXT TALKS Interactive Art Map
properties.details: This project will invite the people of North Miami and visitors to better understand the cultural and historical context of their surroundings by interacting with these artistic text-based paintings.  The project will encourage spontaneous discussion between tourists, community members, city officials, business owners, and youth about creative place-making and community pride.  By learning about the history and beauty of the neighborhood, people will find deeper connections and new ways of looking at their surroundings.  As an added benefit, the text-based paintings will promote active walking throughout the city of North Miami creating communal gathering places along the way.

comments.comment: This is a great idea that brings technology, art and fitness together into a unique experience.  Best of luck to you Lark and Houghton on your creative idea!

properties.description:
The idea behind this is to create an artistic platform Friday's afternoons at Allapattah's Juan Pablo Duarte Park. This will be accomplished by having student (children) artists create LIVE paintings, music and dance at the park for the public's entertainment. 

The artists will create student generated, original works of arts that will have the cultural center of Allapattah, Juan Pablo Duarte Park engaged and abuzz in the Arts. Locals can see and hear live artistic performances Fridays afternoons while relaxing. at the park. 

The Motivational Edge, a 501(c)3 that utilizes culturally relevant arts as a motivational platform to inspire youth towards academic achievement, increased self-confidence and the building of essential life skills.
properties.title: Juan Pablo Duarte Park for the Arts
properties.details:
Many locals within the Allapattah area never have the chance or time to see or hear quality, live artistic performances. By a joint effort of the Village of Key Biscayne  offering the landscaping upkeep and the Commercial Shopping Center Owners giving consent  we, the people will benefit with a mini park and the butterflies  will have a safe habitat.

properties.description:
The idea is to enrich the Urban Landscape by transforming chain link fences into community chalkboards.

Each chalkboard will begin with an intention or positive subject matter, a community partner and a launch plan that will encourage the chalkboard’s sustainability.
properties.name: Chalked Up Miami
properties.title: Chalked Up Miami
properties.details:
On these chalkboards, people can satisfy their need for individual expression! Children and adults alike can surround themselves with art and engage in making it. Playing and creating together builds community.This pilot project is premiering in Miami’s Wynwood neighborhood in December 2013. Our goal is to have one chalkboard installed by Art Basel and expand to other proposed sites shortly after as time and funding allow. 

There will be an opening event, in which Miami Arts Charter, our community partner, will participate. Subsequent chalkboards will engage with different constituents in the community. 

We have six other targeted sites and currently have enough funding for the first board. The redundancy of multiple chalkboards in a single neighborhood will add to the greater cohesiveness and expression of the district itself and expand the project’s viability and impact.

properties.description: is to provide Little Free Libraries (LFL) throughout Miami. LFL is a "take a book, return a book" program to promote literacy and artistic endeavor in neighborhoods. Local artists design structures in colorful shapes and forms to house books with open access. Books that otherwise might sit on a shelf are placed in these structures on a voluntary give-and-take basis. The design, construction and use of LFL can brighten a neighborhood, park, school area and community center while helping to promote a love of reading. They give the community a chance to highlight local artists and represent their culture through the design of the 'library' structure. They may also attract people who would otherwise not be inclined to visit a local library.
properties.title: Little Free Libraries
properties.details: Communities, student and church groups as well as after-school programs are just some of the ways that a community could work together in the design, construction and placement of  Little Free Libraries (LFL) to provide access to books that may not be available from other sources. Sharing of books can promote discussion and help people of all ages feel more connected. An example of the LFF project was just launched in the Little Haiti community where a local Haitian artist designed three eye-catching structures that represent Haitian culture and will be strategically placed throughout the community. We hope for similar Little Free Libraries in other Miami neighborhoods to promote literacy, artistic endeavor and community engagement.

properties.description: Off the Wall, is a transmedia community engagement art walk that will bring Murals for Dorsey Park in Overtown Miami, FL alive in the physical and virtual world using a technology  designed to engage a diverse intergenerational audience, open up new avenues of dialogue and provide a co-creation, co-production and collaborative storytelling opportunity. In effect, the mural will be transformed into a self-guided interactive story scape co-developed by an engaged audience using technology.  With the use of QR Codes and a mobile application, observers will also be able to play a scavenger hunt and add their own stories to game while learning about the mural.
properties.title: Off the Wall: Murals for Dorsey Park Transmedia Art Walk
properties.details: This opportunity will activate the murals at the park so that children, youth and families can learn about the history of the community, interact with great art and have fun while playing a scavenger hunt using their mobile phones.

properties.description:
Let's place a fountain at the corner of  Española Way and Drexel Avenue and gather the inevitable coins to donate to a charity. We should have a contest to determine both the design of the fountain and the charity. 

Española Way, the cozy Miami Beach lane built as an artists’ colony in the 1920s, won The Miami Herald’s best block in South Florida competition in 2012. It is a street enjoyed by tourists and locals alike. There is a built-in user base already. 

Española Way features nightlife, shopping, dining, art and music. At the same time Miami Beach faces all the challenges of a city. Combating the island's homelessness could be a worthy goal for the small, but steady revenue the fountain would generate.
properties.title: Española Way Fountain
properties.details:
Local businesses would benefit because the fountain would be visible from Lincoln Road. The fountain would provide a visual cue, a waypoint, looking down Drexel, to find the street. 

It's great that  Española Way mixes cars, bikes, motor scooters and pedestrians into one space but every once and awhile it might make sense to maximize the place's great architecture and walkability and fill Plaza De Espana with even more diners around the new fountain.

properties.description: This project will be organized by C.R.A.F.T. with the support of several international and local artists, as well as one of Miami’s biggest professional skateboarders. Our goal is to revamp Wynwoods abandoned RC Cola Factory, an un-used and relatively large space, by turning it into the Wynwood Paint and Skate pop-up park. Last year, the 27 world-renowned artists we brought to Wynwood painted several complex murals on select buildings for a beautification project. This year, having noted the relationship between graffiti and skateboarding, the growing number of skateboarders nationwide and the lack of a major skatepark within a 22-mile radius of Wynwood, we will promote the event as an art-based temporary skate park. Both graffiti and skateboarding have been regularly used as outlets for at-risk youth. Without a local place for both participants to showcase their talents, the mediums often lead to heightened criminal activity and sometimes death. The Wynwood Paint and Skate pop-up park will function as a 3-day event during Miami’s 2013 Art Basel festival in order to showcase Miami’s need for a permanent space on-site. Ultimately, we aim to create a venue that will function as a place where youth from both the skateboarding and graffiti worlds can learn, create and play in a safe and controlled environment.
properties.details:
With more than 13 million skateboarders in the U.S. and an increase of 10% participants per year since 2010, skateboarding is the fastest growing sport in the country. Within the past few years, we have also seen an emergence of mural-work and street-art worldwide. However, in Miami, although the Wynwood neighborhood remains one of the biggest graffiti and street-art districts in the world, there are currently no safe places for local muralists to work, and there are currently no major skateparks within a 22-mile radius. Our event will not only provide a temporary space for both crowds to enjoy, but it will also showcase Miami’s need to build a permanent space on-ground to keep young participants away from the dangers of illegal activities.

The reason we decided to host this initiative in Wynwood is due to the neighborhoods poverty levels. In 2000, with a median household income of $11,293.93, Wynwood was known as one of Miami’s most dangerous and most impoverished neighborhoods. Within the past few years, the neighborhood has seen much change. However, not only do most sections of the neighborhood continue to be impoverished, but residents continue to lack a solid communal space.
properties.title: Wynwood Paint and Skate Pop-up Park
properties.name: Wynwood Paint and Skate Pop-up Park

properties.description: The vision is to improve Griffing Park located at 12220 Griffing Blvd., North Miami, Florida 33161.  The proposal is to build an outdoor amphitheater to host weekly community events at Griffing Park to include Musical Nights, Arts in the Park, Films on the Green (movie night), and a Taste of North Miami (culinary arts.)  It is also proposed to fund and re-locate the farmer’s market from the MOCA Plaza to Griffing Park. The proposed streetscape improvement would include a new 10 feet wide shared use bike and pedestrian lane, additional shade trees, stamped concrete decorative treatment to encourage pedestrian activity and linkage between NE 125 Street and Griffing Park as well as street lighting and bicycle racks.
properties.title: Creating New Places Out of Old Spaces
properties.details: The mission of the city of North Miami Parks and Recreations Department is to continue to improve the quality of life through services and create a connection between the community, its partners and the City.  The improvement to Griffing Park and the streetscape will increase livability and encourage the use of outdoor space, while increasing social integration and interaction among neighbors.  The improvements will also provide free outdoor recreation for constitutes and serve as an attraction to surrounding communities. As the City embarks on the redevelopment of the downtown area, the proposed corridor will provide a direct passage to the downtown area and generate economic support for local businesses.

Another great idea to improve an important park that is home to the City's Veterans Memorial, a public art installation Electric Tree by Mark Handforth, and a beautiful open space.  Griffing Park is in the heart of North Miami and it has the potential to be the catalyst to spur development in the surrounding area.

properties.description: EXILE Books is a temporary bookstore that is temporarily installed in public locations throughout Miami to activate the environment and engage the local community. The bookstore will educate the public about artist's books and publications and introduce accessible, affordable art to the mass public. In addition to the retail store, there will be events, workshops, presentations, and performances that will engage local artists, encouraging collaborations, and creating a shared platform for exchange.
properties.title: A mobile pop up artist's bookstore to activate a public place
properties.details: EXILE Books will provide access to materials and resources that are not currently available in Miami. These books are conceived as works of art in and of themselves. The titles will represent a broad cross section of  the diversity of the Miami community, and are intended as mass communication and dissemination of information. From the radical zine to an exquisitely executed printed piece, there will be materials that will appeal to everyone. EXILE will engage the viewer, inform its audience, and energize the environment. Nothing like this exists in Miami, and I think this city is ready for an experimental artist bookstore.

properties.description:
Through our expansion into the vacated Miami Art Museum building in the Miami-Dade Cultural Center, we will catalyze a rebirth of the facility as a mecca of cultural activity. HistoryMiami will reinvigorate the vision of the late Miami-Dade County Mayor, Jack Orr, who commissioned architect Philip Johnson to design the Mediterranean-style facility as a gathering place for Miamians. 

Specifically, we seek to expand the utilization of the facility's 20,000 sq. ft. outdoor plaza by adding needed programming infrastructure and promoting its use by the community. We also propose to build-out a multifunctional museum courtyard (located between our two museum buildings) with a performance space, shading elements, and public art.
properties.title: Miami-Dade Cultural Center Revitalization
properties.details:
Near the County’s government center, courthouses, and numerous businesses at the western edge of downtown, this plaza is underutilized by the vibrant weekday population of workers. Its use further fades on the weekends, when residents and visitors are pulled to new performing arts and museum developments elsewhere. 

This once exciting cultural center is primed for a community-enriching revival. We will leverage the creative potential of downtown to reinvigorate the space into a dynamic place that will attract and connect South Florida's diverse population. This place, once infused with lively community-oriented activities such as festivals, concerts, film screenings, and much more, will emerge a vibrant community center for all to enjoy.

properties.title: Morningside Park Common Spaces Project
properties.details:
Project will greatly increase visibility of and community access to one of Miami’s most beautiful parks and its most valuable asset - the waterfront.

Improve community awareness of the park’s active lifestyle amenities (kayaking, canoeing, sailing) while simultaneously enhancing and beautifying the facilities that serve one of Miami’s most diverse neighborhood/communities and the burgeoning upper-east side.
Will help create community centered spaces that can simultaneously serve active/sporting uses as well as more gathering place type activities 
Colorful trees, planters with benches, and other enhancements (e.g., wifi access points) can be added throughout pathways and common areas so that park patrons can sit, relax,& enjoy the bay.

properties.description:
We utilize biodynamic principles in a variety of highly sustainable growing methods to transform underutilized spaces into vibrant and productive food systems. 

Through on site training, demonstrations, & technical assistance, we empower individuals to develop community food systems within urban areas. These systems provide high quality, healthy, affordable, & safe food options for residents of the local community.

Many of our growing methods have been inspired by our founders’ first hand experience working with Will Allen, CEO of Growing Power in Milwaukee. Will believes that we cannot have healthy communities without a healthy food system.

Our goal is simple: to grow food, to grow minds, and to grow community.
properties.title: Future City Farmers | Urban Farming Educational Center to support sustainable growing in Miami
properties.details:
We believe that all people should have access to good food at all times. By training community members to become urban farmers, we assure them a secure source.

Community members can participate in workshops, “lunch & learns”, and volunteer, giving them hands-on experience in a variety of biodynamic growing methods that are practical for urban environments. 

The Future City Farmer’s Educational Center covers a wide range of topics for workshops and demonstrations, including: aquaponics, vermiculture, composting, mushroom cultivation, beekeeping, storm water management, organic gardening, solar energy, & more.

With Future City Farmers, individuals gain skills that can forever change lives.

properties.description: As an avid sail racer and race officer, I have watched as Biscayne Bay soars its way to becoming the regatta hub of the world. Many locals are unaware of the number of sailboat races and competitors that traverse Biscayne Bay. We have ideal conditions and sail racers love Miami as a venue year round. As a result, there is a racing regatta almost every weekend including the Volvo Ocean Race Stopover (2012), The Bacardi Cup, The Columbus Day Regatta, the Olympic Class Regatta, and the Orange Bowl just to name a few, where thousands of sailors take to the bay each year. However, there is not enough space to accommodate the growing racing fleets and local yacht clubs have met or exceeded their capacity to host racers.
properties.title: Regatta Grand Central
properties.details: Regatta Central is a quick and very effective solution. A large floating-type dock will be easily positioned in the shallow part (5ft) of the bayshore area (similar method used in the Northeast). This area is the base for most sail racing and sees racers every day. The platform would be a launching  and rigging station used to clear up traffic at the local yacht clubs and increase Miami's ability to host more racers. Racers can be shuttled out from select locations and have their own space to prepare their boats on. This also helps solve the issue of motor boat incidents with sailors, as they will no longer be launching from the same area.

properties.description: In our beautiful space of Miami Dade county, there our endless vacant space that could be counted at about 100 acres plus. The most interesting thing about these spaces is that they our unused and our part of our everyday drive through the county, we are talking about the vacant fields that are nestled under the 300ft power lines. These fields our regularly maintained by landscaping maintenance crews that charge a pretty penny. Here at edible Miami we are horticultural specialist who design and install edible landscapes and food forests along with an array of self sustaining practices. We and the communities in which these unused spaces lay strongly believe theses spaces can be made into public parks that have a diverse range of fruit trees
properties.title: Community food forest
properties.details: have a new space to interact that was once an unused space. living in south Florida  our people have a beautiful tropical and sub tropical climate in which provides a year round growing season. In such a diverse group of ethnicities there is many things we have in common and a great example to point out is the amount of tropical food or fruit we consume. In these public food forests communities have a location to routinely gather, interact, learn and observe the hundreds of different diverse trees that Miami Dade county has the great potential to grow. These public food forests save the communities money on regular maintenance and the array of fruits and spices the park provides. This forest would take Miami  top of the sustainable movement

With many residents in these areas working and traveling close by, Deco Bikes can help to alleviate the traffic issues seen throughout the downtown and Brickell areas as well. Most importantly, by reducing the amount of car usage and traffic, Deco Bikes will greatly pollution. While requiring an initial financial investment, it would solely sustain itself as it is a pay-by-use service.

properties.description: We will turn this old, dilapidated house into a model of simple environmental resilience and sustainability. We will raise the foundation of the house in order to bring it well above the rising sea and flood levels. Then we will perform various inexpensive landscape changes and building retrofits, such as adding native vegetation, passive lighting, and drainage improvements. These changes will also reduce the energy needed to operate the house. Information about climate change and solutions will then be placed in and around the house, and it will be opened up as an exhibit.
properties.title: Rising with the Sea Level of Miami
properties.details: Communities in Miami are increasingly at risk from flood damage as human-caused climate change accelerates sea level rise. Miami has the most assets at risk due to climate change of any city in the world, but it is the less mobile, local families that will be most affected as the sea level rises. Our transformation of this house into a public exhibit will allow people to come together to learn about and discuss these impending environmental issues in their community. It will also give people a concrete example of changes they can make in order to be more resilient to flooding, as well as make their homes more environmentally responsible.

comments.comment: demo, not a place for public space, especially since its next to a park.
This house is an eyesore scheduled for demo but it would nice to show Miamians that architecture can be restored.  Demolishing and rebuilding is a sustainable pattern for communities.  Great concept.

properties.description:
My idea is to utilize City of Miami, Virrick Park to develop a collaborative sustainable garden and vocational skills training program for underserved community youth in Coconut Grove.
The garden will be used as an innovative approach to healthy lifestyle education, focusing on the horticulture of local accessible produce and the use of the items grown in the garden for the development of healthy snacks which will be sold at the Virrick Park concession location.Through job readiness skills development, horticulture, yoga, nutrition, exercise and culinary workshops, this project will provide valuable skills, education and job placement opportunities to at-risk youth within the community. With eight partnering agencies including Coconut Grove Cares, the Nityananda Center and The City of Miami, this project would provide a revitalizing program for youth and residents in West Coconut Grove.
properties.title: Horticulture, Healthy Snacks Concession & Job Training Program
properties.details: Participate in community involvement, strengthen community partnerships and develop a sustainable garden program that will not only revitalize underused areas in the West Coconut Grove, but also provide valuable skills and education to residents within the community. Residents will have access to fresh produce, participate in hands-on educational and culinary workshops and have the opportunity to learn vocational training skills. Job placement at the Virrick Park concession stand will be available for those participants that graduate from the vocational training program, and local restaurants have been recruited to place graduates in jobs within the 33133 zip code.

properties.description: The Education Fund’s Edible School Garden program is a groundbreaking, student-centered, seed-to-table interdisciplinary approach to educating our children. Using edible gardens as “hands-on outdoor laboratories,” students not only learn to make healthy food choices to last a lifetime, but also become stewards of the earth and ambassadors in the movement to “green” our world. They appreciate their place in nourishing our environment while also acquiring a taste for healthier lifestyles. What began as a five school pilot, the program is now in 50 elementary schools, providing a green oasis in some of the most underserved communities in Miami-Dade County of which most are considered to be “food deserts.”
properties.title: Garden of Feedin'
properties.details: For most students, their Edible School Garden is their first connection with nature. Their pride in watching their plants grow motivates them to learn about their creations. Students become active participants in a learning experience that could never be gleaned from a textbook or the Internet. As caretakers of the gardens, students establish a knowledge and consciousness of the environment and its interconnection with living things, not the least of which is their role as caretaker to our planet and the resources that sustain it. Equally as important, students learn about nutrition and develop healthy eating habits to combat the debilitating effects of diabetes, obesity and other diet related illnesses, resulting in a healthier community.

comments.comment: i love the idea of teaching kids about eating healthy and using the garden as a school classroom.

properties.description: Open a gym, think LA Fitness, specifically for  young adults diagnosed with being on the Autism Spectrum. Regular fitness training leads directly improving  self confidence that ultimately would lead to a self sufficient and gainfully employed individual.  I would hire speech and OT therapist students as trainers for these kids. Incorporate music, active sports such as basketball , golf simulator all with goal of improving hand eye coordination. My son like others is has his challenges, but spends the bulk of his time either at school or bored in his room watching video games.These kids cannot attend a normal gym as it is too overwhelming for them and would cause too much disruption in a regular gym setting. Our kids need the same opportunity as the rest of us. The benefit is improved thinking, better school participation and a much better adjusted person, that is better prepared for life. properties.description: Only 20 percent of a child's time is spent in a classroom and what happens during the remaining 80 percent will have a significant impact on the rest of their lives. I agree. I also think this area is larger than the current proposed area in Port of Miami.

This is an excellent idea. This same site - adjacent to both Metrorail and the MetroMover - was expanded by former owner Glenn Straub to meet baseball park size requirements and offered for FREE to the City and County for the Marlins Ballpark. For inexplicable reasons that have never been revealed, this offer was declined and the ballpark was condemned to failure at the former Orange Bowl site. Putting the soccer stadium here would salvage something from that exercise. If the site is too small, perhaps it could be combined with the City of Miami's property directly to the east between 7th and 8th streets

properties.description: Use public spaces for musicians to play and put out their hat.  Include students  forms schools so they can earn money for expenses.
properties.title: Bring in the buskers
properties.details: As above

properties.description: We need to find a public space that has bay access and is a good location to catch fish. We would need a pop up location where people can use fishing rods and tackle. They can pay a small fee to buy bait. The goal is to take your children fishing. There is nothing better than seeing a child catch a fish. We just need to make it more accessible and more cost effective.  We can teach conservation at the same time.
properties.title: Take your kid fishing
properties.details: Spend time with children to teach them to fish and to teach them about the environment.

properties.description: Create a local driving range, where parents can teach their children to drive.  This area has been vacant for a number of years.  The streets a.re already paved.  It should be minimum cost to clear land and install road signs conducive for teaching persons to drive.
properties.title: Teach Me to Drive
properties.details: Since drivers education has been removed from the public school system, This would give a controlled environment for parents to take their kids to learn to drive and provide a realistic controlled environment  of real life driving skills.

properties.description:
Like NYC has done at Times Sq, Union Sq and other traffic congested streets, block/close lanes to traffic with pots of plants and flowers. My recommendation is to close the east side, north bound side of Ocean Drive. This will reduce noise, reduce congestion and improve the user experience for tourists & locals alike. 

Why the east side vs west?  For a few reasons: first & more importantly, so the restaurants don't "steal" the new space and fill with tables like they've done on Lincoln Rd and on Ocean Dr during festivals. That would not achieve my stated goal.  And second, so those arriving for drop off have safer access to hotels, restaurants & retail.
properties.title: Ocean Dr safety, traffic, user experience improvements
properties.details: Tourists and locals alike could feel safer in crossing to the park and gain more space to enjoy the park without the commercial aspects (restaurants, retail) consuming the new space.

properties.description: Donated bicycles and instructors in the park to teach children and adults how to ride a bike. This would be great for those who cannot afford to buy bikes or have had them stolen.  Getting people out into the fresh air, having fun, exercising and meeting others is a wonderful experience.  In addition, have an area where the Human Society brings dogs out of the shelter where children and adults can walk, talk, feed and groom their no charge rent a dog.  Animals bring out the best in people getting them in touch with life is really great especially for the abused, lonely and elderly.  It also gets the dogs out and about raising their spirits too.
properties.title: Lean To Ride And Walk A Dog
properties.details: Get away from hum drum lives, teach the children to communicate with others non-electronically and just be outside having fun in the sun.

properties.description: In a park(s) schedule sessions for children and adults to sharpen their  reading skills or to learn to read.  Teachers and/or upcoming teachers donate their time and earn credits.  The Human Society can loan out dogs that the readers can read to, some dogs may even get adopted.  Covered structures will need to be built for inclement weather as well as areas  out in the open.  The reading to dogs program has proven to be successful in Libraries.   The first item on the agenda is to teach how to pronounce Library, it is NOT Liberry.
properties.title: Outdoor School For Reading Skills
properties.details: Improve their education which will benefit them and Miami as well.  The more you know the further you can get in life, the future will be brighter and better which makes happier, healthier people.

comments.comment: Great idea.  We need to use the outdoors more

properties.description: This place needs it all. There's nothing.  A park in the south just like tropical park so that the largest community has access to green space before they built more house.
properties.title: A Tropical Park in West kendall!
properties.details: The community can exercise, parents can place children in sports, high schools can have access to a stadium for sports. As well as reducing the immense population of people in West kendall with some green space.

properties.description: The creation of elevated passways for pedestrian  with a precast system  involving minnimum construction to avoid  traffic jams.
properties.title: Downtown elevated crosswalks and escalators ( Las Vegas strip type)
properties.details: Get across intersections like Byscaine Boulevard to mayor events and attractions in a safer way and at the same time  improving traffic  .

properties.description: This is an old rail road line, tracks removed, that would serve as a great bike and pedestrian path. It stretches from Coral Way South, and connects to the South Dade busway
properties.title: Miami Rails to Trails
properties.details: Increase their use of outdoor space

properties.description: A digital photo tour map of Miami's most scenic spots to take a picture.  Regular Signs should be put up at the spots and Maps online could pinpoint them.  Digital cameras should be pre-mounted at these key locations to capture a picture or short video when people stand there and pay $1 to have the photo taken automatically with benefits going to the city.  There are so many landmarks that people take pictures at and the bay/intercoastal is an amazing photo pop from so many angles.  It encourages locals and tourists to check out Miami.
properties.title: SeeMe Miami
properties.details: text/email/call a posted number on the sign and the camera would snap a photo or short video of them at the location and they can download it for $1... or upload to a Miami City Facebook/Twitter/Instagram showing people throughout the city having fun.

properties.description: Its a corner that should stay accessible by foot only making it a great area to stop and get a gym style workout while making it look good to passerby's.
properties.title: "Westchester Workout"
properties.details: This will promote walking in the neighborhood.

comments.comment: Thank you GREAT PARK SUMMIT 2014

properties.description: Plant some trees and build some mountain bike and hiking trails.  These garbage hills are perfect for Mountain Bike/ Hiking trails.  A Mountain bike/Hiking park would be a great way to hide the ugly land fill and it would also be good for the environment.  You could build miles of trails going up and down the hills.  Great fun and great exercise.   There are no real hiking trails or biking trails anywhere near this area.  The hills elevation should also offer some nice views.   It just seems like a perfect way to hide our garbage dump and do some good for the environment and our community.
properties.title: Mountain Bike and Hike Park
properties.details: Hike and bike on trails that go up and down hills.  Going up the hills is always a work out, and riding down the hill is always fun and challenging.  Planting trees is good for the environment.  Parks are good for people and pets.    It just seems like the right thing to do here.

comments.comment:
The County needs pressure from the public to move on its plans to reuse the landfill. The idea has been in the works for many years. Lets organize!
http://www.epa.gov/region4/superfund/images/allresourcemedia/pdfs/reusenw58stlffl.pdf
Great idea!

properties.description: The plan would be to utilize the indoor space and design it so that individuals can join and learn various hapkido techniques.
properties.title: Hapkido Martial Arts Fitness Center
properties.details: Individuals from ages 12 and above can take classes there. The classes would introduce the techniques and forms of the hapkido art and the first aim would be to teach self-defense techniques to women. The other aim would be to incorporate an anti-bullying message along with a curriculum so that kids in middle and high school can learn about physical and mental self-discipline and self-empowerment. So that they exude confidence and are able to diffuse potentially violent encounters by not appearing vulnerable and not advocating violence. As for older adults, the classes would introduce breathing techniques, flexibility challenges along with mental and spiritual empowerment.

properties.description:
would be to provide weather and tamper proof internet-ready devices next to or near public schools with significant representation of low income students; located in a well lit, easily accessible area.
The internet station is not a traditional computer, but would be more like a netbook, cost-effective but extremely internet capable. While the computer itself would be inexpensive, and internet access very reasonable priced, acquiring or producing a exterior encasing and the devices the public would touch would require the most resources.
The schools to be included could be chosen by the school board, but if I could only start with one it would be Paul Laurence Dunbar Elementary School.
properties.title: Everyone Informed: to demonstrate knowledge is power, especially for the community.
properties.details:
As knowledge is power, those least likely to access information due to accessibility interests are most disenfranchised by the status quo. Ignorance begets other issues which plague communities including lack of healthy social cohesion and resource-limited creativity.
These internet stations are next to schools to give child-students the easiest physical access, but they can be used by their parents, neighbors, and the community in general. These can serve as fantastic study stops for group projects, or a good research spot for a community project!

properties.description:
In most developed countries, access to fresh organic produce (and meats) is a few blocks away. Micro markets and corner shops serve the public in multiple locations as a common component of daily life.
In Miami, farmers markets are expensive, limited, and geo-socio-economically isolated. If anything, they are a luxury afforded to those with time and money.

This needs to change

The solution - THE CO-OP GROW-OP 

Democratically operated, a true cooperative which pools local farms, markets, and businesses to help spread sustainable, fair-trade, organic and ethical products throughout Miami. The Co-op will provide affordability and access to pop up markets, job opportunities, agricultural education, and great food to all
properties.title: The Co-op Gro-op
properties.details:
Actively participate in instilling a sense of community pride while bettering the health of our environment and public. 

Individual members buy a stake in the coop via small Fee (15 - 50 $) and help sustain its assets via monthly work requirements. 


- Store Shifts

- Field Production

- Meeting attendance

- Administrative tasks

- Supply chain management 

In return they are given an extremely reduced price for Co-op products, while still driving the over all price down for the public. 

Micro Markets and fresh goods will proliferate

Agricultural seminars and job opportunities will open

Local Business and Farms will grow

Urban garden will rise

The way we consume will change for ever.

comments.comment: Great idea we need more access to fresh foods and this sounds like something that could greatly benefit healthy and ecologically friendly lifestyles in Miami.

properties.description: Our modular PARKLET is designed to mix-and-match module pieces to create an outdoor oasis in place of cars.
properties.title: PARKLET
properties.details: ...find a space to watch the day go by while thinking of what to do next.

properties.description: The BLANK BOX is an urban intervention which will transform a vacant lot by activating its use specific to the following areas: Education/Technology, Health/Wellness, Art/Studio, Retail/Food + Drink or Farmstand/Agriculture. These mass-customized, pre-manufactured and locally sourced buildings deploy on the site of a vacant lot and allow for community engagement to occur. The idea for the BLANK BOX (think pop-up shop) programmed with a specific social need (healthy food, education, computer skills) specific to the demographics of a neighborhood that helps foster the public safety and awareness on a vacant site through its use and activation of it.
properties.title: BLANK BOX
properties.details: ...meet unmet urban social needs. It also allows for participation from outside entities. The education box can partner with a university to have classes, the Tech. Center can have online university's offer discounted classes to pursue degrees. The Farmstand can offer fresh local vegetables and also utilize planters on site to grow their own. Museums can stream their collections on video monitors while art classes for children can take place. Local citizens can also be employed as caretakers, while area start-ups can coexist and use these outposts for good. This concept will aim to meet the social needs at a variety of different levels with the slightest impact igniting change.

properties.description:
If all Miamians could agree on one thing, it's this: traffic is bad. Really bad. And there is no over-night fix for this massive issue of congestion. And while public transit, such as our lovely metro-mover, are free and convenient to use, hitting many major destinations in Downtown, people either don't know about it, or they choose not to use it. 
There needs to be an aesthetic at the metro mover stations: murals, paintings, frescos, sculptures, mosaics or art installations to create a better place more capable of attracting tourists and residents.
properties.title: Move Me!: Art at the Metro Mover
properties.details: The great thing about art is that it's creative, enticing, and vibrant. This is what the dull and austere metro mover stations need. Not only does it create an appealing environment, but it creates a conversation. Art has an amazing ability to connect people and create a dialogue. A greater sense of community could be achieved through the work of local artists while simultaneously deflating traffic congestion.

properties.description: Make it a pedestrian blvd, similar to Lincoln Rd, along Miracle Mile and Coral Way. Starting from Le Jeune Rd, crossing 37th, 32nd until 27th ave. with middle gardens, coral tiles, restaurants, upscale stores.

cool!

At the same time the chefs and apsiring entreprenuers would all need to be based in the South Florida area. We would create partnerships with FIU and Miami Dade where students can volunteer and fulfill their internships as well.

comments.comment: fantastic Idea!
Love this idea!! Great way to promote local talent!

properties.description: Salsa dance is a very popular social activity that's fun and active - it's one that can help you maintain a healthy cardiovascular system, while tearing up the floor to some serious salsa beats.
properties.title:
Salsa Dancing to Spice up your Community and Keep Fit

Salsa Dancing - Spice it Up and Stay Fit
properties.details:
The music and atmosphere will draw people from their homes to gather in the style of "old fashioned" neighborhood block parties.  The space we envision as being the center of the "salsa dance party" is an empty lot on Coral Way and 12th, near Downtown Miami.  
The event will be visible to those accessing Coral Way, a major traffic thoroughfare, via car and could potentially draw these people to join in, and dance and mingle the night away.

properties.description: Freedom Tower Mapping Proyection. The Mapping Projection Software that allowed the editing and projection of a movie and special effects utilizing a building as a movie screen in a 3D environment also known as spatial augmented reality

comments.comment: This is absolutely amazing

properties.description:
How often do you look up and get inspired? Are there many landmarks in Miami that you wish to take a picture of? I suppose we take or paradise weather conditions for granted and regular landscaping serves the purpose...
Imaging now Green Real Plant Vertical Gardens and Living Walls inspiring us indoor and outdoor... as you enter the Miami International Airport Lobby, take a walk on the Lincoln Road or pass by the new Tunnel.
properties.title: Miami Vertical Gardens - Walls to Inspire
properties.details:
When the city has too many concrete walls and few green oasises You wonder why don't we change dimensions and grow vertical.  There could not be a better place than tropical Miami to implement this Vision, a Vision for the Paradise City, where the Walls are built to Inspire!

At Miami Vertical Garden Inc. I dream to make it happen.

comments.comment: This is a win-win for everyone.  It is beautiful, it is artistic, it is environmentally helpful and makes people happy!!!  Just beautiful!!   Expertly designed and planned.
I like this idea. I would really like it if you used native local plants to show off our natural beauty.
Awesome idea !!I would love to see more and more vertical gardens growing in MIami.The way to connect with the nature at the most unexpected places .
I like this approach  to beautification. I have seen the work that can be done and not a lot of maintenance is required. Genius !!! And so beautiful ...

properties.description:
Miami Beach will not survive the pending rise in sea level.

We should start a program to convert the streets into a canal/waterways similar to Amsterdam or Venice.

We use the earth removed to raise the adjoining properties ground level above the flood level
properties.title: Accommodate the Rising Sea
properties.details: Continue to remain the great city we have.

comments.comment: Very good Idea. I agree 100% on you with this. The only question what to do for hurricanes? Amsterdam doesn't get those.

properties.submitter_name: Steve Hagen, Miami Green Park Advocate
properties.infolink: http://petitions.moveon.org/sign/more-parks-for-miami    or email StevenMIA@aol,comm for the remainder of letter above.
properties.description:
Open Plea to all who want more parks in City of Miami.
Space allows only first  paragraph of letter to the Herald.

For entire  letter,   email StevenMIA@aol.com
or go to 
http://petitions.moveon.org/sign/more-parks-for-miami
 
"A quest to find Miami's Better Pubic Spaces" March 2, 2014 by Andres Viglucci outlines the second annual effort by The Miami Foundation, the Health Foundation of South Florida and the Herald to put $130,000 to work in not just creating better public spaces, but bringing people together to build community.  We need both.  
 
These organizations understand that any city can not become or remain great if its residents are not engaged in their government, which can begin by taking ownership and pride in
properties.title:
Get Media, Foundations, Neighborhood & Environmental 
groups to Lobby Miami City Hall for More Park
properties.details:
in various spaces.   
 
In my view, these Foundations are in a small way, attempting to do what Miami City leaders have not adequately done.  We are stuck at about 40 condo/neighborhood organizations serving a population of about 415,000.  Contrast that to Tampa which boasts 88 neighborhood organizations with 70,000 fewer residents.  Tampa's  Mayor runs a Neighborhood University to grow neighborhood leaders.  
 
As far as resident participation, Miami conducts reviews of the Neighborhood Comprehensive Plan every seven years as required by Florida law ....no more space

comments.comment: I'm with you.

Miami residents and organizations need to come out of their closets and lobby Mayor Regalado and Commissioners or we will never get more parks in Miami.    Developers need to pay their fair share of Impact Fees for More Parks.   Sign the petition.   This effort needs key community leaders!!!    It is sinful that Miami has added 50,000 new residents but have added only 6 acres of parks in the last decade.

properties.description:
Urban Farming

Community Food Projects are intended to bring together stakeholders from the distinct parts of the food system and to foster understanding of food security trends and how they might improve local food systems.   Local distribution of locally grown nutritious produce can be consumed by persons that do not have regular access to fresh vegetable and fruit since they  often have limited  choices on where to shop, e.g. convenient stores.   In addition low income people would develop marketing skill so that surplus products could be sold locally within the community including restaurants.   This would eliminate so called food deserts in the community.
properties.title: Food Security: Urban Farming

properties.description: There is a piece of land behind the AA Arena that spends its time either sitting empty or used as excess parking while thousands of residents live nearby without quick access to public space.  This lack of grass in this area of downtown has led to a pretty gross situation for area residents and pet-owners alike.  I think this space would make a wonderful dog park, offering an area for local pet owners to exercise their dogs and enjoy the outdoors rather than walking them to one tiny patch by the BP.  I know Museam Park is slated to open soon but there is no word on whether there will be a dog park there.  The closest "official" dog park is either in the Grove or Beach, leaving nothing for downtown's pooches.
properties.title: Free up underutilized waterfront public space
properties.details:
This will allow people to enjoy a wonderful waterfront space where dolphins are often swimming and allow area dogs (of which there are alot) with a place to burn some energy off.  It would also likely make the area more sanitary as the lack of grass has let to some unpleasant conditions.

Adding a semi-permanent healthy food truck/coffee truck at the park would give commuters a great place to grab some morning breakfast or pick up dinner on the way home and enjoy the space too.

comments.comment: Margaret Pace park  at  NE 17th  and Bayshore Drive has a huge dog park. - not fenced though.

properties.description: A NEW SPACE INSIDE THE MUSEUM TO SHOW EMERGING ARTISTS.
properties.title: THE GALLERY AT THE MUSEUM OF THE AMERICAS
properties.details: A NEW PLACE TO GIVE GREAT OPPORTUNITIES TO LOCAL AND INTERNATIONAL ARTISTS.

comments.comment: Perhaps an annual exhibit of art works with a limited subject of "MIAMI" could be tried to motivate the participating artists to actually visit the area.  I am sure the Greater Miami Chamber of Commerce and other similar organizations  would like that and cooperate.

properties.description: Stop using the area behind the lake as a dump. Clear all the garbage and make a walking trail through the trees, add a few benches and it becomes a beautiful place for reading and birding.
properties.title: Convert Miami-Dade Parks property currently used as maintenance dump to a passive nature walk park.
properties.details:
It will make Miami-Dade County, owner of the property make use of it for what it is supposed to be, a PARK for the public, not a maintenance dump!
It would encourage people to spend more time outdoors in a very quiet and peaceful park, situated in a very densely populated area of Miami-Dade.

properties.description: Let the people of greater Miami know this taxpayer funded monument exists and it is theirs to enjoy.
properties.title: Hidden Monument
properties.details: Sit under the sun and appreciate it.

properties.description: Let the people of greater Miami know this taxpayer funded monument exists and it is theirs to enjoy.
properties.title: Another taxpayer funded Cuban Monument
properties.details: Sit under the sun and appreciate it.

comments.comment: Hi there, which monument are you referencing - can you provide a picture? Thanks!

properties.description: The Southern end of the county has virtually no beaches.  We need more beachfront area down south.  To that end, I propose the development of a beach park near Black Point Marina.  Sand from the ocean floor could be dredged and placed in an area where there are no protected wetlands.  Then a parking area needs to be erected.  Perhaps a community pool could be installed.  This will provide more jobs for people looking to work for the county.  An entry fee could be charged so as to offset the cost of the park.  I'm thinking of an area similar to Matheson Hammock - but further South.  Maybe a water park (if it's not too cost-prohibitive) can be added in the distant future, too!
properties.title: More Beaches in the South!
properties.details: Well, there just aren't any nice beachy parks in the Southern end of the county right now.  If a person lives in Cutler Bay, he must drive to Matheson Hammock (some 11 miles away) to go to the beach.  The other prospect is to drive to the Keys - Key Largo is about 1 hour away.  If we had our own little beach here in town, it would provide recreation for us here in Cutler Bay (and we won't need to go to Miami Beach and add to the crowds there).  This will also provide for more community involvement and perhaps even more jobs for residents in this area of the county.  I really hope this gets the funding to see the idea through to fruition.

properties.description: Over the last few years, Miami has been up and coming on the art scene.  In fact, many artists seem to be moving to and living in Miami.  What if we could harness that energy and provide local artists a place to freely display their art.  I propose that area be Ocean Drive.  The idea would be rooted in being able to permanently close off Ocean Drive from vehicular traffic and transform it into a public walkway.  With strict guidelines on how people can display their art, artists could set up a display area for themselves and promote the local art scene to both locals and tourists.  This would allow pedestrians to not be restricted to the narrow sidewalks on both sides of Ocean Drive.  It would allow for a permanent public space as well.
properties.title: Project Art South Beach
properties.details: The idea of closing Ocean Drive to vehicular traffic permanently in itself would provide a great public walkway.  You have an area rich in Architecture, Restaurants, and Hotels.  It would create such a grand open area for conversation with the background of having the artists display their work.  It would be modeled in a similar fashion to Union Square in NYC when they have the open fresh farmer's markets on weekends and have artists display their works.

properties.description:
Hydroponics is a method of growing plants without soil.  It's the fasted growing sector of agriculture, and it could very well dominate the food production in the future.

By building hydroponic community gardens we could bring a fresh perspective to those who have limited access to fresh fruits, herbs, and vegetables.  

facts: 
- Some hydroponic crops use 90% less water that the same crop in traditional soil farming.
- We can plant 4 times the amount of crops in the same as traditional soil farming.
- Some crops grow twice as fast.
- Hydroponically grown crops can use NO herbicide or pesticide chemicals which significantly impact the environment and our bodies.
properties.title: Hydroponic Community Gardens
properties.details:
These gardens could provide food for individuals in need, build community connections, and educate our next generation about hydroponic gardening, the importance of healthy food and where its food comes from. 

These gardens can be at schools, hospitals, recovery centers, churches, parks, roof tops, or even vacant lots.

comments.comment: I fully support the development of Hydroponics Community Gardens. This sounds like an excellent idea.

properties.description: I stay in the Miami Gardens are and everyday I see a new girl walking around with a baby bump or a stroller or even both. this generation is going to increase the baby boom population. after having a child at a young age girls give up on their dreams. I want to show them that even teen moms can succeed in life and kill the stereotype around teen moms. so my idea is to get young girls and show them some successful women that were teen moms and let them see that dreams do come true.
properties.title: Girl Power
properties.details: see teen moms in a better way and stop judging them.

properties.description: This idea does not cost a lot of money since it only needs walls and space for kids to be creative, learn, experience and have fun. It would both make the area more beautiful and interesting for children, their parents, possibly even tourists, and teach the children of Miami about the many diverse backgrounds and nationalities of the residents of Miami.
properties.title: Miami's International Diverse Backgrounds -Children's Community Creative Corner
properties.details: Learn about each other's different backgrounds and experiences, introduce kids to the diversity of their communiry, spread acceptance of different people in the diverse, international Miami community and teach us all to become accustomed to one another's culture and customs. Children would be able to learn about different nationalities that make up Miami and become more open to differences, learning to take advantage of them and expand their knowledge, and interests about the countries and cultures of the world.

properties.description: Utilize modern CPTED (Crime Prevention Through Environmental Design) principles to create areas that feel safer and have less fear of criminal activity.  Especially relevant techniques and principles are: natural surveillance (and eyes on the street), management, ownership and maintenance (Broken Windows Theory).  An area that has clear visibility, daylight-mimicking illumination, unobstructed lines of sight, an increased number of users and viewers. Here, we can ask the ultimate CPTED question: How do we make this place better?  The answers are found in ownership, maintenance, upkeep, lighting, increased users, and other crime prevention techniques that could be considered here and acted upon if deemed appropriate.
properties.title: CPTED Central
properties.details: Travel safely along the M-PATH.

properties.description: I would like to start a Glamping Campaign for Miami Dade County to get more residents and tourists  interested in camping outdoors.  Glamping or "glorious camping" could be brought to any county, state, and federal park.
properties.title: Glamping in Miami
properties.details: Vacationing in Miami does not have to be at a swank South Beach or Brickell hotel.  Glamping is not about expense but all about creativity.  The concept provides all the creature comforts of home in the midst of the great outdoors. It's a great fit for couples, friends, families and especially kids who get a healthy dose of nature and adventure,

properties.description:
The Arts, be it visual – painting, films, music – classical, pop, musical productions or spoken and written word – poetry, novels – have positively affected society through creative intervention and articulation on social issues.  The Arts reflect society and make statements that have brought about social change.  This is what we seek to do by producing a feature film, Hard Knocks, in Miami, Florida.  

Hard Knocks Foundation is a not-for-profit group that assists at risk youth and teaches them good citizenship through participation in Sports and exposure to the Arts.  We are Co-Producers on a Feature Film, Hard Knocks, which focuses attention on the negative effects of privatizing our Juvenile and Adult System on sentencing kids in Miami
properties.title: Hard Knock Film Project. This Film project will be produce in Miami Florida. The film will help kids
properties.details:
Hard Knocks and Adult System on sentencing and on the decision to try youth as adults.  It is a family film and we anticipate will be rated PG-13.

The film has a budget of $936,254, $626,932 of which will be spent in Florida.  The film will hire 671 Floridians in crew, cast and extra positions.  Many of the 100’s of extras will be residents of the Coconut Grove Community.  Vendors will receive approximately $250,000

comments.comment: we are working hard to bring this project to Miami Florida.

properties.description: This site, along with the adjacent properties have remained vacant for as long as I can remember and I always see people fishing in the canal and playing on the property. In an effort to beautify this region and utilize the space, I imagine a site with a path for people to walk and bike, a playground for children to play and a variety of plants, trees, and murals to beautify the property. Although it is a large idea, it could be accomplished affordably with the cooperation and support of the local schools and community. (Primarily in the form of volunteer work). In addition to this site, the park could continue to perpetually grow and use the land which continues to run North.
properties.title: Briar Bay Linear Park
properties.details:
People who live in this community and surrounding communities could visit the park, use its facilities and this park will provide an opportunity families and friends to exercise and play together. 

Additional facilities could be added as time progresses such as volleyball, basketball, and tennis courts. 

Organizations such as the Falls and YMCA could partner with the park, host events in the park, and contribute to its development.

properties.description: We are seeking to open a nonprofit restaurant in the area.  ("A what?!") We will partner with great local organizations to hire those who desperately need a "hand up" -- such as wounded warriors and homeless mothers.  We will teach them the hospitality industry and ready them for success. Some might say we teach them "to fish"!  All profits are donated to area charities that feed the hungry.
properties.title: 2Fish Nonprofit Restaurant - Where we teach a man "to fish"
properties.details: Patrons will bring their families for a meal that's good for the body AND good for the soul.  A gathering place that the city and it's citizens can truly feel nourished by.
