properties.description: Build a poetry and scholars village on-site to provide free homework help, creative writing, tutoring and poetry workshops to kids and neighbors.
properties.title: Poetry in the Park
properties.details: get out of traffic, get homework help for their kids, inspire a love of reading and writing, as well as feel the inspiration of the written word.

properties.description: How about we build metro movers ALL OVER the city so if you don't have a car or cant drive for what ever reason you're not hopeless.
properties.title: MORE METRO MOVERS!
properties.details: so people don't NEED to have a car to live in Miami.

properties.description:
...GROW fruit trees  ONLY from now on...... we spend too much money planting 'pretty trees'  for landscaping. if every tree put out by the city of Miami was a fruiting tree, a lot less people would go hungry.
*ORGANIC IS THE ONLY WAY TO GO*
properties.title: PLANT EDIBLE TREES!
properties.details: ...eat locally grown food. This will maximize nutrients, save money and energy on food transportation, and will lower costs of anyone struggling to buy healthy food.

comments.comment: every tree might be much - there will be many never picked, fruit will fall on pavement and rot... but a great idea for selected places, in parks and more pedestrian friendly areas.

properties.description:
A covered area off the side walk where  a lot of pedestrians walk by. (maybe the field where the farmers market is on Saturdays) I imagine a spot where people could drop off or pick up any gently used things. like clothes, shoes, books, and baby stuff. 
(Like a free goodwill)

OR* the items could be specific, like a book spot. A simple bookshelf where one could drop off a book, and pick one up. Education is the key toward independence.
(But the spot has to be covered to protect from rain)
properties.title: Swap Point
properties.details: There are a lot of low-income people in the neighborhood and a lot of need for community support here. Maybe a homeless person could find a blanket here for a cold night.

comments.comment:
a permanent place will probably become a spot full of trash, but what about a weekly/by-weekly meetups on Sundays to swap your things. 
I would love that!
great idea!

properties.description: Empty lots are everywhere. They look like hell and depress  property values and the tax base. BUT, this fenced land could be repurposed  for multiple things: dog parks, mini kid parks, urban farms, etc.  I'm interested in a dog park. The 2 most expensive components are already there: the land and the fence.  Right now, the property owner pays taxes and pays to mow the weeds.  He/she could be approached to allow the property to be used for something now until they can find a long term use (like adding a building).  Either the minimal costs could be funded by government/charitable groups or preferably, set up as a private entity. Is it worth $10-20 bucks a month to have a place in short walking distance to let your dog run with other dogs?
properties.title: Repurpose existing infrastructure on empty lot for a dog park (+ food forest?) .
properties.details:
Make it easier for people to exercise their dogs in urban areas: something within walking distance so it can be done every day. Why should these amenities be limited to South Beach? If it's easy, one will do it every day. If one has to load the dog(s) into a car and drive 10-15 minutes to a dog park, it won't happen too often.  

I'm posting this as a way to hash out the idea, but I'm serious about making it happen. My neighborhood may not be the right one, but I have no doubt it could create tremendous value both for the dog owners and the neighbors.  If the property owner will allow it, you can plant trees around the perimeter of the property for shade and those might as well be fruit trees (thus a food forest).

comments.submitter_name: Steve Hagen, Miami Green Park Advocate  StevenMIA@aol.com
comments.comment:
This effort is possible IF the City of Miami raises Impact Fee for Parks that developers are to pay.   We need to lobby Mayor Regalado and Commissioners.   Sign the petition
http://petitions.moveon.org/sign/more-parks-for-miami

properties.description: Set up recycling bins near major pedestrian walkways in busy South Beach.
properties.title: Recycling on South Beach
properties.details: More easily recycle their bottles and aluminum benefiting the environment.

comments.comment: They already have this... :-/

properties.description: is to add light posts along the walk/run path in Roberta Hunter Park.
properties.title: Step 'Light'-ly
properties.details: enjoy the park while ensuring safety. When visiting Roberta Hunter Park you see everyone from all ages doing all forms of exercise. The park comes equipped with individual workout stations along the path. Many families use the park as a way to stay fit and keep their children active so there is a lot of activity during the week. The only deterrent is visibility in the early evening hours. Safety is a major issue when visiting any park. What would make this park safer is to have light posts along the path. People in the surrounding neighborhoods will be more inclined to visit the park with this added measure of safety.

comments.comment: It is expensive install light poles. Solar light poles are easier to place as you can do them without wiring but event then they're pricey. I do agree light for safety is a important element for any community. Besides lighting what about cameras? Something to consider.

properties.description: Every religious group has a meeting place. People go there on a regular basis to gather, pray, socialize and study. Some have great programming for young people, too! My idea is to form a partnership with a company that historically gives back, such as Home Depot. They could be asked to provide low cost tools and seeds or plants for the middle and high school students to plant gardens in place at the churches, mosques, temples and other religious locations. Volunteers could help teach the older kids the science of planting and gardening. All young people need community service hours; this could be a fun, practical way for a positive experience and involvement in giving back to the community while learning a skill that will last a lifetime!
properties.title: Helping our kids get even more involved in a GREEN way!
properties.details: Get our young people involved and help them benefit their community while learning skills that last a lifetime! The actual cost could be minimal; schools or the religious organizations could run an art contest to come up with posters for publicity, with a US Savings bond as a prize that could be used towards the winner's education! It's a win-win!

comments.comment: Your idea is a good one, but don't forget about the larger component: those gardens need to be watered, weeded and occasionally trimmed on a consistent basis and that's hard to get done even with the large volunteer network.  Even if they say planted fruit trees in poor neighborhoods, those trees need to be watered every other day consistently for as long as a year or they die.  The consistent volunteers will be the toughest part.

properties.description: is to provide solar lighting alongside Bayshore Drive to assist early morning and evening runners.
properties.title: Runner's deLIGHT
properties.details: feel safe and be encouraged to run regardless of the time of day. Solar street lights offers a green solution!

comments.comment: I actually was thinking about this myself but more for poor neighborhoods suffering from crime rates. I used to work for FPL and as a former phone rep number one concern for people when street lights out is the security. I support any LED street light and if it's solar heck why not. Question though: Who maintains it? Who does the planning and installation? Even if the icy accepts it can they be in trouble with the Power company? Just things to consider I guess before moving. I'd like to know more about this: erikmaguina@bellsouth.net Keep me posted.

properties.title: Floating Cinema
properties.details: Enjoy the water, the weather and film all at the same time.

comments.comment: I have to agree with George about Marine Stadium!
Natural match for Marine Stadium, which already has seats and roof.
Let's do thisssss

Take a water taxi to a floating water cinema? This would make a great 'date night' or a wonderful family outing with the kids. Love it!

properties.description: Create a pedestrian railway crossing here.  Make a passage through the 15 block long chain link fence, add safety lights, train warning signs, and a walkway.
properties.title: Neighborhood Railroad Crossing
properties.details: This would allow residents from the neighborhoods to the west access to the businesses and schools on Biscayne Blvd.  Currently, people have to go many blocks to the north or south or end up squeezing through a chain link fence and crossing the tracks with no safety measures.
